loans.name: Tak

texts.en:
Tak P., age 51, lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been selling groceries in front of her home and is able to earn up to US$1 of profit per day. Her husband, Hing Sim, age 45, is a local construction worker who has built houses since 1993.  He is able to earn around US$4 per day.  Mrs. Tak P. used to be a housewife but her husband’s income was not enough to support the family, so she started selling groceries to help with the family's expenses. Together, the couple has three children, two of whom are employed and the other one is too young to work.
Mrs. Tak P. is seeking a loan of US$500 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to add to her inventory of groceries, as she has many customers now.

loans.use: To add inventory to her grocery business, as she has a growing number of customers.

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Miss Sunday N. (25) is single and lives with her parents along national road number one, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has one brother who is a construction worker. Her parents are old and stay at home.

Miss Sunday is in the business of selling Chinese noodles. She has been in this business for eight years. She sells the noodles in a small shop along the road in Korky market. Sunday works very hard to support her family because her parents are old and they can't work. She needs one motorcycle to carry her goods and materials for her business but lacks the money to do this. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a second-hand motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle to use in the family.

loans.name: El

texts.en:
El T., age 37, is married and lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has sold beef to earn a living and is able to earn up to US$3 of profit per day. Her husband, Hel Ly, age 36, is a local butcher who provides meat for her to sell. Mrs. T. told a loan officer that prior to selling beef she was a vendor selling vegetables and her husband was a construction worker who built houses.  However, both had to change professions due to problems.  She told a loan officer that every month she needs to pay for food that costs around US$35 and utilities that cost about US$5. Together, this couple has three children, two of whom are employed and one is too young to work.

Mrs. El T. is seeking a loan of US$1,000 to purchase cow for her husband to kill for meat.
(Mrs. El is pictured with her husband and her son.)

loans.use: Mrs. El Tap is seeking a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a cow for her husband to butcher for meat.

loans.name: Bora

texts.en:
Mr. Bora K. and his wife, Mrs. Sarath Nao, who live in a small village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1986 and have five children; one son and four daughters. All of them study in a local school.

Mr. Bora and his wife have been in the business of selling fish and fishing for fifteen years. To add to the fish they catch themselves, they buy other fish from Prek Phnao market at Pon Nhea Loeu district for resale at a market in Phnom Penh.

Bora is requesting a loan of US$1200 to purchase one boat, fishing nets, and more fish for resale.

loans.use: To buy one boat, fishing nets, and buy more fishes for resale.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Say S., age 28, is married and lives with her husband in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2006, she has been selling a variety of groceries to earn a living and is able to earn up to US$5 of profit per day. Her husband, age 30, has a business running a motor-taxi to help support his family and is able to earn up to US$3 of profit each day. Both of them were farmers before starting these businesses, but had to change their work because of bad weather conditions. In their village, there is no irrigation system so their family and other villagers depend on the weather to farm.  They are all very happy when there are dark clouds, but if there is no rain their crops or rice are damaged. Every month, this couple needs to pay around US$75 for food, US$10 for utilities, and US$50 for their children's education.

Mrs. Say S. is seeking a loan of US$600 to add to her grocery inventory to meet her customers' demands. (Mrs. S.'s mother is pictured because Mrs. Say S. and her husband were not available.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To add inventory to her grocery business in order to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Mrs. Koem Thoen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank which consists of niN. people is located in Phlov Trei Village in Kandal Province.  Mrs. Koem T. is the Village Bank President. She was born in 1965. Mrs. Koem T. has three children, two of whom are door-making workers; the youngest oN. is attending school.

Mrs. Koem T. owns a small piece of land on which she grows mango trees. She now faces a problem because the plantation has been damaged by insects. Therefore, Mrs. Koem T. decided to ask for a loan to buy pesticides to kill all the insects in order to make her crop more productive. Aside from this business, Mrs. Koem T. is a grocer. Her husband, Mr. Khiev Samoeurn, always assists his wife in both businesses.

loans.use: To buy pesticides to kill  insects in order to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Miss Chanthol N. (22) is single and living with her parents. She has one sister who is a silk weaver and one brother. Her parents grow bananas and raise cows. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Miss Chanthol has been a silk weaver for seven years, a skill she learned from her neighbour. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. The main income in the family is from her and her sister's weaving.

Chanthol is requesting a loan of $1000 to build one rest room for the family to use.

loans.use: To build one rest room.

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Koemseang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok K. was born in 1958 and she now lives in Sdao Kanlaeng Village in Kandal Province. She is the Village Bank President who has been selected by the members. This Village Bank consists of fifteen members. 

Mrs. Sok K. sells vegetables in the local market. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Sok K. decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. Her husband, Mr. Toeb Seab, is a house construction foreman who usually works outside the village. Mrs. Sok K. has eight children, two of whom are construction workers while another one sells vegetables with her. Three others stay at home and cook food for the household, while the remaining two are attending high school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mr. Heng L., and his wife, Mrs. Saroeun Auk, who live about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000. They have no children but Saroeun Auk has four children from her first marriage.

Mr. Heng has been driving a motor taxi for two years. He is also a farmer in the local village. Mrs. Saroeun stays at home and does housework because she has a problem with one of her eyes. Heng is in the process of building his house (the house in the picture is not his house) and lacks the money for materials. Therefore, Heng is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase materials to build his house.

loans.use: To purchase wood materials to build his new house.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Sophorn is a farmer who lives in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. She is married and lives with her husband and their eight children. Two of the children are married, and the others are young. Sophorn and her husband work hard every day to support their large family. She grows rice crops in the rainy season; this is a main source of income for her family.

Now it is the rainy season and time for farming. Sophorn is preparing to grow rice, but she lacks necessary capital. She needs to pay for plowing and fertilizer, so now she is requesting a loan of KHR 2,000,000 ($500 USD) to support her efforts.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and fertilizer

loans.name: Sreytoch

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreytoch T. (29) and her husband, Mr. Bunnat Meas (36), who live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1998 and have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children study in a local school and the youngest one stays at home.

Mrs. Sreytoch has been a silk weaver for many years. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been working at a company in Phnom Penh for almost ten years.

Sreytoch is requesting a loan of $700 to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: To build fence around her house.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.en: Alisher M. is 22 years old and lives in a high mountainous region of Tajikistan famous for its farming and colorful forms of dress. Most people raise livestock, and Alisher has been in this line of work for his whole life. He lives in a big family with eight children, of whom he is the oldest. Alisher also works at the local collective farm, but that is seasonal work. Most of his income comes from taking care of a large heard of animals, and he is very proud of what he does for a living. He has applied for a loan from Kiva to build a new barn for his cows.

loans.use: To build a new barn for his cows.

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Sokhom is a 38-year-old farmer, living in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. She lives with her husband and their five children, all of whom are young and attending school. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeun Chheang, is also farmer, and is a head of family. Sokhom has been growing rice crops since 1990 and works hard everyday to support her family.

Because of her family's increasing expenses, she needs to expand her farming business to increase her income. She requests a loan of KHR 1,000,000 ($250 USD) to purchase a plot of farmland to use for growing rice. Sokhom's husband is pictured because Sokhom is not available.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of farmland to use for growing rice

loans.name: Nurhon

texts.en: Nurhon E. was born in 1979 in the Asht region of Tajikistan. She is married, has two children, and works two jobs: she is a part-time school teacher who also makes clothing that is especially prized in her area. Nurhon applied for her first loan from MicroInvest earlier this year and immediately impressed us as a serious and reliable client. She used her loan to successfully improve her clothing-making business by buying dyes needed to make special socks that are popular with her customers because are very warm and part of the national dress. She has made socks for 10 years, and is very experienced and skillful at what she does. Nurhon is now applying for her second loan, which she will use to buy a computerized yarn-making machine. She will repay the loan in four months.

loans.use: To buy a computerized yarn-making machine.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti P. lives in a Bagdol, Lalitpur.  She lives with her husband and two sons.  Her husband, Mr. Nar Bahadur P., works in a hospital.  Her two sons are studying in grades 6 and 2.

One year ago, Mrs. P. started supplying decorative items in the local market.  She buys these goods from wholesale Chinese markets and supplies them in the local market.  She started this business to uplift the living standards of her family.  She also doesn't want to depend in her husband's income.

Now, Mrs. P. is requesting her second loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy varieties of gift and decorative items to increase her supply in the local market.

loans.use: To buy varieties of gift and decorative items

loans.name: Hidjran

texts.en: Hidjran is the mother of one child. She lives in Baku city. She was born in 1983. Hidjran has been in the cafe business for 3 years. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the necessary things for her cafe so she can provide her customers with the best service.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things for cafe to provide her customers with the best service

loans.name: Rupa

texts.en:
Rupa G. lives in a single family household with her husband and two daughters in Bagdol, Lalitpur.  Her husband's name is Bin Bahadur G. and he is currently in Dubai to earn money.  Both of her daughters are studying in grade 12.

Mrs. G. opened her poultry farm 2 years ago to upgrade the standards of her family.  Her aim is to send their children to a good college.  Mrs. G. sells her chicken in the local market.  Her daughters also help her in her work. 

Nowadays, in Nepal, the demand for chicken is increasing rapidly.  To meet the demand she has to expand her business.  So, Mrs. G. is requesting a Rs 15000.00 loan to buy small chickens for her business.

loans.use: To buy small chickens to expand her business.

loans.name: Sadaqat

texts.en: Sadaqat Baji is the wife of A. A. who sells vegetables in a vegetable market. She is a housewife and makes decorative embroidered  dresses to order. She has been living in an area named Shalimar, situated in the city of Lahore, Pakistan for the last 20 years. Sadaqat owns a three room brick house. She is the mother of  five children: three sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Sadaqat successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute ). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (thread,cloth and patterns) to fulfill the orders of her customers.

loans.use: To buy material for decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Sarswati

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarswati B., 40 years old, is a tailor in the village of Bhatkepati, Kathmandu.  She opened her tailoring shop 4 years ago.  Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses and school uniforms for both boys and girls.  She prefers to make popular dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, Makhshi and others.
 
Before starting her own business, Mrs B. took a 6-month training course in tailoring from a training institution.

She plans to use the loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.  She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education.

She lives in a single family household with her husband and two children.  Both of her children are in primary school.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.name: Agil

texts.en:
Agil is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He settled in the Fuzuli region in the Alkhanly village. He is married and has 3 children. This man was born in 1960.

He has run a cattle breeding business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a calf to improve his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Rameshwori

texts.en:
Rameshwori M. is a resident of Thecho.  Thecho is located in the Lalitpur district.  Most of the people in this area are engaged in farming.  Mrs. M. lives in a single family household with her husband and one daughter.  Her daughter is studying in primary school.

Together, Mrs. M. and her husband, Mr. Shyam M., opened their grocery shop three years ago in Thecho.  They sell different types of grocery items in her shop like rice, maize, paddy, noodles and so on.  Now, Mrs. M. is requesting a Rs. 10000.00 loan to buy different types of grocery items for her business.

She would like to use her increased income to provide better education for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy different types of grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Firudun

texts.en: 5 years ago, Firudun started this business. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, settled in Fuzuli region. He was born in 1968. He is married and has 3 children. Now he needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the foodstuffs to expand his wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs for re-sale

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti C. is a resident of Tangal Lalitpur.  Tangal is one of the busiest bazaars of the Lalitpur district.  Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses.  

Mrs. Shanti C. has four members, including herself, in her family.  A few years ago, her husband, Mr. Siddhi Ratna C., died, so she now has sole responsibility for her family.

Shanti C. is a grocery shopkeeper in the town of Tangal.  She opened her grocery store three years ago to improve the living standards of her family.  She sells different grocery items in her shop.  She has two sons and one daughter who help in her shop.  Her older son works in a finance office.  Her younger son and daughter help their mother in her grocery store.

Now, Mrs. Shanti C. is requesting a Rs 25000.00 loan to buy various grocery items such as rice, maize and snacks to expand her shop.

loans.use: To buy various grocery items to expand her business

loans.name: Kabita

texts.en:
Kabita N. is 21 years old and lives in Tangal, Lalitpur.  Miss N. has five members, including herself, in her family.  She lives with her father, mother and two brothers.  Her father is an engineer.  Both of her brothers are studying in the BBS level.  Miss N. is also studying in BBS.

Miss N. is engaged in a kitchen utensil shop business.  Her two brothers also work in the same shop.  They sell various types of kitchen utensils like rice cookers, pressure cookers, buckets and other items.  Due to a lack of funds, they are not able to expand their business.

So, Miss N. is requesting her second loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy the necessary utensil items for their shop.

loans.use: To buy necessary utensil items for their shop.

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita R., a resident of Tangal, lives in a single family household with her husband and two sons.  Her older son works in a finance office and her younger son is studying in grade 11.

Together, Mrs. R. and her husband, Mr. Sankhaman R., opened their small restaurant 6 years ago to strengthen the economic condition of their family.  They sell different varieties of food items in her shop.  Specifically, she prepares Newari foods.  The majority of the people living in the Lalitpur district are Newars, so Newari food is very famous and tastier.  The demand for Newari food is increasing day to day.  They also serve tea and coffee.  Her restaurant is small but very popular in her locality.
 
Now, Mrs. R. is requesting her second loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy necessary food materials for her shop.

loans.use: To buy necessary food materials for her shop.

loans.name: Farrukh

texts.en:
Farrukh A. is 24 years old. He is married with two adorable kids.

Farrukh has been breeding cattle since he was a young boy. He is a purposeful person. He likes animals and enjoys looking after them. Being in this business for 11 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning in five o’clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and generate a stable, considerable income for his large family.

Today, knowing that the prices for the animals are not so high now, but will increase for sure, Farrukh is planning to add to his livestock and to purchase cattle and calves. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting 2000 Somoni (600 USD) for a term of 12 months. Farrukh thanks all for trusting and supporting him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle and calves to expand his business

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen baji is the wife of  Mr. Munir who has a burning stove where he makes bread for his customers. He has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Yasmeen is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She has been living in the city of Lahore for the last 17 years. She owns a two story house and rents out the first floor. Yasmeen is the mother of  seven children: five sons and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. She has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute). Now Yasmeen is applying for a loan to make another burning stove to increase the profits of her husband's business.

loans.use: To make another burning stove

loans.name: Ganesh Maiya

texts.en:
Ganesh Maiya R. opened her gift shop two years ago in the town of Tangal to uplift the living standards of her family.  She sells various types of gift and decorative items in her shop.  

In Nepal, the demand for gift items is increasing constantly because Nepal is very rich in its festivals. So, to meet the demands of the customers, Mrs. Ganesh Maiya R. is requesting a Rs 30000.00 loan to buy various types of gift items of her shop.

Ganesh Maiya R. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two children.  Her husband's name is Mr. Santa Krishna R. and he works in a private office.  Her daughter works in a local office and her son left his education and has no work.

loans.use: To buy various types of gift items of her shop

loans.name: Baroat

texts.en:
Baroat R. is 45 years old. She’s married with two children. The difficult circumstances and hardships in her life made her recognize the value of work from a very young age. For about 10 years she has been purchasing young cattle in the local market to fatten and sell in local markets.

Baroat is a very hard-working woman, and her diligence is incredible. She works with a strength worthy of immense admiration. She has always looked for a way to be an important protagonist by providing extra income to her home.

Baroat wakes up early every morning to feed her cows and bulls, with the goal of fattening them and selling them at the best price in the local market. She started this occupation because of the recommendation and teaching of her beloved mother. Thanks to this activity she is supporting her children with education.

Baroat wants to keep on educating them because she hopes that they’ll reach the goals that they have laid out for themselves.

With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) with a term of 12 months to buy a calf in order to expand her business and to improve the living conditions of the family. Let’s support this brave woman who has a lot of courage and strength to live. Your generosity can change their lives.

loans.use: Purchasing small cattle to fatten and re-sell

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en: Mutabar Y. is 60 is years old. She’s a hard worker, married and has three children. Her husband receives a very low wage that does not cover all of the family's expenses. That's why Mutabar went into business selling foodstuff in her own grocery store. She has been running this business for two years. The business is stable and has allowed her to improve her family's living conditions. Today, Mutabar is asking for a loan of $575 that she will use to expand her business, offer a better service to her customers and improve various aspects of her store. She promises to repay the loan in 12 months, and wishes to extend her thanks to everyone who chooses to help her..

loans.use: To buy additional food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Kean

texts.en:
Kean L., age 36, is married and lives with her husband in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2005, she has been selling groceries from her home and raising pigs to earn a living.  She is able to earn up to US$5 of profit per day. Since 1995, her husband, Kat Sovan, age 40, has supplemented the household by working as a local teacher in one of the high schools in the village. On average, he makes around $3 per day. Together, this couple has three children and all of them are students. Mrs. Kean told a loan officer that she needs to pay around US$100 on food, US$12 for utilities, and US$120 for her children’s education.

Mrs. Kean is seeking a loan of US$1,000 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to build a bigger cage and purchase more pigs and feed for her livestock.  

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To build a bigger cage and purchase more pigs and feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Uma

texts.en:
Four years ago, Mrs. Uma N., 42 years old, opened her own shoe shop and small shoe factory.  She sells different kinds of women's shoes.  She began her business with a loan from BPW Patan. 

Now she is requesting her third loan of Rs 25000.00 to further expand her business by purchasing raw materials.  Her economic condition is low, so she needs a loan to further expand her business.  With her increased income, she plans to help her husband in the family's financial matters.

Her husband's name is Sobiyat Man N..  He is a college teacher at the Patan Campus.  Mrs. N. has two daughters aged 14 and 9 years old.  The youngest daughter is in grade 7 and the oldest daughter is in grade 9.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Sehr

texts.en: Sehr Baji is the wife of M. who is a butcher by profession. Sehr baji is a housewife and sews clothes. She lives with her family in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She lives in a rented house. Sehr Baji is a mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are getting an education. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy livestock (cows and goats) to enhance her husband's business. Sehar baji plans to use the loan to help her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy livestock to expand the business

loans.name: Bhagabati

texts.en:
Mrs. Bhagabati L., 42 years old, is a tailor in the town of  Kalanki in Kathmandu.  She opened her tailoring shop 15 years ago.  Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, Makhshi and others.
 
Before starting her own business, Mrs. L. took a 6-month training course in tailoring from Sunita tailor shop near her town when she was younger.

She plans to use her Rs 20000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.  She wants to add to her family's income and support her children's education.  

Her husband's name is Sahadev L. and he is a tourist guide.  She has two daughters and one son.  Her two daughters just took the +2 education exam and her son is working and studying abroad.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Tuhfanisso

texts.ru:
Tuhfanisso R. lives in the Jallolidini Rumy region. She is 49 years old, divorsed, and lives with her son. To provide for her family, she owns a business. She sells clothing. So that she could purchase seasonal items, she plans to obtain a loan. She will be paying off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахматова Тухфаниссо проживает в районе Джалоллидини Руми. Возраст 49 лет. Разведена. Живет с сыном. Для того , чтобы обеспечить семью занимается бизнесом. Торгует на рынке одеждой.Для того , чтобы закупить сезонный товар к осеннему сезону , планирует получить кредит и завезти товар. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Mrs. Rita K., 51 years old, is a tailor in the town of  Kalanki in Kathmandu.  She opened her tailoring shop 25 years ago.  Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies' dresses like Kurta Sulwar, blouses, ladies' long dresses, Makhshi and others.
 
Before starting her own business, Mrs. K. took a 6-month training course in tailoring near her town.  Several years ago, her husband, Uttam K., died and now she has sole responsibility for her 5 children.

She plans to use her Rs 25000.00 loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.  Her economic condition is very low to fulfill the basic needs of her family.  She needs a loan to expand her business and be able to earn more profit to fulfill her family's basic needs.

She has two sons and three daughters.  Four of her children have completed the SLC level and the youngest son is in grade 8.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng H., age 36, is a former farmer and lives with her husband in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been selling a particular type of mint to earn a living and is able to earn up to US$5 of profit a day. This kind of mint is the type they normally put in fried rice and soups to make the food smell good. Her husband, Sun Saridh, age 43, runs a business catching fish and selling it to the market to earn an approximately US$5 of profit per day. This couple has five children together, three of whom are employed and the other two are students. She told a loan officer that she needs to pay around US$85 for food and about US$15 on her children's education. 

Mrs. Seng is seeking a loan of US$1,200 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase a wooden boat with a motor and fishing tools in order to catch more fish.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a wooden boat with a motor and fishing tools in order to catch more fish.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida Baji is the wife of B. A. who makes steel-body cooking ranges. He has been in this profession for the last 25 years. He learnt this art from his father and chose this work as a profession.

Abida Baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She has been living with her family in a city named Lahore, Paksitan for the last 30 years. She owes a three-room brick house. She is a mother of twelve children: eight sons and four daughters. Her first four sons work with their father while the remaining four sons are studying. She is applying for a loan to buy more steel to expand her husband's business.

loans.use: To buy steel to make cooking stoves

loans.name: Davlatmoh

texts.ru: Тоджиддинова Давлатмо проживает  в городе Нурек. Занимается бизнесом. Торгует тканями на центральном рынке. К осеннему сезону , к приходу холодов хочет получить кредит и уже завезти зимние ткани. Привозит она товар из города Душанбе . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 18 лет , с того момента как муж оставил их семью  и она осталась одна с шестью детьми на руках. Теперь она старается дать детям все по мере возможности. Старший сын должен поступать в ВУЗ , поэтому ей необходимо очень много работать. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 10 месяцев
texts.en:
Davlatmoh T. lives in Nurek. She runs a small business selling fabrics in the central market. She would like to get a loan to buy winter fabrics to prepare for the coming colder fall and winter seasons. Davlatmoh buys the fabrics in Dushanbe. She has been in this business for 18 years, after her husband left her alone with six children to support. Since then she has tried to give her children everything within her means. Her oldest son is about to start university and so she is working as hard as she can. She plans to repay the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fall and winter fabrics

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en: Rizwana Tabassum Baji is the wife of A. B.. He is a driver by profession. Rizwana baji is a house wife and prefers to do household work. She lives with her family in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a four rooms brick house. She is a mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. Her elder sons run a cosmetics shop. Rizwana is applying for a loan to buy material (lipsticks, nail polish, various type of creams) for her sons' shop.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Lek

texts.en:
Lek V., age 46, lives with her husband in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been selling rice and baskets to earn a living and is able to earn up to US$10 in revenue per day. Her husband Yen Vanny, age 50, is a local teacher in a primary school in the village. On average, he makes around US$4 per day. This couple has eight children together, of whom three are employed and the five other are students.

Mrs. V. is seeking a loan of US$1,000 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase a plot of land to resell and the remainder will be used to raise pigs to sell. (Mrs. Lek V. is pictured with her daughter.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land to resell and the remainder will be used to raise pigs to sell.

loans.name: Djamilya

texts.ru: Зиеева Джамиля жительница района Вахдат. Возраст 44 года , замужем , имееь 5 детей.Образование средне-техническое. По профессии портниха. Занимаеся этим видом деятельности более 14 лет. Клиентка шьет национальные платья и реализует их на местном рынке .Так же принимает заказы на дому.В данный момент клиентка хочет купить новую швейную машинку для того , чтобы взять к себе на работу помошницу. Это даст возможность увеличить объем продукции . Планирует погасить кредит втечении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Djamilya Z. lives in the Vahdat area. She is 44 years old, married and has 5 children. She has a community college diploma. Djamilya works as tailor and has been doing this for 14 years. She saws traditional dresses and sells them at the local market. She also takes custom orders and works from her home. Djamilya would like to get a loan to buy another sawing machine so as to hire extra help. This will allow her to increase her output and sales. She plans to repay her loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Mrs. N. Thavy is a mother of four children who lives in Phteah Rung Village, Pursat Province. She has been growing rice crops with her husband for eighteen years. Rice grows only in the rainy season. The rice crop provides the main income for her family; thus she has to sustain her efforts and be willing to expand in the future.

She increases her rice yield every year by using fertilizer. Now she is requesting a loan of KHR 500,000 ($125 USD) to purchase fertilizer to use to increase her rice yield.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer to use to increase rice yield

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen baji is the wife of M. Y. who runs a hotel. He has 25 years experience in this business. Yasmeen  is a housewife and prepares dishes for the hotel. She lives in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house. She is a mother of four sons. All of her sons are studying. Yasmeen successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute ). Now she is applying for a loan to buy staples (rice and chick peas) for the dishes she prepares for her husband's hotel.

loans.use: To buy staples for her hotel food business

loans.name: Radjabgul

texts.ru: Юсупова Раджабгул жительница района Вахдат.Возраст 50 лет, замужем,имеет 12 детей. Клиентка  больше 20 лет занимается куплей продажей ткани.Она скупает у оптовых поставщиков ткань и реализует ее в розницу. Ведет торговлю из дома.Этот вид  бизнеса позволяет ей содержать свою большую семью .Так как  муж клиентки инвалид и не может работать. В данный момень Раджабгул хочет закупить  ткань ,на что ей нужны деньги.Она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Radjabgul U. lives in the Vahdat area. She is 50 years old, married with 12 children. She has been in the fabric sales business for over 20 years. Radjabgul buys fabrics from established suppliers and then re-sells them. She runs the business from her home. The business has helped support her large family as her husband is an invalid, unable to work. Radjabgul would like a loan to buy additional fabrics to increase her inventory and variety. She plans to repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To incease inventory & variety

loans.name: Muzaym

texts.ru:
Muzaym S. lives in Vahdat district. She is married and has a high school education. She and her husband have five children. Muzaym's business is buying and selling produce. Early in the mornings, she purchases fruits and vegetables from local farmers wholesale. Muzaym then sells the produce for a profit, allowing her to support her family. Since she already sells a wide variety of fruits and vegetables, Muzaym would like to diversify the goods offered at her market stall. She has applied for a 12-month loan to purchase additional inventory.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Савидова Музаям жительница района Вахдат. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Клиентка занимается куплей продажей овощей , фруктов и зелени. Музаям рано утром скупает у местных крестьян их продукцию оптом.Затем реализует ее на своей торговой точке в розницу.На прибыль от торговли она содержить своих детей.Так как в данное время поспели все фрукты и овощи ,клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент своей торговой точки. Музаям берет кредит срокм на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To diversify the goods for sale

loans.name: Thi Yen's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. D. Thi Yen (ID number 17120007), born in 1969, has a business in renting wedding decorations. Her husband is a taxi driver and her two children are of school-going ages. She would like to borrow 5,300,000VND through Binh Minh to expand her business. Her family's frequent income is very suitabL. to repay the loan weekly, thus they would like to apply for more loans to raise their standard of living. Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. Tran Thi Lien (ID Number 17120006), born in 1960, has a small general store. Her husband passed away, so she has to raise her two school-going children by herself. She would like to borrow 5,724,000VND to expand her store.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Thu Ha (ID Number 17120008) was born in 1973. Her husband is an electrician. She would like to borrow 4,876,000VND to invest in her drink store.
  • Mrs. D. Thi Hanh (ID Number 17120013), born in 1976, would like to borrow 4,876,000VND to expand her drink store.
  • Mrs. L. Thi Thanh Nga (ID Number 17120020, born in 1984, would like to borrow 4,452,000VND to invest in her eatery.
  • The total amount requested is 1,525.00USD).

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva volunteer.

     Đỗ Thi Yến (Ms 17120007), sinh năm 1969, chị làm nghề kinh doanh dịch vụ cho thuê đồ cưới hỏi. Chồng chị là lái xe taxi, hai con chị còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. Chi vay mức vốn: 5.300.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở rộng kinh doanh. Chị vay vốn ở tài chính vimô Binh Minh để có thêm vốn hỗ trợ kinh doanh của mình. Thu nhập thường xuyên của hai vợ chồng rất phù hợp với hoàn trả tuần nên vợ chồng chị mong muốn tham gia vay vốn lâu dài để cải thiện cuộc sống. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Đỗ Thị Lan (Ms 17120006), sinh năm 1960, làm nghề buôn bán nhỏ. Chồng chị đã mất, chị phải một mình nuôi hai con còn nhỏ ăn học. Mức vay của chị: 5.724.000 vnđ để mở rộng cửa hàng. Lê Thị Thu Hà (Ms 17120008), sinh năm 1973. Chồng chị là thợ điện. Mức vay; 4.876.000 vnđ để kinh doanh cửa hàng giải khát. Dương Thị Hạnh (Ms 17120013), sinh năm 1976, mức vay:4.876.000 vnđ đểmở rộng cửa hàng nước giải khát. Lại Thị Thanh Ngà ( Ms 17120020), sinh năm 1984, mức vay:4.452.000 vnđ để kinh doanh cửa hàng cơm bình dân.

loans.use: Supplying Wedding Decorations

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Lim Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sok L. is the Village Bank President in Thkol Village in Kandal Province. This village bank consists of twenty-four people. Mrs. Sok L. was born in 1963 and she is now a fruit seller in the local market in the village. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Sok L. wants to expand her business. Therefore she decided to ask for a loan to buy more kinds of fruit to meet her customers' demand. Her husband, Mr. Chhun Mech, is a palm juice collector who gathers juice to process into palm sugar or palm wine.  He also assists in his wife's business when he has free time. Mrs. Sok L. has six children, two of whom are workers who make palm sugar for middlemen. They can make a small income to support their family. The remaining four children are attending high school.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more kinds of fruit to meet her customers demand.

loans.name: Nidjat

texts.en: Nidjat (his father is pictured), born in 1986, lives in Absheron region, Novkhani village. A single man, Nidjat has been in the taxi business for four years. Now he and his father need a loan of $1200 to buy spare car parts in order to improve their business. They thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the taxi

loans.name: Gavhar

texts.ru:
Gavhar I., 43, lives in Vahdat district. She and her husband have 5 children. Gavhar has an economics degree and a small business selling cooking oil. Her business is one of the main sources of income for her family. Gavhar would like to purchase more goods to sell and has applied for a 12-month loan to increase her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Исломова Гавхар жительница райлна Вахдат.Возраст 43 года.ю зхамужем, имеет 5 детей.Образование высшее, по специальности экономист.Гавхар занимается куплей продажей растительного масла. Этот вид деятельености явялется одним из основных источников дохода ее семьи. В данный момент клиентка хочет закупить товар.На что ей нужны деньги. Гавхар решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Vat Pheaktenao Group

texts.en: This group, which consists of six members, is located in Preaek Thum Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Vat P. is the group leader and she sells clothes in the local market. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Vat P. wants to expand it. Therefore she decided to ask for a loan to buy fashionable clothes to sell to the younger generation. Her husband, Mr. Meas Chanuth, is a construction worker. Mrs. Vat P. and her husband are married without any children. They live in poor conditions because they have only a bike for traveling and a television in their household. Mrs. Vat P. hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy fashionable clothes to sell to the younger generation.

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru:
Gulchehra Z. is a citizen of the area of Vahdat. She is 45 years old, married and has 3 children. Gulchehra has been engaged in business for 17 years. She owns a small food store in the Vahdat area. Her store is located not far from home, which allows her to look after her children. From the income of trading she can support her family and buy at the market necessary food products. Currently Gulchehra wants to purchase in bulk goods from wholesale suppliers, however she need money to do this. By consulting with loved ones, she wants to take out a loan for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Зубайдова Гулчехра жительница района Вахдат.Возраст 45 лет, замужем, имеет 3 детей.Гулчехра более 17 лет занимается бизнесом.Она имеет небольшой продуктовый магазин в районе Вахдат.Магазин находится недалеко от дома,что позволяет ей присматривать за детьми. На доход от торговли она может содержать свою семью,покупать на рынке необходимые продукты питания.Сейчас Гулчехра хочет закупить у оптовых поставщиков товар ,на чтоей нужны деньги.Посоветовавшись с близкими она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase in bulk of goods

loans.name: Thi Da's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Da (ID Number 03060008), born in 1960, would like to borrow 3,132,000VND. She has four grown-up children, the eldest one is already married and the other three have been working with a stable income. Mrs. Da is a reliable and responsible person so she was voted to be the group leader. She would like to obtain this loan to invest in raising livestock and making tofu. Her family's average monthly income is 3,500,000VND (about 233USD). Her group also consists of:
  • Mrs. D. Thi Duyen (ID Number 03060012), born in 1966, would like to borrow 3,132,000VND to buy eggs to sell. Her average monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 200USD).
  • Mrs. T. Thi Lien (ID Number 03060013), born in 1980, would like to borrow 1,044,000VND to breed chickens. Her average monthly income is 2,000,000VND (about 133USD).
  • Mrs. N. Thi Doi (ID Number 03060014), born in 1953, would like to borrow 3,132,000VND to raise livestock. Her average monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 200USD).
  • Mrs. P. Thi Ha (ID Number 03060010), born in 1970, would like to borrow 348,000VND to sell leaves for wrapping rice cakes. Her average monthly income is 2,000,000VND (about 133USD).
  • Mrs. H. Thi Khanh (ID Number 03060011), born in 1973, would like to borrow 3,132,000VND to rainse livestock and invest in her general store. Her average monthly income is 3,000,000VND (about 133USD).
  • The total amount requested is 850.00USD

    • Translated from Vietnamese by P. Yen Thanh, Kiva volunteer.

     Trần Thị Đà, sinh năm 1960, MS(03060008), mức vay 3.132.000 đồng. Cô có 4 cháu đã trưởng thành, cháu lớn đã có gia đình, 3 cháu còn lại đã đi làm có thu nhập về cho gia đình. Cô là người có uy tín với bà con trong làng nên cả nhóm vay vốn bầu cô làm nhóm trưởng. Vợ chồng cô vay vốn đầu tư làm đậu và chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân 3.500.000 đồng/tháng. Trông nhóm cô còn có: - Đỗ Thị Duyên, sinh năm 1966, MS(03060012), mức vay 3.132.000 đồng. Chị vay vốn đầu tư đi chợ buôn trứng, thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000 đồng/tháng - Trần Thị Liên, sinh năm 1980, MS(03060013), mức vay 1.044.000 đồng. Chị vay vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi gà, thu nhập bình quân 2.000.000 đồng/tháng - Nguyễn Thị Đợi, sinh năm 1953, MS(03060014), mức vay 3.132.000 đồng. Cô vay vốn để đầu tư chăn nuôi, thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000 đồng/tháng - Phạm Thị Hạ, sinh năm 1970, MS(03060010), mức vay 348.000 đồng. Chị vay vốn đi chợ bán lá dong gói bánh, thu nhập bình quân 2.000.000 đồng/tháng - Hoàng Thị Khánh, sinh năm 1973, MS(03060011), mức vay 3.132.000 đồng. Chị vay vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi và bán hàng tạp hóa, thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000 đồng/tháng.

loans.use: Raising livestock and retailing

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon N., age 28, is married and lives with her husband in Prey Veng, Cambodia. Since 2000, she and her husband, Kong Va, age 55, have sold chickens for a living, and are able to earn up to US$6.50 of profit per day. This couple has two children together and all of them are too young to attend school. Mrs. Phon told a loan officer that she wants her children study until they get a bachelors degree.

Mrs. Phon N. would like a loan of US$1,000 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase more chickens to sell.  (Mr. Kong is pictured because his wife was not available.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken to sell.

loans.name: Tojinisso

texts.ru:
Tojinisso Colieva is a citizen of the area of Vahdat. She is married and has eight children. She owns a small store in the Vahdat area in which she trades food products. This trade is the only source of income for her large family, because her children do not work yet since the are in school. In the current moment Tojinisso wants to increase the assortment of her goods, for which she needs to receive a loan, which she plans to repay within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Солиева Тоджиниссо жительница района Вахдат. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Клиентка имеет небольшой магазин в районе.Торгует она продуктами питания . Торговля является единственным источником дохода ее большой семьи. Дети Тоджиниссо еще не работают.Так как учатся в средней школе. В данный момент клиентка хочет увеличить ассортимент товара. Для чего ей нужны деньги и она решила взять кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Von

texts.en:
Von S., age 46, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 1982, she and her husband, Sout Rin, age 47, have owned a plot of land growing rice and yams for a living and are able to earn around $1 per day. This couple has four children, one of whom is employed by a garment factory. Her daughter always shares some of her money to support the family.

Mrs. Von S. would like a loan of $600 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to hire workers to plow the land and grow yams. (Mr. Sout Rin is pictured because his wife was not available.) 

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To hire workers to plow the land and grow yams.

loans.name: Aminjon.

texts.ru:
Aminjon A. is a citizen of the city of Yavan. He is 32 years old, married and has four children. He is unemployed. He earns an income by raising large-horned cattle and selling milk. Two of his cows have given birth so it is important that he increases the size of his cow barn. That is why he wants to receive a loan so that he can buy building materials. By building a strong cow barn he will be able to be well prepared for the winter and not worry that the cold weather would injure the cows. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Азимов Аминджон житель города Яван. Возраст 32 года , женат и имеет четверых детей. Нигде не работает . Зарабатывает на жизнь путем разведения крупно-рогатого скота и продажи молока. Двое из коров отелились и теперь ему необходимо увеличить коровник. Поэтому он хочет получить кредит , для того , чтобы закупить стройматериалы. Построив крепкий коровник он сможет хорошо подготовится к зиме и не беспокоится о том , что холодная зима повредит животных. Погашать кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im P., age 39, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 1990, she and her husband, Du Thol, age 41, have worked growing rice and raising pigs to sell for a living.  They are able to earn up to US $2 of profit per day. This couple has five children together and all of them are married and no longer stay at home.

Mrs. Im P. would like a loan of $800 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to raise more pigs to sell.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To raise more pigs to sell.

loans.name: Raiy

texts.en:
Mrs. S. Raiy is a 43-year-old farmer. For three years, she has also sold porridge and raised pigs, earning $2.67 per day. She lives in Khcas Commune, Siem Reap Provice. Her husband, Mr. Srey Ro, 42, is a bricklayer earning $2.73 per day. They live with their four children. Their two eldest children can earn $0.75 per day.

In order to increase her family's income, Raiy requests a loan of $500 to purchase wine proving tools to make wine to sell. She will use the remainder of the loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop. This loan will help their family increase their income from the new occupation. In the future, Raiy wants all her children to graduate university and get good jobs.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase wine proving tools to make wine to sell and to purchase fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.name: Rukia's Group

texts.en:
Rukia H., 32, is a widow with five children (ages 17, 16, 11, 6, and 20). She has a beauty salon which she started eight years ago. She works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $43.

Rukia has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to expand her business and pay school fees. She hopes for a new loan to increase her business capital. Rukia will share this loan with her subgroup members selling soft drinks, food, and alcoholic drinks.

In the photo, Rukia is second from the left.

loans.use: to increase her business capital

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S., age 58, lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 1985, she and her husband Norng Song, age 62, have worked growing rice to earn a living and are able to earn around $2.50 per day. So far, they have dug a pond to raise fish for extra profit. This couple has seven children, three of whom are married and no longer live at home.

Mrs. S. would like to request a loan of $800 from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase more fish to raise and feed for the fish.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to raise and feed for the fish, as well.

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Mrs. Ry S. (53) is a widow with two children. Her first daughter has full employment in Phnom Penh, and the second daughter who is a weaver who is married and lives in the family. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Ry S. has been a silk weaver for twenty-one years, a skill she learned from her neighbour. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. She is requesting a loan of US$800 to purchase silk materials for her and her daughter's weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun N., age 32, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 2002, she has been working on her rice paddy field to earn a living and is able to earn around $1.50 each day. Her husband, Khum Oeun, age 36, is a construction worker who builds houses, and he also raises ducks for extra profit. On average, he makes around $2 of profit each day. This couple has two children and both of them are students.

Mrs. Oun N. would like to loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase fertilizers and insecticide for her farmland. The remainder will be used to purchase more ducks. (Mrs. Oun N. is pictured with her husband.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticide for her farmland. The remaining amount will be used to purchase more ducks.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy S. (48) and her husband, Mr. Samoeun Doeun (48), who live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1980 and have three children: one son and two daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives with her husband’s family and the other two children study in a local school.

Mrs. Thy has been selling vegetables since 1993. Some of the vegetables she grows with her husband, and the rest she buys from her fellow villagers for resale.

Thy is requesting a loan of US$300 in order to expand her business of selling vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.ru:
Suhrob A. is a citizen of the city of Yavan. He is 34 years old, married and has five children. He is involved in animal industries. He buy and resells bulls. He has 10 years of experience in this field. This business is also the only source of income for his family. That is why his whole family helps him take care of the animals. He wants to increase his herd by taking out a loan. He wants to fatten up the bulls and then sell them for profit. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Азимов Сухроб житель города Яван. Возраст 34 года, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Занимается бизнесом в сфере животноводства. Перепродает бычков. Опыт работы в данной сфере уже 10 лет. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Поэтому они все вместе занимаются уходом за животными. Хочет увеличить поголовье скота путем получения кредита. Откормив его он сможет выгодно его продать. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Douy

texts.en:
Douy L., age 39, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been growing cucumbers and selling them in the market since 1985. On average, she makes around $1 of profit each day. Her husband Duong Dam, age 43, earns a living as a rice farmer and is able to earn about $2 each day. This couple has four children together.

Mrs. Douy L. would like to loan from Kiva to raise ducks for extra profit.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: Mrs. Douy Lot would like to loan from Kiva to raise ducks for extra profit.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en: Joana B. K. sells saucepans, clothing, and fabric. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Joana and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Ty

texts.en:
Ty L., age 50, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She and her husband have been farmers since they got married. They grow vegetables, and on average they make around 1 dollar per day. Mrs. Ty told a loan officer that it is difficult to earn a living as a farmer because there are no irrigation systems in most provinces, and the weather condition is very bad as well. Farmers depend on the weather to get more output. She continues, farmers are very happy when there are dark clouds, but if there is no rain they will face crop damages. This couple has two children who are married and live away from home.
Mrs. Ty L. is seeking a loan of $500 from Kiva to purchase a cart that will allow her drain the juice from sugar cane plants to earn an extra profit. (Her husband is pictured here because Mrs. Ty L. was not available.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a cart that will allow her drain the juice from sugar cane plants to earn extra profits.

loans.name: Sarum

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarum C. (50) and her husband, Mr. Phoeuk Chhum (52), live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. They were married in 1979 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Two of her children are married and now live outside the family home. Another child studies in Art College in Phnom Penh, and the other one is employed full time.

Mrs. Sarum has been selling grocery items for many years. She buys them from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at her shop in front of her house. Her husband is a farmer. He grows bananas, bitter gourd, and ridye gourds in his farm near the house.

Sarum is requesting a loan of US$800 to expand her grocery business and to pay for repairing her house.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale and pay fee for repairing her house.

loans.name: Tagoiali.

texts.ru:
Tagoiali Z. is a citizen of the city of Yavan. For his whole life he has been engaged in animal industries. He has a small farm where he breeds livestock. He breeds sheep and bulls and goats. After he fattens up the animals, he sells part of the herd, and in their place buys more livestock.. Therefore he plans to receive a loan so that he can increase the numbers of his livestock. He plans to repay the loan within 6 months. Tagoiali is married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Maria Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer.

Зоиров Тагойали житель города Яван. Всю жизнь занимается животноводством . У него небольшое хозяйство , где разводит домашний скот. У него есть и овцы и бычки , и козы. Откормив животных , он какую-то часть продает и на их место покупает новых. Поэтому он планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит он сможет в течение 6 месяцев. Тагойали женат и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: Increase livestock

loans.name: Bui Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Bùi Thị Tâm 39 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2004 trước đây chủ yếu gia đình chị làm ruộng, nuôi lợn, cá nhưng phát triển chậm. Để tăng thu nhập gia đình đã quyết định thuê địa điểm buôn bán kinh doanh thu gom phế liệu  hiện nay đang làm ăn tốt. Số vốn vay lần đầu gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi kết quả cho thu nhập tuy nhiên là không cao. Các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào buôn bán kinh doanh thu mua phế liệu. Công việc kinh doanh của gia đình chị diễn ra thuận lợi. Thu nhập bình quân 200.000đ/ ngày . Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào kinh doanh thu mua phế liệu.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bui Thi T., aged 39, has been a member of TYM Fund since 2004. Back then, her family’s main source of income came from farming, breeding pigs and fishes, but they didn’t generate a lot of income. Consequentially, Mrs. T. decided to rent a place to start buying and selling wastes. Mrs. T. used the loan of the first round to invest in poultries, but she didn’t make much profit. Learning the mistake, Mrs. T. since then has invested the loans from TYM in her business, from which she earns about 200000 VND per day. The business has aided her family financially a great deal. In the next round of loan, Mrs. T. would like to ask for 9.000.000 VND ($550) to expand her business. Her family’s monthly income is about 6.000.000 VND.


Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Evodia

texts.en: Evodia N. is a Tanzanian woman who has run a cloth shop in Dar-es-Salaam  for more than three years now. Her shop is at Vituka, outside Kariakoo shopping city center. She purchases the items she sells from Kariakoo wholesale shops and re-sells to customers in the Vituka area. She wants to expand the shop inventory but her business capital is limited. She's requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 750 to boost her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun H., age 37, lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been growing vegetables and selling it in the market to earn a living and is able to earn around $1 each day. Her husband, Tuon Try, age 38, is a construction worker who has built houses since 1998. On average, he makes about $2 each day. This couple together has four children, one of whom works in Phnom Penh weaving bags, and provides $100 each month to support the family.

Mrs. Yun H. would like to ask for a loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase a stand in the market for her son who weaves bags in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a stand in the market for her son who works weaving bags in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy G. is a fishmonger who buys fresh fish and then processes it for sale. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Mercy and her 3 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Nasira

texts.ru:
Nasira N. lives in the city of Yavan. She lives with her large happy family. Her husband and her three children love eachother very much despite all the hardships. Her husband works at a construction site while she stays at home. She raises farm animals. She has decided to buy a young cow in order to increase the amount of animals she has. This will be possible only if she can obtain a loan for 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Нуралиева Назира жительница города Яван. Живет в своей большой и дружной семье. Трое детей и муж , все очень любят друг друга , не смотря на трудности в жизни. Муж работает на стройке , а она занимается домашним хозяйством. Имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит домашний скот. Сейчас решила купить молодую корову для дальнейшей цели увеличить полголовье скота. Это возможно только , если она сможет получить кредит сроком на 8 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase a young cow

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đặng Thị Hòa 52 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006. Sống tại vùng nông thôn nên nghề nghiệp chính của gia đình chị là làm ruộng, để kinh tế gia đình được cải thiện hơn gia đình chị đã nghĩ đến việc chăn nuôi, tuy nhiện để việc chăn nuôi hiệu quả thì phải đầu tư vốn. Từ suy nghĩ như vậy chị đã quyết định tham gia Quỹ vay vốn, vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị xin vay 3.000.000đ chị đã mua lợn bột và vịt đẻ trứng, với việc chăn nuôi như vậy hàng ngày chị đã có thu nhập từ vịt đẻ trứng, sau vài lứa lợn gia đình chị đã có thu nhập ổn định hơn và việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị ngày càng quy mô. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang nuôi 9 con lợn thịt và 200 vịt đẻ trứng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dang Thi H., aged 52, has participated in TYM Fund since 2006. As Mrs. H. and her family live in the countryside, the main source of income for them comes from farming. To enhance the family’s income, Mrs. H. considered raising poultries, but back then she didn’t have the capital to put her plan into practice. This motivated her to become a member of TYM Fund, from whom she would be able to request for loans. In the first round of loan, Mrs. H. asked for 3.000.000 VND, which she used to buy pigs, ducks and raised them. As a result, the family’s financial situation has been improved a lot. Mrs. H. is currently breeding 9 pigs for meat and 200 ducks for eggs. In this round, Mrs. H. would like to ask for 9.000.000 VND to invest in poultries. Her family’s monthly income is about 5.000.000 VND.


Translated from Vietnamese by KH. Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Gashang

texts.en: Gashang is the mother of 2 children. She was born in 1969. She lives in Baku city. Gashang has been in the beauty salon business for 3 years. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy the necessary things for improving her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy the necessary things to improve her beauty salon

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sorn M. (51, not pictured) and his wife, Mrs. Yoeun Pok (pictured), who live in a small village off of National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh, were married in 1981 and have four children; one son and three daughters. Three of her children have full time employment in Phnom Penh, and the other one sells grocery items at home.

Mr. Sorn has been a mason for eighteen years. In addition to his construction work, he also cooks for wedding parties. His wife stays at home and does house work. Sorn is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase one motorbike to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase one motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Vy

texts.vi:
Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006, chị Nguyễn Thị Vy 36 tuôi. Trước khi trưa tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn vì nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình hoàn toàn phụ thuộc vào mấy sào ruộng. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã vay vốn. Vòng vốn đầu tiện gia đình chị xin vay 3.000.000đ chị đã đầu tư vốn vào đi chợ bán chiếu, từ khi có vốn đi chợ kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển hơn và bớt đi khó khăn. Trong quá trình đi chợ anh chị đã nhận thấy sản xuất dây chun đang là một nghề mới và trên thị trường đang có nhu cầu. Với suy nghĩ đó gia đình chị đã Quyết định chuyển hướng kinh doanh. Sử dụng đồng vốn sẵn có của gia đình kết hợp cùng vay vốn của Quỹ gia đình chị đã mua được một chiếc máy cắt dây chun. Hiện tại công việc làm ăn của gia đình chị diễn ra rất tôt. Thu nhập bình quân 200.000đ/ ngày. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000/ tháng .
texts.en:
A member of TYM fund since 2006, Ms. N. Thi Vy is 36 years old. Before joining the fund, her family's financial situation was difficult because the main source of their income came totally from farming. The first loan with TYM was for 180.00 USD and she invested in her business of selling mats. Since then, the family's income has improved. In the process of shopping, she and her husband notice the production of rubber bands as a new craft, and there is a demand for them in the market. With that thought, they decided to change direction of their business. With the money they have saved combined with a loan from TYM fund, they were able to purchase a rubber band cutting machine. Presently the business is doing very well, with average daily income of 12.00 USD. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 550.00 USD. Average monthly income is 360.00 USD

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Maibonu

texts.ru:
Maibonu Z. lives in the city of Yavan. She sells children's clothing on the central market. She has spent all her money to purchase goods at the beginning of the season. Currently she needs to pay for rent and has decided to obtain a loan for 10 months. She will pay rent, which will allow her to work at her sales location for a long time without any issues. She has permanent clients that know where she is located and therefore it would be not to Maibonu's advantage to change locations. She has been in sales for the past 8 years. She is divorced and has 2 daughters.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Зикирова Майбону проживает в городе Яван. Работает на центральном рынке , где торгует одеждой для детей. С началом сезона все ее деньги ушли на приобретение товара. А в данный момент ей необходимо оплатить арендную плату , поэтому она решила получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев. Она оплатит аренду и будет долгое время торговать на своей торговой точке без проблем. Кроме того у нее есть постоянные клиенты , которые знают ее постоянное место работы. И поэтому менять его ей не выгодно. Занимается троговлей уже 8 лет. Она разведена и имеет двух дочек.

loans.use: Rent

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes K. is married with three children (ages 16, 14, and 10). She has had a business selling food since 2002. She works from 7am to 9pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$ 43.

In the past, Agnes has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her business capital. She hopes for a new loan to continue to grow her business. Agnes will share this loan with her subgroup members selling clothes, cosmetics, and fruits and vegetables.

In the picture, Agnes is the tallest, second from right.

loans.use: to grow her business

loans.name: Preab

texts.en:
Preab S., age 60, is a widow and lives in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 2000, she has been earning a living as a wedding chef and is able to earn around $2 to support her family. She has seven children, four of whom are married and live away from home. Two others are employed doing different work.

To make more profit to support the family, Mrs. Preab S. would like to loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, an amount of $600 to purchase a motorbike for her son to operate a motor-taxi business.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Raya

texts.en: Raya (her husband is pictured), born in 1981 and the mother of two children, is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Zangilan region, and now lives in the town of Khirdalan. Her husband has run a taxi business for five years, and the family is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts for the car. They thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the taxi

loans.name: Nga

texts.vi:
Ms D. Thi Nga is 44 years old, and joined TYM fund in 2006. She currently lives in a village that has a tradition of making baskets. Luckily both she and her husband are very skilled in making baskets. When first joining the fund, she borrowed 185.00 USD to buy materials for making baskets. In this business, they are able to use the labor of everyone in the family. Because of their skillfulness and years of experience in this trade, customers always place their orders ahead and thus her family did not have to spend time trying to sell the baskets. Their daily income from making the baskets is 9.00 USD. Her son works outside the home and makes about 92.00 USD per month. For this loan, her family wishes to borrow 550.00 USD to continue investment in their basket- making business. Their average monthly income is 305.00 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006, chị Đỗ Thị Nga 44 tuổi hiện đang sinh sống ở làng nghề truyền thống là làm thúng. Thuận lợi của gia đình chị là cả hai vợ chồng chị đều thành thạo nghề làm thúng. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị xin vay 3.000.000đ đầu tư vào mua các sản phẩm làm thúng, với nghề này gia đình chị đã tận dụng được tất cả lao động trong gia đình. Có nhiều năm kinh nghiệm trong nghề và lại là người khéo tay nên các sản phẩm gia đình chị làm gia đều có khách hàng đến đặt trước nên cũng không phải mất công đi bán. Thu nhập bình quân từ việc làm thúng 150.000đ/ ngày. Con trai chị đi làm ngoài thu nhập 1.500.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 tiếp tục đầu tư vào làm thúng. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Thuy

texts.vi:
Ms. D. Thi Thuy is 30 years old and joined TYM fund in 2005. Her family's main lines of production are agriculture and animal breeding. When she joined the fund, she borrowed money to invest in her animal breeding farm. Currently her family is raising pigs and ducks. She hopes to produce about 2 tons of pig meat yearly to market, and to have 200 ducks. After expenses, her daily income is 9.00 USD. Since joining the fund, their business has produced good results and the improvement in their income was quite evident. In 2007, her family saved up enough to buy a tractor to use on their farm, and to plow for others in the local area for a fee. For this loan, her family wishes to borrow 375.00 USD to invest in their animal breeding farm. Their average monthly income is 375.00 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đỗ Thị Thủy 30 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2005. Gia đình chủ yếu sảm xuất nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi, khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi. Hiện tai gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và vịt đẻ hàng năm bình quân gia đình chị xuất ra thị trường khoảng 2 tấn lợn thịt, số vịt đẻ gia đình chị nuôi là 200 con trung bình trừ chi phi mỗi ngày thu nhập 150.000đ. Từ khi tham gia vay vốn đầu tư dự án có hiệu quả nên kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển rõ rệt, năm 2007 gia đình chị đã tích lũy mua được 1 chiếc máy cày phục vụ nông nghiệp và làm dich vụ cày thuê cho bà con trong địa phương. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs farming

loans.name: Duyen

texts.vi:
Ms. H. Thi Duyen is 54 years old, retired military personnel with a stable monthly income. However, she is a hardworking woman and likes to stay active. In 2006 she joined TYM fund to borrow money for a breeding farm, and she chose to raise pigs. Because she is retired, she has a lot of time to invest in the family's pig breeding farm. Her first year in the fund already brought good results right from the first loan. She decided to borrow a higher amount for her second loan,and also invested it in her pig farm.
