The income she made from her pig farm was used to purchase things for their daily lives, and to educate her children. She currently has 2 children in trade school. For this loan, she would like to borrow 550.00 USD to invest in her pig farm. Her average monthly income is 305.00 USD

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hoàng Thị Duyên 54 tuổi là cán bộ về hưu có lương tháng ổn định, nhưng bản thân chị là người phự nữ chịu khó lại luôn thích vân động. Năm 2006 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, chị đã chon mô hình chăn nuôi lợn. Bản thân chị là cán bộ về hưu nên chị có rất nhiều thời gian để đầu tư vào việc chăn nuôi của gia đình. Kết quả cho thấy trong năm đầu tiên chị tham gia vay vốn đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế cao ngay từ vòng vốn ban đầu. Sang vòng vốn thứ hai chị đã mạnh dạn vay mức vốn cao cũng đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, thu nhập từ việc chăn nuôi được chị mua sắm các tiện nghi trong sinh hoạt và đầu tư cho con đi học. Hiện nay chị đang nuôi 2 con học chuyên nghiệp. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs breeding

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine S. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Josephine sells children's clothes and fabric for making clothes, which she has done since 1998. She sells them from a basket that she keeps on her head as she walks from customer to customer. Her husband is currently unemployed.

Josephine uses her income to pay the electricity bill. She will use the loan to purchase more children's wear and fabric. With the new profits from her expanded business, Josephine plans to buy materials for her tie-dye business.

loans.use: To purchase more children's wear and fabric for re-sale

loans.name: Thi Bay

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Bay, 35 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2006. Born in the rural area, she understands that she would face financial problems if her family only relied on farming. Right after she was married, she discussed with her husband to find a business that would stablise their family's economy, and they decided on selling pork. Everyday, her husband goes to the town market to buy pork which her sells at home whiL. Mrs. Bay then sells in the village market, bringing back a daily profit of 150,000VND (about 10USD). Since joining the Fund, her family has had more capital so their business has been even more smooth. Besides, she still has a source of income from farming and raising livestock. This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550.00USD) to further invest in her business. Her family's average monthly income is 6,000,000VND (about 400USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Bảy 35 tuổi. Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2006, xuất thân từ vùng nông thôn nên chị rất hiểu rằng nếu chỉ trông vào nông nghiệp thì kinh tế gia đình sẽ gặp nhiều khó khăn. Ngay từ khi chị lấy chồng chị đã bàn bạc cùng với chồng kiếm một nghề buốn bán để kinh tế gia đình ổn định hợn, vợ chồng chị đã lựa chọn nghề buôn bán thịt lợn, hàng ngày chồng chị đi chợ huyện lấy hàng về chị đem bán tại chợ xã còn anh bán tại thôn nhà công việc buôn bán đều đặn thu nhập bình quân 150.000đ/ ngày. Từ khi vào Qũy vay vốn gia đình chị đã có thêm vốn nên công việc buôn bán của gia đình chị thuận lợi hơn rất nhiều,. Ngoài buôn bán gia đình chị vẫn có nguồn thu nhập từ nông nghiệp và chăn nuôi. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ tiếp tục đầu tư vốn vào buôn bán. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Selling pork

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy T., age 41, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She works selling Khmer cakes and pumping air for motorbike tires. Her husband, Kim That, age 46, is a motor-taxi driver and is able to earn about $5 of profit a day. This couple together has six children, two of whom are married and no longer lives at home. One of their children is a construction worker who builds houses, and earns $2.50 per day.

Mrs. Thy T. would like to loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to purchase a motorbike for her husband to earn extra profit. (Mrs. Thy and her husband are pictured together.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to earn extra profit.

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Dame E. Georgette est née le 22 Décembre 1980 au GABON. Togolaise de nationalité, elle est célibataire sans enfant . Elle réside au BENIN depuis 1993 et à une forte expérience dans la distribution vente. Actuellement, elle a loué une boutique et s'est spécialisée dans la vente des produits de la Société Béninoise de Brasserie (SOBEBRA), des liqueurs, des tissus, du repas prêt à manger et divers produits de consommation courante. Son chiffre d'affaire journalier n'est pas négligeable. Le volume de son activité a augmenté et aujourd'hui elle a des difficultés de trésorerie. Elle vient donc solliciter ce prêt pour satisfaire ses nombreux clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Georgette E. was born on December 22, 1980 in Gabon. She is a citizen of Togo, single and has no children. She has lived in BENIN since 1993 and has a strong experience in the retail business. She is currently renting a shop and specializes in the sale of goods from the Société Béninoise de Brasserie (SOBEBRA), liquor, fabric, ready to eat meals and various every day goods. Her daily sales figure are not insignificant. Her business volume has increased and today she has a cash flow problem. She is requesting this loan to meet her clients demand.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 15 bottles of liquor, 2 boxes of couscous and 5 cases of beer

loans.name: Thi My

texts.vi:
Mrs L. Thi My, 48 years old, is a caretaker in a kindergarten. Her monthly salary is 2,000,000VND (about 133USD), thus her family's finance is quite stabL.. Before joining the TYM Fund, her children were still going to school, so the family's expenditure relied mainly on her salary and that of her husband. In 2004, she joined the TYM Fund to invest in raising livestock to increase her family's income. With this, she was abL. to send her children to university and her family's financial situation improved. Now, her children are already graduated and have stabL. jobs, but she wants to continue raising livestock in a larger scaL. so she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) this time. Her average monthly income is 6,000,000VND (about 400USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chi Lê Thi Mỵ 48 tuôi hiện chị đang là giáo viên mần non lương tháng 2.000.000đ kinh tế gia đình ổn định. Những năm về trước các con chị đang trong độ tuổi ăn học nên việc chi tiêu trong gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào đồng lương của 2 vợ chồng chị. Năm 2004 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi tăng thu nhập cho gia đình. Với việc kết hợp chăn nuôi nên chị đã có điều kiện về kinh tế để đầu tư cho các con chị học đại học. Hiện nay các con chị đã ra trường và có công ăn việc làm ổn định, nguyện vọng của gia đình chị đầu tư chăn nuôi lớn hơn nên vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising livestock

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Mr. B. Phal is a 47-year-old who lives with his wife and one child in Srork Commune, Kampong Cham Province. He grows rice on his farmland in the rainy season, which provides the main income for his family. Phal and his wife work hard every day to support the family. They lack capital to pay for plowing their farmland and to purchase fertilizer for their rice crop. They decided to request a loan for this purpose.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To pay for plowing their farmland and to purchase fertilizer for their rice crop

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris T. is married and has two children. She has received schooling through middle school. Doris sells fabrics for sewing clothing in Cape Coast, which she has done since 1998. She keeps the fabrics in a large basket on her head as she walks around from customer to customer. Her husband is a technician.

Doris uses her income to pay utility bills and expenses for food for her family. Doris will use this loan to purchase more fabrics to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Doris plans to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics for sale

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Bou S., age 27, is married and lives in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has been selling grocery products from her home since 2006 to earn a living and is able to make around $5 in revenue per day. Her husband, Ang You Long, age 25, has a business operating a motor-taxi, earning approximately $5 of profit per day. This couple has two children and all of them are students.

Mrs. Bou S. would like to loan from Kiva via Credit, a local partner, to add to her grocery’s inventory and purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business. (Mrs. Bou S. is pictured with her husband from home.)

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To add to her grocery’s inventory and purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en: Zuhura H. is a married Tanzanian woman. She runs a business selling charcoal at Buguruni just beside Dar es Salaam's city center. Charcoal is the main source of energy in Tanzania and the rest of developing countries. She purchases the charcoal bags from the nearby Mkuranga and Kisarawe Districts and sells them retail at Buguruni. Her business dream is to run an alternative business because charcoal destroys the environment. She needs a loan of $550 to meet her business demand.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.ru:
Gulizor N. lives in the city of Yavan. She lives in one of the more distant villages. She is a housewife. She raises animals and sells milk. She would like to obtain a loan in order to by a machine to make dairy cream. This will allow her to make dairy products including kaymak. She will be able to sells dairy products to her neighbors at a lower price. This will allow her to improve her own situation and help others. She plans to repay the loan within an 8 months period. Gulizor is 46 years old and she has 6 children.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Норова Гулизор жительниц города Яван. Живет в одном из отдаленных кишлаков. Домохозяйка. Занимается животноводством и продажей молока. Хочет получить кредит и купить аппарат для выжимки сливок. Это даст ей возможность производить кисломолочные продукты , а так же каймака. Она сможет продавать производимую продукцию соседям по низким ценам. Таким образом она поможет себе и близким людям. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 8 месяцев.Гулизор 46 лет и унее есть шестеро детей. У нее очень дружная и веселая семья.

loans.use: Purchase a machine to make dairy cream (separator)

loans.name: Thi Nhi

texts.vi:
Mrs. L. Thi Nhi, 44 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2007. Her first loan of 3,000,000VND (about 200USD) was used to invest in doing business and raising livestock. Her business of supplying fresh eels, snakes and frogs for restaurants brings about a high profit of 200,000VND (about 13USD) each day. Apart from doing business, her family also invests in rearing pigs. Currently, she has 8 pigs, so each year she sells out an average of 2 tonnes of pigs, earning high profit. This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550.00USD) to invest in rearing pigs. Her average monthly income is 6,000,000VND (about 400USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Nhị 44 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2007 vòng vốn đầu gia đình chị xin vay 3.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán và chăn nuôi. Với nghề buôn bán đồ tươi sống như lươn, rắn, ếch gia đình chị chuyên cung cấp cho các nhà hàng, đây là một mặt hàng đặc sản nên thu nhập rất cao bình quân mỗi ngày lãi 200.000đ. Ngoài việc buôn bán gia đình chị còn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, hiên tại gia đình chị đang nuôi 8 con lợn thịt bình quân mỗi năm gia đình chị xuất 2 tấn lợn ra thị trường thu nhập từ chăn nuôi của gia đình chị cũng rất cao. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Rearing Pigs

loans.name: Emilie

texts.fr: Née le 05 Janvier 1965 à Cotonou dans la capitale économique du BENIN, dame A. Emilie est mariée. Elle est mère de six enfants dont cinq sont à leur charge. Elle est revendeuse d'escargot et autres produits divers tels que les chaussures, les bijoux et autres depuis trente ans. Actuellement, elle éprouve des difficultés financières liées à l'augmentation du nombre de clients qu'elle sert. Elle sollicite  ce prêt non seulement pour satisfaire la demande pressante de ses clients mais aussi pour élargir son champ d'activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emilie A. was born on January 5, 1965 in Cotonou the economic capital of BENIN. She is married and the mother of six children, five of them are still dependent. For thirty years, she has been selling snails and other various products such as shoes, jewelery and more. She is currently facing financial difficulties related to an increase in the number of customers she is serving. She is requesting this loan, not only to fulfill the pressing demand of her clients but also to broaden her business field.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 15 snail baskets

loans.name: Luong Thi

texts.vi:
Chi Luong Thi H. is 32 years of age. She and her husband reside with her parents, along with 2 small children. Besides working in the field, the family’s main business is mat weaving.  She has been a member since 2005 and was able to obtain an initial loan of 3000 000d in which the family used to buy raw materials for mat making.  She was able to make a profit 2500 000d after this initial loan.  Mat making is not hard work; it’s able to bring a steady income for the family.  The loans she requested and received thereafter were used for her business and some of the money was invested in livestock as well.  The operation of her mat making business has gone smoothly now that the business is stable.   The family is able to produce 5 mats in a day and after all expenses, they are able to profit 150.000d from each mat.  This time she is requesting a loan of 9.000.000d to invest in buying raw materials for mat weaving.  Her family average income is 5.000.000d/month.  Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.
Chị Lường Thi Hạnh 32 tuổi. Vợ chồng chị sống cùng bố mẹ, hai con còn nhỏ ngoài làm ruộng công việc chính của gia đình là dệt chiếu. Năm.2005 tham gia Quỹ với số vốn vay ban đầu 3000 000đ gia đình chị sử dụng mua lác dệt chiếu  kết quả sau 1 vòng vốn khi trừ chi phí thu được 2500 000đ. Công việc làm chiếu không vất vả nhưng cũng đem lại thu nhập giúp kinh tế gia đình chị ổn định hơn. Các vòng vốn sau chị vẫn đầu tư vào làm chiếu kết hợp với việc chăn nuôi. Từ khi có vốn gia đình chị đã thuận lợi hơn trong việc kinh doanh làm chiếu bình quân môi ngày gia đình chị sản xuất 5 chiếc chiếu trừ các khoản chi phí gia đình chị vẫn có lãi 150.000đ. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư dệt chiếu.Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay school fees for her daughter and  also expand her business

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi H. 41 years of age has been a member since 2003. Her very first loan of 2.000.000d was invested in the business of mat weaving. The initial loan used prove to be a success and since been borrowing and obtaining more capital for the business. Her daily income is 150.000d. Presently, her children are grown, the two eldest have jobs of their own bringing in a monthly income of 3.000.000d. She is requesting a loan of 12.000.000d to buy more raw materials for mat making. Her average income is 6.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hà 41 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2003. Vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị xin vay 2000 000đ về đầu tư vào dệt chiếu, nguồn vốn vay anh chị đã quay vòng thấy thuận lợi và có hiệu quả, các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đều vay vốn ở mức cao và đầu tư vào dệt chiếu và cho thu nhập bình quân hàng ngày 150.000đ. Hiên tại các con chị cũng đã lớn, 2 con lớn đã đi làm và cho thu nhâp hàng tháng là 3.000.000đ. Vòng vốn nay gia đình chị xin vay 12.000.000 đầu tư vào buôn bán chiếu. Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi H. is 52 years of age. She has been a member since 2006, the home where her family reside sits on a main road and is a very ideal and convenient location for an auto part store. She was able to borrow 3.000.000 on her first loan, which she used as capital to buy a variety of rubber rope products (timing belts) to sell out of her home; averaging 60.000d/day. After seeing the success of her business, she was able to expand her business, offering products such as automobiles rims and tires. This special inventory demands a higher capital; therefore she is requesting a larger loan amount. The auto part business has been a success; in 2007 she was able to purchase a truck to help aid in transporting her inventory. This time she is requesting a loan of 9.000.000d to use as principal for the new inventory. Her average income is about 7.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng 52 Tuổi. Tham gia Quỹ năm 2006, với địa điểm gia đình chị đang sinh sống gần đường quôc lộ nên rất thuận tiện cho việc kinh doanh. Vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị vay 3.000.000đ để thêm vốn buôn bán dây chun ở thời điểm đó thu nhập bình quân là 60.000đ/ ngày. Quá trình buốn bán phát triển nay gia đình chị đã mở rông mô hình kinh doanh, đầu tư kinh doanh mặt hàng xăm, lốp ô tô. Với mặt hàng kinh doanh này yêu cầu vốn đầu tư lớn nên các vòng vốn sau gia đình chị đều vay ở mức vốn cao. Công việc kinh doanh phát triển nên năm 2007 gia đình chị đã mua được 1 chiếc ô tô vận tải để chủ động trong việc vân chuyển hàng hóa. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng buôn bán. Thu nhập bình quân. 7.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Services

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr: Dame A. Elise est née vers 1968 à BOPA dans le département du MONO. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants que sont Elodie 16 ans et en apprentissage, Natacha 13 ans est au cours secondaire et Lucas est au cours élémentaire 2. Dame A. Elise est revendeuse des tubercules d'igname séchées dont la farine sert à préparer de la pâte appelée au Bénin "TELIBO". Elle sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter son volume d'activité et pour satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elise A. was born around 1968 in BOPA in the department of MONO. She is married and has three children : Elodie, 16 years old, is an apprentice, Natacha, 13 years old, is in secondary school, and Lucas is in elementary school. Mrs. Elise A. is a retailer of dried yam tubers, which can be made into flour and used to make a paste called "TELIBO" in Benin. She is asking for this loan to increase the volume of her business and to satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 bags of dried yam tubers and various other products

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr: Dame A. Florentine est née le 01 Septembre 1982 à Lomé (TOGO). Divorcée, elle est mère d'un enfant; Ronaldo ATALEY âgé de 5 ans et scolarisé. Elle est revendeuse de divers produits de consommation courante dans le marché de Gbégamey qui est l'un des marchés de Cotonou. Elle exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans. Avant cette activité elle faisait la distribution vente. Elle assure seule l'éducation de son enfant et les charges familiales. Le but essentiel de sa demande de crédit est de renforcer sa capacité financière afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mrs.Florentine A. was born on September 1, 1982 in Lomé (TOGO). She is divorced and the mother of one child; Ronaldo ATALEY, 5 years old and attending school. She sells various every day goods in the market in Gbégamey, one of the markets in Cotonou. She has been running this business for 5 years. Before this activity she was in the supply/ sale business. She, alone, provides for the education of her child and for the needs of the family. The essential goal of this loan request is to strengthen her financial ability in order to provide for the needs of her clients.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 bags of rice, one box of canned food, and 2 boxes of pasta

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase construction materials like cement, ballast, timber, etc.

loans.name: Kingniké

texts.fr: Dame A. Kingniké est née vers 1965 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au sud du Bénin. Originaire de la région de l'Ouémé au sud-est du Bénin, elle est mariée à NOUVOESSI Zamba agent de la Société Béninoise de Manutention Portuaire (SOBEMAP). Elle est mère de 3 enfants. Elle vend de l'acajou et s'approvisionne à KILIBO, DASSA et ABOMEY. Elle vend dans les pays de la sous région comme le NIGERIA, le TOGO, ABIDJAN et également dans les marchés locaux de Cotonou. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 25 ans environ et réalise un chiffre d'affaire mensuel moyen de 250 000 francs. Parallèlement à cette activité, elle vend aussi du repas prêt à manger et est à son quatrième crédit à ALIDé. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire davantage ses clients.
texts.en:
Ms. Kingniké A. was born around 1965 in Cotonou, in the county of Littoral in the south of Bénin. Originally from the Ouémé region in the southeast of Bénin, she is married to Zamba NOUVOESSI, an officer of the SOBEMAP [long-shoring society of Benin], and is the mother of three children. She sells cashews and gets her supplies in KILIBO, DASSA, and ABOMEY. She makes sales in the countries of the sub-regions, such as NIGERIA, TOGO, ABIDJAN and also in local marketplaces in Cotonou. She has been in this business for about 25 years and produces monthly sales figures of about 250,000 francs. Concurrent to this business, she also sells ready-to-eat meals and is on her fourth loan with Alidé. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business and to satisfy her customers more.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 sacks of cashew nuts, 100 empty bottles, 2 sacks of cassava flour, and 100 kg of corn.

loans.name: Géronime

texts.fr: Dame N. Géronime est née le 30 Septembre 1961 à Cotonou dans le départment du Littoral. Elle est originaire de la ville historique Ouidah. Mariée, elle est mère de deux enfants; Dieudonné qui est agent des Forces Armées Béninonises (FAB) et Armande qui est revendeuse de divers.  Dame N. Géronime est revendeuse de divers produits de ménage et va s'approvisionner dans le marché de Dantokpa de Cotonou. Elle exerce cette activité depuis quinze ans environ. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour augmenter sa capacité financière et satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. Géronime N. was born on September 30, 1961 in Cotonou in the county of Littoral. She is originally from the historic city of Ouidah. Married, she is the mother of two children: Dieudonné, who is an officer of the FAB [the armed forces of Benin], and Armande, who is a retailer of various goods. Ms. Géronime N. is a retailer of various household goods and is going to gets supplies from the Dantokpa marketplace in Cotonou. She has been in this business for about fifteen years. She is requesting this loan to increase her financial capacity and to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 boxes of detergent, 1 box of condensed milk, 24 cans of sardines, 1 box of pasta, 1 box of soap, and other goods

loans.name: Hekima Group

texts.en:
Tabu has owned a cafe and clothes-sales business in Dar es Salaam since 2002. She is 44 years old, married, and has four children ages 6, 9, 15, and 23. She works daily from 7:00am to 6:00pm, which allows her to earn a monthly profit of approximately $300. She hopes that with this loan, she will be able to buy more goods at bulk rates to sell for a greater profit at her store.

Tabu will share this loan with her fellow group members who also have shops in Dar es Salaam.

loans.use: To buy more goods for business.

loans.name: Upendo (Delete This Enterpreneur) Group

texts.en:
Zena has owned a salon in Dar Es Salaam since 2007. She is 25 years old, married, and has one 7-year-old child. She works daily from 8:00am to 10:00pm at her salon. She is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $150, but she is hoping that taking out this loan will help her to expand her business and increase her profit. She intends to purchase lotions and other items for the salon with the loan.

Zena will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members. Businesses of the group members include charcoal, clothing, and fabric sales.

loans.use: To buy lotion and other items for salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase stock

loans.name: Isabella Mgaya's Upendo Mloganzila Group

texts.en:
Isabella M., 42, is married with four children (ages 22, 18, 11, and 8). She has a general store which she started 4 years ago. She works from 7am to 8pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $87.

Isabella has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to build a small house. She now hopes for a new loan to buy a big stock of rice from upcounty. Isabella will share this loan with her subgroup members with businesses selling cereals, vegetables, chicken feed, and also a food vendor.

In the photo Isabella is 1st on the left.

loans.use: To buy up a large stock of rice from upcountry

loans.name: Flora's Hekima Group

texts.en:
Flora is 44 years old. She is married with 4 children ages 21,15, 12, and 9. She has been a milk and banana seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Flora now hopes for a loan to buy more milk and bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with maize and banana sales, milk and egg sales.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and milk for her business

loans.name: Aïcha

texts.fr:
Aïcha B. is 38, married, and has four children. She would like to develop her small palm oil-selling business. She would like to improve her family’s standard of living and would one day like to build her own store. This is her first loan, and she intends to repay it in six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Aïcha B. 38 ans, est mariée et a 04 enfants en charge. Elle souhaite renforcer son petit commerce d’huile de palme. Elle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et envisage à construire plus tard son propre magasin. Voici son premier prêt qu’elle compte rembourser en une seule échéance au bout de six mois.

loans.use: Develop her small palm oil-selling business

loans.name: Yanina

texts.en:
Yanina is married. She has one son, Maxim. Yanina started a small business motivated by sheer necessity to have a means to live. Today she runs a kiosk selling household items and other small necessities. She has been in business for 12 years. She has about $2400 invested in her business.

Yanina is very sociable and lively. Her efforts, dedication and rich experience of work in the sphere of market trade have helped her keep and expand this business. Her natural talent to get a wide assortment of practical items for sale helps Yanina find her market and be successful in her business. Yanina is requesting a loan to invest in increasing her inventory. She wants to purchase a range of practical items that always sell well. The loan in combination with constant hard work and willingness to serve clients' needs will promote growth of her business and increase of her earnings.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold P. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur engaged in the business of wholesaling and retailing, selling a variety of items including big and small bags. He purchases some items from the wholesale shops in Kariakoo business center, and others are imported from Zanzibar. His business area is at Mchikichini Matching Guy's business center. He need a loan of US$ 1200 to expand his business.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina is an entrepreneur from Kherson where she sells clothing items in the central market. She has been in business for about 6 years. Presently, Dina has about $8000 invested in her business.

Dina is a disciplined and responsible entrepreneur who likes accuracy in her work with clients and order in all business procedures. Dina is very consistent and thorough and handles challenging situations with stunning determination and stamina. She is requesting a 5000 Grivna loan to increase her turnover capital. Dina admits she needs financial support as her business continues to grow and develop. She is hoping to increase assorted inventory and her proceeds as a result. We believe her communication and managing skills will help this client achieve stability and success in business as well as financial independence.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Alima

texts.fr:
Alima K. is married and has three children in her care. She would like a loan that will enable her to bolster her small business selling diverse food items at the market. This work will enable her to improve her family's living conditions and to provide for their needs. She is going repay the loan all at once at then end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

Alima K., est mariée et avec 03 enfants en charge. Elle souhaite un prêt qui lui permettra de renforcer son petit commerce de denrées alimentaires diverses au marché. Cette activité lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et de subvenir à leurs besoins. Elle va rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Commerce in diverse food items for retail sale

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married and lives with her husband in the town of Pavlograd in central Ukraine. After Ludmila had resigned from her last job she couldn't find a new job in her field for a while. Her family was facing a tough financial situation at the time, so she decided to take a risk and start her own small business. Today Ludmila runs a small kiosk selling shoes and clothing in the local market. Currently, she has 4 vending facilities in the same marketplace and about $16,000 invested in inventory.

Ludmila is a determined entrepreneur. She has been in business for about 20 years. She knows how to set goals and achieve them. Ludmila recognizes that financial assistance from "Nadiya Ukraine" has provided significant support for her business and has promoted its stable growth. Ludmila is requesting a loan for 5000 Grivnas to increase her turnover capital, which will allow her to re-supply her inventory and increase her sales. Eventually, Ludmila Anna is hoping to rent a bigger vending facility and open her own little shoe store. She believes that financial assistance in combination with her zeal, perseverance and diligent work will someday help her dream come true.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal footwear and clothing

loans.name: Lyubov

texts.en:
Lyubov is married. She worked for a time as a market vendor. Financial problems brought out her tenacity and innovation, however, and she decided to start her own small business. Today she has a small kiosk selling casual outerwear for women in one of the local markets. Moreover, Lyubov also owns a hairdressing business offering hairstyling services in a location which is very favorable for most of her clients. She has been in this business for about 2 years.

Lyubov is a focused, hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her businesses sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers. Lyubov would like to get a loan for 3000 Grivnas to purchase additional merchandise and re-supply her inventory. She is planning to purchase a variety of clothing items and will significantly expand her clothing trade. Lyubov believes that having an assortment of women's outerwear that is both practical and good quality will increase her sales and offer both warmth and style suitable to any taste and weather.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To purchase necessary merchandise

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr:
Awa S., born in 1963, is married and has six children and one other person in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Keur Khaly, in Thiès, for seven years. She wants to buy shoes, incense, and perfume, and to make clothing to sell. Awa wishes to bolster her business in order to better address the needs of her family and to ensure the schooling of her children. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

Awa S., née en 1963 est mariée avec 06enfants et 01 autre personne en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Keur Khaly à Thiès depuis 7 ans et demi. Elle veut acheter des chaussures, de l’encens, des parfums et confectionner des habits pour vendre. Awa souhaite renforcer son commerce pour mieux faire face aux besoins de sa famille et assurer la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Commerce in shoes, clothing, parfume, and incense

loans.name: Ndèye Anna

texts.fr:
Ndèye Anna D., age 45, is married and has four children and another person in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Keur Khaly, in Thiès, for seven years. She wants to bolster her commerce in sheets, pagnes (colorful African cloth), and cakes. To do so, she is going to buy some cloth for sheets and pagnes and some flour for making cakes to sell. Her income is going to allow her to improve her family's living conditions. She is requesting a loan that will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

Ndèye Anna D., 45 ans, mariée avec 04enfants et 01 autre personne en charge est membre du banc villageois de Keur Khaly à Thiès depuis 7 ans. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de draps,de pagne et de gâteaux. Pour cela, elle va acheter des tissus pour les draps et pagnes et de la farine pour faire les gâteaux et vendre. Ses revenus vont lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Commerce in sheets, pagnes, and cakes

loans.name: Ndèye Ndioro

texts.fr:
Ndèye Ndioro F., age 44 ans, is married and has four children, plus four other persons in her care. She has been a member of the village bank of Keur Khaly, in Thiès, for three and a half years. She is the manager of a game arcade (foosball, video games). She wants a loan to buy a role-playing video game and to address operating costs, such as electricity. Her income is going to enable her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan that she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

Ndèye Ndioro F., 44 ans, mariée avec 04enfants et 04 autres personnes en charge est membre du banc villageois de Keur Khaly à Thiès depuis 3 ans et demi. Elle est gérante d’une salle de jeux. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter une maquette de jeu et faire face aux dépenses de fonctionnement comme l’électricité. Ses revenus vont lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy a role-playing video game

loans.name: Roy

texts.es:
Roy is 30 years old and is the father of a two-year-old son, named Joseph, who means everything to Roy. He has a wife, Cintia, who supports him as much as possible in his business. He buys and sells rounded and crafted logs; this work takes up most of his day. Sometimes, in order to obtain the wood, he has to travel to different towns by river, which can take 2 or 3 days. He likes that his work allows him to earn a good income so that he can live peacefully and without worries. It is, however, difficult for him to have to travel for long periods of time. Roy work for his daily expenses and for the nourishment of his young son. With the money from the loan, Roy wants to build a place near his home where he can store and sell his wood.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Roy, de 30 años es padre de un hijo de 2 añitos, de nombre Joseph, que es todo para él. Tiene a su esposa Cintia quien lo apoya en lo posible en su negocio. Se dedica a la compra y venta de madera rolliza y trabajada, esta labor le ocupa casi todo el día. A veces para conseguir la madera tiene que viajar hasta los diferentes caseríos, por río en un lapso de 2 o 3 días. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera buenos ingresos para vivir tranquilo y sin preocupaciones. Lo difícil es tener que viajar por largas temporadas. Roy trabaja para sus gastos diarios y la alimentación de su pequeño. Con el dinero del préstamo quiere mandar a construir un local junto a su vivienda para almacenar y vender su madera.

loans.use: To set up a place to store the wood that he sells

loans.name: Winefred

texts.en:
Winefred B. is a fishmonger who buys fresh fish and then processes it for sale. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Winefred and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores is 42 years old; she is single and is the mother of 3 adult children, who live with her and support her a lot. She sells beauty products and plastics, like trays, chairs, tables, pitchers, glasses, etc. She takes these products and sells them in different places; her clients pay her either on credit or with cash. Dolores and her children work all day. She likes that her work allows her to get to know many people with whom she shares ideas about business. Dolores requests this loan so that she can increase her supply of products and rent a place to sell her goods.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Dolores tiene 42 años, es soltera, madre de 3 hijos ya adultos, que viven con ella y la apoyan mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y la venta de plásticos (bandejas, sillas, mesas, jarras, vasos y otros), estos productos, los lleva a vender por los diferentes lugares, dejándolos al crédito o al contado a sus clientes. Trabaja todo el día junto a sus hijos. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce a mucha gente con quienes comparte ideas de negocio. Dolores pide este préstamo para implementarse con más productos y alquilar un local para la venta de estos.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise and rent a place where she can sell her goods

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, who is 50 years old, has 6 children, all of whom are professionals and are independent. At present, she lives only with her husband Daniel who is a carpenter and supports her wholly. She sells different varieties of food, like French fries with sausage, “juanes,” fish wrapped in leaves, and other regional plates. This activity is carried out outside the house, in a place that is very busy and crowded. She has already spent 7 years in this job. She also the owner of a three-wheeler that her husband drives; he is in charge of its maintenance. She only sells her food at night. She is pleased when people taste her food and tell others about its good flavor. With the money from the loan, she will buy tables and chairs so that her clients are more comfortable. Later, she hopes to buy carp for protection from the rain.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz (50 años) tiene 6 hijos, todos ya profesionales e independientes. En la actualidad solo vive con su esposo Daniel que se dedica a la carpintería y la apoya en todo. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en distintas variedades: salchipapas, juanes, pescado envuelto en hoja y otros platos regionales. Esta actividad la realiza fuera de su casa, en un lugar muy transitable y concurrido, tiene ya 7 años en esta labor. También es propietaria de un motocarro que maneja su esposo y es quien se encarga de su mantenimiento. Ella sólo vende por la noches, le gusta que mucha gente deguste de su comida y difundan a otros de su buena sazón. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará mesas y sillas para dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes, posteriormente, desea comprarse una carpa para protegerse de la lluvia.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs so that her dinner guests are more comfortable

loans.name: Alira

texts.es:
Alira is the mother of four children, who love her a lot. They are still students and are her reason to improve. She lives with her husband, who is a welder. Alira sells beauty products and children’s clothes. She travels to sell these products at different places in her area. This business was started six years ago and is going well. What she likes about her work is that she is able to generate good income so that she can go forward and support her children in their studies and in any other possible way. The most difficult thing is walking to sell her products. She wants to invest the money that she is requesting so that she can buy more products. Later, she wants to buy herself a three-wheeler to mobilize herself.

Translated from Spanish by A. Shah, Kiva Volunteer.

Alira es madre de 4 hijos que la quieren y aman mucho, ellos son aún estudiantes y su razón de superación. Ella vive junto a su esposo Celso, quien es soldador. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa para niños, lleva a vender estos productos por los diferentes lugares de su zona, este negocio lo viene realizando desde hace 6 años y le va muy bien. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le genera ingresos propicios para salir adelante y apoyar a sus hijos en lo posible, en sus estudios. Lo más difícil para ella es llevar a vender sus productos caminando. Quiere invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de más productos, posteriormente quiere comprase un motocarro para movilizarse.

loans.use: To expand the merchandise that she sells

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra has a restaurant (the space is rented) that sells roasted and fried chicken. Her assistant is her older sister. Sandra is a single mother of a 4 year old child as her husband abandoned her many years ago. Sandra lives in her parent’s house (located in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone in the city of El Alto). She is applying for a loan to purchase as industrial store which would improve the quality of her food and increase her number of clients. This is her first loan with Kiva, and the evaluation carried out allows us to approve her loan application.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Sandra tiene un restaurante (el local es alquilado) que vende pollos al spiedo y brosther (pollo crocante), su ayudante es su hermana menor. La propietaria es madre soltera de un niño de 4 años, su pareja la abandonó hace muchos años. Sandra vive en la casa de sus padres (ubicada en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de El Alto) Solicita crédito para comprar una cocina industrial, lo que mejorará la calidad de su comida y aumentar el número de sus clientes. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, la evaluación realizada nos permite aprobar su solicitud de préstamo.

loans.use: To buy work tool (industrial stove)

loans.name: Javier Carlos

texts.es:
Javier M. is an illustrator and he makes small notebooks with drawings to color designed for children between 3 and 6 years old. His wife is a seasonal clothing vendor and both activities are their principal income sources with which they support their children ages 4 and 6. Their home is located in the zone of San José de Yunguyo (city of El Alto). Javier applies for this loan to acquire the raw material (paper, ink) and satisfy market demand, which will allow him to increase his income. This is his first loan with Kiva and he qualified favorably in our evaluation which is why he has access to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Javier M. es graficador, elabora pequeños cuadernos con dibujos para colorear destinado a niños de 3 a 6 años. Su esposa es comerciante de ropa por temporadas, ambas actividades son sus principales fuentes de ingreso con las que cubren la manutención de sus hijos de 4 y 6 años de edad, su vivienda esta ubicada en la zona de San José de Yunguyo (ciudad de El Alto). Javier solicita crédito para adquirir materia prima (papel, tinta) y satisfacer la demanda de su mercado, lo que permitirá que se incrementen sus ingresos. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, calificó favorablemente en nuestra evaluación por lo que puede acceder al crédito.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Gilda

texts.es:
Gilda is a single mother, she is 51 years old, and has 4 children, who are now adults and work and live with her.
She works selling candy and sodas beverages, in the morning she sells from her home, in the afternoons she sells on different zones of Pucallpa. She has been working on this since she was 16 years old. She likes her job very much because thanks to it, she raised her kids and it keeps her active. She works all day and business is good.
With the money she is requesting, she wants to acquire more candy and build a portable kiosk that would be easier to move from place to place.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Gilda es madre soltera, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos, los mismos que ya son adultos, trabajan y viven con ella. Ella se dedica a la venta de golosinas y bebidas heladas (gaseosas), por las mañanas vende en su domicilio, y por las tardes los lleva a vender por las diferentes zonas de Pucallpa. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 16 años. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque gracias al mismo, sacó adelante a sus hijos y sobre todo porque la mantiene activa. Ella trabaja todo el día y le va bien en su negocio. Con el dinero que solicita, quiere adquirir más golosinas y mandar a construir un kiosco que pueda ser fácil de trasladar de un lugar a otro.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of products she sells and buy a portable kiosk / Incrementar la cantidad de los productos que vende y comprar un kiosco.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is an unsalaried baker and it is the only job with which he supports his three children. He is divorced and his house is located in the Villa Ingenio zone of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy construction material (tiles, stucco and cement). He plans to finish building his kitchen and put a roof his house so that the rains do not inconvenience him. This is his first loan with Kiva and our evaluation revealed positive results, which is why he can access the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Antonio es un panadero asalariado, es el único trabajo con el que cubre la manutención de sus tres hijos. Es divorciado y su casa esta ubicada en la zona de Villa Ingenio de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito será usado para comprar material de construcción (tejas, estuco y cemento), él planea terminar de construir su cocina y techar su casa para que las lluvias no lo incomoden. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, nuestra evaluación reveló resultados positivos y por eso puede acceder al préstamo.

loans.use: Home Repairs

loans.name: Licenia

texts.es:
Licencia and her husband Pedro are parents of 7 children who are now independent and have their own families, they had fixed their house so they can all live together, but keeping each family’s privacy.
Licencia works selling regional vegetables, fruits and other products, she, with her big smile and kindness provides good attention to her clients, who are satisfied with Licencia’s products. She has a space on her house where she keeps her business, where she works all day, she has 16 years working on this activity and until now it has brought her good income. She likes her job because she gets to know lots of people; they like her very much and talk about several subjects.
Licencia is asking for a loan to extent her business and later on build a portable kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Licenia y su esposo Pedro son padres de 7 hijos que ya son independientes y de familia, han acondicionado su casa para que puedan vivir todos juntos, pero respetando la privacidad de cada familia. Licenia se dedica a la venta de verduras regionales, frutas y otros productos, ella, con su gran sonrisa y amabilidad da una buena atención a sus clientes, quienes se van satisfechos con los productos de Licenia. Tiene un espacio en su vivienda donde está su negocio, al que dedica todo el día, lleva ya 16 años en esta labor y hasta ahora le ha traído buenos ingresos económicos. Le gusta su trabajo porque conoce mucha gente, la cual le tiene mucho cariño y conversan de muchos temas. Licenia pide este préstamo porque quiere ampliar su negocio y posteriormente mandar a construir un kiosco.

loans.use: To increase her investment capital to extent her business / Incremento de su capital de inversión para la ampliación de su negocio.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José, is 42 years old and is a single father, he is a teacher of elementary school, has 2 wonderful kids who study and help him on his business.
For the past 2 years he has dedicated to provide service with an internet cafe, because it is near by a high school most of his clients are students. José is very active and hard worker, this is why he wants so much to keep on with this business because it seams very profitable to him, besides working as teacher on the school.
He works to pay for his regular expenses and his children’s education.
His goal is to keep on growing his business; he wants to invest the money on extending his space, because it is very small.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

José, de 42 años de edad es padre soltero, es profesor de educación primaria, tiene dos hijos maravillosos que estudian y lo apoyan en su negocio. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a brindar servicios de cabinas públicas de Internet, a razón de estar cerca de un colegio y son los alumnos en su mayoría, sus clientes. José es muy activo y trabajador, por eso que tiene esas ganas de seguir adelante en este negocio ya que le parece muy rentable, aparte trabaja como profesor en una institución educativa. Trabaja para solventar los gastos diarios de su hogar y por la educación de sus hijos. El objetivo de José es seguir creciendo en su negocio, quiere invertir el dinero en ampliar su local, ya que es muy pequeño.

loans.use: Extent the space where he has an internet cafe / Ampliación del local donde tiene cabinas públicas de Internet.

loans.name: Santos Rosendo

texts.es:
Santos works buying plastic tubes in order to cut them into small pieces and shape them in the forms of T, Y, L. These serve for sewer connections and the finished product is sold in large quantities in the stores of the El Rosario Santos area. He is single and lives in the area of Tembladerani (city of La Paz) in his parents’ house. His loan will be directed toward the purchase of a greater quantity of tubes, which will allow him to reduce costs. It is the second time that he has applied for a loan through Impro as well as Kiva. His credit history favors him very much as he is qualified as client 1, meaning that he makes all of his payments punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva volunteer.

Santos se ocupa en comprar tubos plásticos para cortarlos en pequeños pedazos y moldearlos en forma de T, Y, L. Esto sirve para las conexiones de alcantarillado, el producto terminado se vende en grandes cantidades a las tiendas de la zona de El Rosario Santos es soltero y vive en la zona de Tembladerani (ciudad de La Paz), en la casa de sus padres. El crédito será destinado para comprar mayor cantidad de tubos, lo que le permitirá reducir sus costos. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito, tanto en Impro como en Kiva. Su historial le favorece bastante, esta calificado como cliente 1, lo que quiere decir que paga puntualmente todas sus cuotas.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José drives “trufi 1” (a trufi is a taxi with a fixed route), traveling from the southern zone to the center of the city of La Paz. He is single and lives with his parents in the El Pedregal zone (La Paz). The loan would be used for the maintenance of his vehicle and to purchase tires. This is the third time he seeks a loan through IMPRO, having settled his previous loans in a satisfactory manner. His previous history allows him access to this credit, as it will be a great help to him and increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

José es chofer del trufi 1 (trufi es un taxi con ruta fija), su recorrido abarca desde la zona sur hasta el centro de la ciudad de La Paz. Es soltero y vive en la casa de sus padres, zona de El Pedregal (La Paz). El crédito será destinado para el mantenimiento completo de su vehiculo y la compra de llantas. Es la tercera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el cumplimiento en los anteriores préstamos fue bueno. Sus antecedentes e historial le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que será de gran ayuda y aumentará sus ingresos.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Emeldina

texts.es:
Emeldina is 34 years old and lives in the neighborhood Villa Venezuela. She is single and has no kids yet. She sells herbal medicine in the area where she lives and the people there demand these products a lot; some because of their beliefs as they think it cures faster than conventional medicine. She will invest the solicited credit in buying products for the herbal medicines to satisfy her clients demands.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Emeldina tiene 34 años de edad, habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela, es soltera y aún no tiene hijos. Se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales naturales, hace 8 años en conjunto con su hermana inició el negocio de la venta de medicina natural, en el barrio donde ella habita la gente demanda mucho esos productos ya que por creencia de algunos de ellos, creen que curan más rápido que la medicina convencional. El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de productos medicinales naturales para así satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy natural products/Compra de productos naturales

loans.name: Micaela Marcia

texts.es:
Micaela works as a legal assistant at a law firm. She is single and has no children, but she also receives no assistance with her educational costs, food or other expenses.

She lives with her parents in the Alto Sopocachi zone of the city of La Paz.

The loan would be used to work on her thesis for a law degree, which will allow her to graduate and find a job that will pay better.

This is the second time she asks for a loan through IMPRO, and her history qualifies her as a top client. In other words, she makes her payments on time which is why she can have access to the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Micaela P. trabaja como asistente legal en un bufete de abogados. Es soltera, no tiene hijos pero no recibe ningún tipo de ayuda al momento de pagar sus estudios, alimentación y otros gastos. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la zona de Alto Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz, vive en la casa de sus padres. El crédito será destinado para elaborar su tesis de grado (carrera de Derecho), lo que le permitirá graduarse y buscar un trabajo mejor remunerado. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, el historial le califica como cliente 1 es decir que cumple puntualmente con las cuotas de pago, por eso puede acceder al préstamo.

loans.use: Educational expenses.

loans.name: Inés

texts.es:
Ines R. is a single mother of 3 kids, 2 of whom work and support her financially, while the youngest is studying in primary school. She is 46 years old and lives in the neighborhood Villa Venezuela where she has a small grocery store in her house. She has had this business for 16 years and this means she has a lot of clients, all neighbors of hers form where she lives. The demand from her clients grows each day, and this is why she sees the need to invest in her business and to stock it with the necessary products. The loan she has asked for is to buy dairy products and bread as these are everyday products that she sells most of. Her plan is to keep working so she can support her son in his studies and to make him a professional in society.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Inés R. es madre soltera de 3 hijos, de los cuales 2 están trabajando y la apoyan económicamente, el menor de ello está estudiando la educación primaria. Tiene 46 años, habita en el barrio Villa Venezuela, donde tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación. Tiene 16 años de tener este negocio, lo cual le ha permitido hacerse de una cantidad considerable de clientes, todos ellos vecinos de la zona donde habita. La demanda de productos de sus vecinos crece día a día, es por eso que ella se ha visto en la necesidad de invertir en su negocio para abastecerlo de los productos necesarios. El préstamo solicitado es para compra de productos lácteos y de panadería ya que por ser de consumo diario necesita tener mayor inventario de éstos. Sus planes son contar siempre trabajo para seguir apoyando a su hijo en los estudios y formar un profesional para la sociedad

loans.use: To buy dairy products and bread/Compra de productos lácteos y panadería

loans.name: Anna

texts.fr:
Anna F. is married and the mother of three children in her care. She wants to increase her capital for cattle feed and, at the same time, work in the small-scale commerce of ice and ice cream that is very profitable during this period of high heat. She wishes to ensure a good future for her children and in this way to meet family needs, particularly in terms of health and schooling. She intends to repay the loan all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

Anna F. est mariée et mère de 03 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle veut augmenter son capital d’embouche bovine et en même temps faire un petit commerce de glaces et de crèmes glace très fructueuse en cette période de forte chaleur. Elle souhaite assurer un bon avenir à ses enfants et subvenir ainsi aux besoins familiaux plus particulièrement de santé et de scolarisation). Elle compte rembourser en une seule échéance au bout de six mois .

loans.use: Feed for pigs and simultaneously the sale of ice cream

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.fr:
Mr. Moustapha D. is a trained upholsterer with more than 30 years' experience. He is married and the father of three children. He was granted a Kiva loan that he repaid without difficulty. He is asking for this loan with a view to buying raw materials for his upholstery business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

mr moustapha D. est un tapissier de profession de plus de trente années d'expérience .il est marié et père de trois enfants .il a eu à bénéficier d'un pret kiva qu'il a soldé sans difficulté .il demande ce pret dans le but de s'approvisionner en matières premières pour la tapisserie.

loans.use:
purchase of materials for upholstering furniture

achat de matériels de tapisserie

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yadira is 40 years old and lives in the neighborhood Reparto Shick, one of the biggest business towns in Managua. She is married and has 2 kids, her husband works selling lubricants. 10 years ago Yadira decided to start a small business selling clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and this business has grown and changed a lot. She has made big sacrifices and has had to learn to administrate her business to maintain it. As part of its continued growth Yadira will invest in buying more merchandise to satisfy the various needs of her clients. She will keep on encouraging her kids so they can be professionals one day and have a good life with their families.

Translated by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Yadira tiene 40 años de edad, habita en el barrio Reparto Shick, uno de los barrios con más movimiento comercial de la ciudad de Managua. Es casada, tiene 2 hijos, su esposo trabaja en un negocio de venta de lubricantes y vulcanización. Hace 10 años Yadira decidió empezar un pequeño negocio de venta de mercadería variada como ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, negocio que con el pasar del tiempo ha ido creciendo y ha diversificado mucho. Ella cuenta que ha tenido que hacer grandes sacrificios y sobre todo aprender a administrar su negocio para que éste se haya podido mantener. Como parte de su continuo crecimiento Yadira invertirá en la compra de más mercadería para así satisfacer los diversos gustos de sus clientes. Seguirá animando a sus hijos para que éstos puedan convertirse algún día en profesionales y puedan tener una vida digna junto a sus familias.

loans.use: To buy different sorts of merchandise to invest in the business/Compra de mercadería variada para inversión de su negocio

loans.name: Llane

texts.es:
Llane, is 37 years old and has 4 children who are studying and are her happiness. She lives with her husband Leopoldo, who works at a sawmill.
Llane provides very good attention to her clients on her small grocery store where she sells first necessity products, but she not just works on this, she also rents rooms and creates art on clothes, all this helps her very much on her daily expenses. She has been working at her grocery store for the past 4 years and works at it almost all day.
Llane wants to improve the environment of her business, extent it and stock it, later on fix some of the rooms she rents and provide better attention to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Llane, (37 años) tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando y son su mayor alegría. Ella vive con su esposo Leopoldo, quien trabaja como empleado en un aserradero. Dar una buena atención es la actividad diaria que tiene Llane, tiene una pequeña bodega de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad, pero no solo se dedica a esto, sino también al alquiler de habitaciones y al arte textil, lo que le ayuda mucho en sus gastos diarios. Esta actividad la viene realizando desde hace 4 años y atiende casi todo el día en su bodega. Llane tiene el deseo de mejorar los ambientes de su negocio, ampliarlo e implementarlo, posteriormente mandar a refaccionar algunos pormenores las habitaciones que alquila y desde luego brindar una mejor acogida a sus clientes.

loans.use: Extent and improve her grocery store / Ampliación y mejora del espacio de su bodega.

loans.name: Alejandra Virginia

texts.es:
Alejandra started her business selling tortillas and boiled beans. Thanks to good administration she has been able to move forward and put a small grocery store in her house. Even so, this has been very hard as she has not always had enough money to stock her store, and this is why she would like credit; to buy basic grains and products for the home which are the most sort after things in her neighborhood, Rene Cisneros in Managua. Alejandra is 45 and her life partner is a plumber and supports her with the household costs. They have 5 kids and get help from 2 of them who work. They hope the family will move forward and improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Alejandra empezó a ser comerciante con el negocio de ventas de tortillas y frijoles cocidos, gracias a su buena administración pudo salir adelante y poner una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación aunque ha sido muy difícil porque no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder abastecer la pulpería, por eso recurre al crédito ya que con ese dinero comprará granos básicos y productos para el hogar, que son los que más necesita porque son más demandados por sus vecinos del barrio René Cisneros de Managua. Alejandra tiene 45 años de edad, su compañero de vida es fontanero y la apoya con los gastos del hogar. Tiene 5 hijos de los cuales recibe el apoyo de dos de ellos quienes ya están trabajando, y esperan como familia poder salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

loans.use: To buy basic grain and products for the home/Compra de granos básicos, productos para el hogar

loans.name: Gora

texts.fr:
Mr. Gora D. is a merchant who lives in the Kaossara district in Thies. He is married and is the father of three children. He has more than 17 years' experience in selling groceries in a shop in the Randoulène-sud district. It is with a view to bolstering his business capital that he is requesting this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

mr gora D. est un commerçant qui vit au quartier kaossara à thies.il est marié et père de trois enfants .il a une expérience de plus de 17 ans dans le commerce de produits alimentaires dans une boutique au quartier randoulène sud.c'est dans le but de renforcer son fonds de roulement qu'il sollicite ce pret.

loans.use:
additional capital for his general store

commerce de denrées alimentaires

loans.name: Maimouna Badiane

texts.fr:
Maimouna Badiane M. is a trained hair stylist, single and with no children. She has been working in this trade for more than 4 years. She is requesting this loan with the intention of buying equipment for her beauty salon.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

maimouna badiane M. est une coiffeuse de profession , elle est célibataire sans enfants et exerce ce métier depuis plus de quatre ans .elle sollicite ce pret dans le but d'acheter du matériel pour son salon de coiffure.

loans.use:
purchase equipment for her beauty salon

coiffure

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Two years ago Carmen was a wandering saleswoman selling clothes; she sold her products from house to house. She started with only a bit of merchandise, mainly women's tops. As time has gone on her sales have increased and with her earnings she has been able to invest more in her business, and a year ago she rented a small stall in the Villa Nueva Market. Now she needs more capital to keep investing in her business and earn more.

Carmen asked for a loan from FAPE to invest in some men's and women's trousers, also in underwear and clothes for all the family. She wants to have a better business, better earnings and to give her kids and her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen hace dos años era una vendedora de ropa ambulante, vendía sus productos de casa en casa, empezó su negocio con poca mercadería principalmente blusas para mujeres. Con el paso del tiempo sus ventas fueron creciendo y con las ganancias pudo invertir mas en su negocio, hace un año tuvo la idea de alquilar un local comercial, el cual esta situado en el Mercado de Villa Nueva. Ahora ella necesita más capital para poder seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y tener más ganancias. Por eso Carmen solicito un préstamo a FAPE, para poder invertir en comprar pantalones para hombre y mujer, también para ropa interior, y ropa para toda la familia... Ella quiere tener un mejor negocio, tener mejores ingresos y así darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijas y su familia.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothes for her clothes selling business/Compra de mas variedad de ropa, para su negocio de venta de ropa.

loans.name: Julia Justina

texts.es:
Mrs Julia P. is a 51 year old woman living in barrio 380 in Managua. She is divorced, with a 19 year old daughter and a 7 year old son. The children's father provides support for them. She has a small store in a room in her home, which she began 7 years ago by selling ice and ice cream. She used her last loan to improve her home, and she will use this loan to improve her business. With the money that she is requesting she plans to purchase basic grains and cleaning products to stock her business and to meet the needs of her customers in the neighborhood. This is a very poor neighborhood, and people purchase their daily needs in the small stores. For this reason,Juila must keep her store stocked with products so that her customers do not lose faith in her.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Julia P. tiene 51 años de edad, habita en el barrio 3-80 de Managua, es divorciada, tiene una hija de 19 años de edad y un niño de 7 años de edad, el papá le apoya en la manutención de sus dos hijos. Tiene una pulpería en su casa de habitación, la cual desde hace 7 años ha venido administrando, la cual empezó con ventas de hielo y helados. El crédito anterior fue usado para mejoras de su hogar pero éste será usado en la mejora de su negocio, con el dinero solicitado comprará granos básicos y productos de limpieza para abastecer su negocio y satisfacer las demandas de sus vecinos del barrio. Este barrio es un barrio pobre, la manera de vivir de la gente es comprar en las pulperías las necesidades del día, es por eso que Julia necesita tener su pulpería llena de sus productos para así no quedar mal a sus clientes.

loans.use: Purchase of basic grains and cleaning products

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth C. is a 33 year old young woman who lives in the Hialeah neighborhood of Managua. She and her husband, who works cleaning rooms, have an 8 year old daughter. Each of them work hard every day to give her a better life. Elizabeth has worked taking in outside laundry and ironing for the last 4 years. She began working when she saw the need to help her husband with the household expenses, and alsobecause she wanted to finish building their home. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials which they will be used to build a room for their daughter, to give her greater comfort and privacy. Elizabeth hopes to find better work which will help her progress in life.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth C. es una joven de 33 años, habita en el barrio Hialeah de Managua, es casada, su esposo es recamarero, tienen una niña de 8 años de edad, por la que trabajan diariamente para darle una vida mejor. Elizabeth trabaja lavando y planchando ajeno, hace 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Se vio en la necesidad de buscar trabajo para apoyar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, y porque también querían terminar de construir su hogar. El préstamo será usado para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto para su pequeña hija y así darle comodidad y mayor privacidad. Elizabeth espera poder encontrar un mejor trabajo que le permita desarrollarse en la vida

loans.use: Construction of a room for her daughter

loans.name: Manuela Isabel

texts.es:
Manuela is a 38 year old married woman who lives in barrio 380. She has two children, ages 8 and 13. Her husband works in security services and provides for the expenses of the home. Maunuela sells tortillas and boiled beans - a business that she started with her own money 4 years ago to help out with family expenses. With the money that she is requesting from this loan, she will invest in infrastructure - purchasing construction material to add on to a bedroom in order to improve conditions. She plans on eventually opening a small store, finishing work on her home, and allowing her children to get an education.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Manuela tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380, es casada, y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 13 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en servicios de seguridad y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Doña Manuela vende tortillas y frijoles cosidos, tiene cuatro años de experiencias y comenzó con dinero propio para aportar a los gastos de la familia. Con el préstamo que está solicitando es para infraestructura, para comprar materiales de construcción para realizar una extensión de una habitación, para estar en mejores condiciones. Sus planes son poder llegar a tener una pulpería, terminar de construir su casa y brindar estudios a sus hijos.

loans.use: Addition to a bedroom

loans.name: José Oswaldo

texts.es:
Jose is a married 20 year old man who lives n barrio 380. His wife is a homemaker. Jose works for a private company as a sales representative, a position that he has held for one year. His wife is pregnant with their first child, which will be born in a few months. For this reason, Jose would like to build onto his home to improve their quality of life for the new baby. With the money that he is requesting, he will build a room onto their home so that they can be more comfortable. In the future, Jose would like to save enough money to open a beauty salon that his wife would run.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

José tiene 20 años de edad, habita en el barrio 380, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa. Don José trabaja en una empresa privada desempeñándose como ejecutivo de ventas tiene un año de estar laborando. La esposa de José está embarazada su bebé nacerá en pocos meses, por lo que desea construir su hogar para darle mejor calidad de vida a su bebé. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para hacer un cuarto en su vivienda para estar más cómodos. Desea en un futuro reunir capital para poner un salón de belleza para que lo administre su esposa.

loans.use: Construction of a room.

loans.name: Shouman

texts.en: S., a 48-years-old married man, lives with his wife and 2 children in Baalbek, located in the Bekaa valley. S. sells second-hand clothes. The loan he is requesting, USD 1200, will be used to purchase a wider variety of merchandise to diversify the selection he can offer to his clients. This is the first time S. has requested a loan from Al Majmoua; his background makes him a good candidate for a loan.

loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of merchandise

loans.name: Shealan

texts.en: Shealan, 31 years old and single, lives in Baalbek, located in the Bekaa valley. Shealan is the owner of a pastry shop. He always looks for a way to improve his business and therefore has been able to grow a good base of loyal customers. The loan he is asking for, USD 1000, is to purchase raw materials and thereby diversify his inventory of goods. This is the first time that Shealan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to diversify the inventory of goods presented in the pastry shop

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel, presently single, lives in Baalbek, a town located in the Bekaa valley. Kamel is the owner of a shop that sells air conditioning split units. 

Kamel decided to get married a couple of months ago. He would like to borrow USD 1,000 to cover the wedding expenses. This is the first time Kamel has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: Cover wedding expenses

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad, 24 years old, is the father of two children who are his inspiration and motivation to move forward. Ahmad is the owner of a grocery store.

Ahmad needs a loan for the amount of USD 1,200 to purchase a wider variety of merchandise to offer a wider choice to his customers and therefore expand his business. This is the first time Ahmad has requested a loan from A. Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase a wider variety of merchandise to offer a wider choice

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es:
Bibiana is single and 36 years old, she has a son who loves her very much. She lives in her parent’s house, they help her with her business.
Bibiana works daily selling beauty products, she works for three lines selling by catalogues, she is a very high spirited woman, and what she sets her mind on she conquers.
This is why she decided to start this business, because it seams profitable to her, she works all day and has one year on this business. What she likes the most is to socialize with other people. Business is good and currently she is leader on one of the lines she works for. Bibiana works to help her parents with daily expenses and for her son’s education.
With the loan she is asking, she wants to improve her business, and buy a showcase to keep in good condition her products and to exhibit them.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Bibiana es soltera, tiene 36 años, es madre de un hijo que la ama mucho. Ella vive en casa de sus padres quienes le dan la mano en su negocio. La venta de productos de belleza es el trabajo diario que tiene Bibiana, trabaja para tres líneas de productos de belleza por catálogo, es una mujer de armas tomar y lo que se propone, lo cumple. Por eso, decidió incursionar en este negocio, ya que le parece rentable, trabaja todo el día desde hace ya un año. Lo que más le gusta es socializar con otras personas. Le va muy bien, actualmente ya es líder de una de las líneas para quien trabaja. Bibiana trabaja para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos diarios y para la educación de su hijo. Con el dinero que solicita quiere implementar más su negocio, así como también comprar una vitrina para tener en una buena condición y exhibición sus productos.

loans.use: Stock products and buy a showcase to exhibit her beauty products / Implementación de mercadería y compra de una vitrina para la conservación y exhibición de sus productos de belleza.

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
Rocio is 38 years old and has 3 children who study and support her very much. She lives with her husband Claudio who supports her too in her business.
She works selling books on different places in her city, for the past 25 years, she sells them cash or on layaway, her husband is one in charge of taking the books to the clients, while she takes care of collecting the money. She works all day, including Sundays and holidays. What she likes the most is that she knows several places, people and generates good income.
Rocio works to cover her family expenses and to provide education to her children.
The loan she is asking is to rent a place to sell her books.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.
