Rocio, de 38 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos quienes estudian y la apoyan mucho. Ella vive junto con su esposo Claudio quien la apoya mucho en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de variedades de libros, los vende por los diferentes lugares de su ciudad, esto ya hace 25 años; dejándolos al crédito o al contado, su esposo es el encargado de llevar los pedidos a los clientes, mientras que ella se dedica a la cobranza de los mismos. Trabaja todo el día, incluido domingos y feriados. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares, personas y le genera buenos ingresos. Rocío trabaja para solventar sus gastos familiares y la educación de sus hijos. El monto que solicita en préstamo es para alquilar un local para vender sus libros cómodamente.

loans.use: To rent a space to sell her books / Alquiler de un local para la venta de sus libros.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys, 26, is the mother of two marvelous school-age boys who are her reason for being. She lives with her husband Jonás, who works as a chauffeur. She has been selling clothing and shoes for a long time. Gladys gets up very early to get everything ready before going to sell her products in different locations in her area. She runs the business for nine months a year selling her products every day and sometimes already gives credit to reliable people. Gladys and Jonás work very carefully to ensure their children’s happiness and see them become professionals one day and be able to support their families. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy merchandise and, in the near future, she wants to rent a location for selling her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva volunteer.

Gladis, de 26 años es madre de 2 hijos maravillosos que están estudiando y son su razón de ser. Ella vive junto a su esposo Jonás que trabaja como chofer. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace mucho tiempo. Se levanta muy temprano a preparar todo, para luego llevar a vender sus prendas a los diferentes lugares de su zona. Lleva en este negocio 9 meses, vende todo el día y a veces deja a crédito cuando las personas son de confianza. Gladys y su esposo trabajan con mucho esmero para ver felices a sus hijos y que en un mañana sean profesionales y puedan solventar los gastos de sus futuras familias. Con el dinero que solicita quiere adquirir mercadería, y en un futuro cercano, alquilar un local para la venta de sus prendas.

loans.use: Building up her business inventory (clothing and shoes)

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly, 47, is the mother of six, five of whom are independent, and her family remains her responsibility. She lives with her husband, a fisherman, who agrees with what Nelly has decided to do. She has been selling fish and plantains around her neighborhood for six years, and it has gone very well due to the very convenient and busy location. Nelly works from 6 to 10 A.M. What she likes about her store is that it generates a good income that is gradually increasing. What is difficult about the business is not having a booth to provide a better presentation of her products. Nelly works to pay for daily expenses and the education of her son. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to build her booth and stock it with select fish to give special attention to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva volunteer.

Nelly, de 47 años de edad es madre de 6 hijos, siendo 5 de ellos independientes y de familia, quedando el último a su cargo. Vive con su esposo Ignacio (pescador) quien está de acuerdo con lo que se propone Nelly. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y plátano en las fueras de su domicilio, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 6 años y le va muy bien ya que se encuentra ubicada en una zona muy transitable y concurrida. Nelly atiende desde las 6 hasta las 10 de la mañana. Lo que le gusta de su negocio es que le genera buenos ingresos y crece poco a poco. Lo más difícil es no tener un kiosco adecuado para dar una mejor presentación a sus productos. Nelly trabaja para los gastos diarios y la educación de su hijo. Con el dinero que solicita quiere mandar a construir su kiosco e implementarse con pescado selectos y así dar una buena atención a sus clientes.

loans.use: Construction of a booth for better convenience and product sales.

loans.name: Salvith

texts.es:
Salvith, 36, and her husband Armando have three children: an infant and two students, whom Salvith adores. Armando, who transports passengers, and Salvith have decided to progress in their lives. Salvith has sold cold items (carbonated beverages, beer, popsicles, etc.) from her house for the past four years starting at noon, and mornings she takes care of children in her home for the Wawasi government program (mothers who look after the children of low-income working women). She likes her jobs for the opportunities of which she has already taken maximum advantage. Sometimes she has to get up at nght when her customers want to buy some cold products. Salvith wants to build a small establishment and set up chairs and tables to give her customers a better reception. That is why she is asking for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva volunteer.

Salvith es madre de 3 hijos, un bebe y dos estudiantes, quienes son su mayor adoración, ella tiene 36 años y vive junto a su esposo Armando, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros y junto han decidido salir adelante. Salvith se dedica a la venta de bebidas heladas (gaseosas, cervezas, chupetes de hielo, entre otros) dentro de su vivienda desde hace 4 años, atiende a partir del medio día, ya que también trabaja por las mañanas cuidando niños con el programa gubernamental Wawasi (son madres que cuidan a los niños de las mujeres de pocos recursos que salen a trabajar) que se encuentra instalado en su casa. Le gustan sus trabajos, ya que son oportunidades que aprovecha al máximo. A veces tiene que levantarse en la noche cuando sus clientes desean beber algún producto helado. Quiere mandar a construir una ramada e implementarse de mesas sillas y dar una mejor acogida a sus clientes, este es el motivo por el cual solicita este préstamo.

loans.use: Setting up a space to sell her drinks and cold products

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda is a dedicated and hard-working 60-year-old woman with two children, one of them already independent and the other a student, who both live with her. Her husband Félix is a farmer who helps her a lot in her business of selling plantains in her area. She started the business 27 years ago and works at it all day. Florinda does not have to worry about going to buy her plantains because her husband grows them every season. Her work is very profitable, and she has had no problems so far. She is working to pay the household expenses and to educate her son. She wants to invest money in the construction of a booth so that her plantains are better protected.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva volunteer.

Florinda es una mujer dedicada y trabajadora, a sus 60 años es madre de dos hijos, siendo uno de ellos ya independiente y el otro estudiante, ambos viven con ella, su esposo Félix es agricultor la apoya mucho en su negocio. Ella se dedica a la venta de plátano en las afuera de su vivienda, lleva en este negocio 27 años y vende durante todo el día. Florinda no se preocupa en ir a comprar plátano para venderlo, ya que su esposo se dedica al cultivo del mismo y se lo envía cada temporada. Su trabajo es muy rentable, y hasta ahora no ha tenido problemas. Trabaja para los gastos del mercado familiar y la educación de su hijo. Quiere invertir el dinero que solicita en la construcción de un kiosco para que sus plátanos estén mejor cuidados.

loans.use: Construction of a booth to protect the plantains she sells and make sales more convenient

loans.name: Julia Edilberta

texts.es:
Julia is 50 and lives with her husband Pedro and their six children, who are all adults now and working. Together, the family is trying to improve its standard of living. Julia owns two motorcycle trishaws that her sons maintain and operate to transport passengers. Furthermore, Julia sells clothes in various locations in her region from 6:00 in the morning to 6:00 in the evening. She has been conducting this activity for the past three years. She likes her work because she feels it is useful to society. With her loan, she wants to buy spare parts to maintain and repair one of her motorcycles, buy more garments to sell and then rent a location to set up her clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ian Harvey, Kiva volunteer.

Julia, de 50 años vive a lado de su esposo Pedro y sus 6 hijos que ya son adultos y trabajan. Esta familia, en unión, busca mejorar su calidad de vida. Julia es propietaria de dos motocarros, son sus hijos los que las cuidan y manejan haciendo trasporte de pasajeros. Adicionalmente, Julia se dedica a la venta de ropa por los distintos lugares de su zona, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Ella lleva en esta actividad desde hace 3 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo, es que le hace sentir útil a la sociedad. Con el dinero que solicita en préstamo, quiere comprar repuestos para el mantenimiento y arreglo de una de sus motos, comprar más prendas para su venta, y posteriormente alquilar un local para poner su tienda de ropa.

loans.use: Motorcycle repairs and purchase of wholesale merchandise (clothing)

loans.name: Milka Ynes

texts.es:
Milka is single and an executive secretary by trade. At 25 years old, she is a young businesswoman. She lives with her parents, who support and provide her with all the possibilities to make headway. Milka has a cold beverage business (beer and soft drinks). She started it two years ago and it has gone well so far. The store is located out of her home, and she tends to it all day long. What she likes about her job is that she learns a lot, especially the exchange of ideas with the business people who supply her store. She works hard to help her family with expenses and keep active in her business. She wants to add more products to her store selection to keep making headway and with time she hopes to transform it into a well-known place with much more traffic.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Milka es soltera, de profesión secretaria ejecutiva, tiene 25 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora, vive junto a sus padres, quienes le brindan apoyo en lo máximo de sus posibilidades para salir adelante. Milka tiene un negocio de bebidas heladas (cerveza y gaseosa), se inició en esta actividad hace 2 años y le va muy bien hasta ahora. Su negocio está en su vivienda, atiende todo el día. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que aprende mucho y sobre todo intercambia conocimientos con las personas de las empresas que le abastecen los productos. Ella trabaja para apoyar con los gastos familiares y tener activo su negocio. Quiere implementarse con más producto para seguir adelante y con el tiempo espera que su negocio se convierta en lugar conocido y de mucha concurrencia.

loans.use: Supply more products to her store / Abastecimiento de producto para su negocio.

loans.name: Talita Dorca

texts.es:
Talita is 27 and the mother of two children, who are both students. She lives with her husband, Luis, who is a professor and is very supportive of her. Talita does housework until midday and in her free time she sells clothing for credit or cash. Wanting to increase her income, she began this business two years ago because she saw it as something she would be able to do and it would also mean extra income for her family. She works every day to supplement her husband's income towards household expenses and especially for her children's education. Talita wants to continue to expand her clothing business and that's why she plans to use the money from this loan to take a trip to purchase what she needs. She hopes you will lend her a hand.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Talita a sus 27 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos, los mismos que estudian, vive junto a su esposo Luis, quien es profesor y la apoya en todo. Talita es trabajadora domestica hasta el medio día, en sus ratos libres se dedica a la venta de ropa al crédito o al contado. A causa de querer incrementar su sustento económico comenzó este negocio hace 2 años porque vio que era factible para ella y significaba un ingreso extra para su familia. Su esfuerzo diario es para apoyar con los gastos a su esposo y sobre todo para la educación de sus hijos. Talita quiere seguir creciendo en este negocio de la venta de ropa, por eso que con el dinero del préstamo planea hacer un viaje y comprar lo necesario, ella espera contar con su apoyo.

loans.use: Travel to the city to purchase a variety of clothing at a lower cost.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Mrs Felipa has works making and selling tortillas for the last 15 years. During that time she has also installed a mill, and has rented out a room in her home. Mrs Felipa would like to build her room rental business, which is why she has decided to invest in purchasing beams and galvanized metal sheets to renew the roof of the rooms. Mrs Felipa is married, and her husband works as a security guard. They have an 18 year old son who is preparing to attend the university. For this reason Mrs Felipa needs to seek out new sources of income that will allow her to support her son in his university studies.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Felipa desde hace 15 años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Con el tiempo también puso un molino, y empezó a alquilar una habitación en su vivienda. Doña Felipa desea fortalecerse en el negocio de los alquileres de cuarto, es por eso que desea invertir en ellos, el uso del préstamo será para la compra de perlines y zinc para cambiarles el techo a las habitaciones. Doña Felipa es casada, su esposo es guarda de seguridad, tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad, quien ahora se prepara para entrar a la universidad, es por eso que Doña Felipa tiene que buscar nuevas fuentes de ingresos que le permitan apoyar a su hijo en los estudios universitarios

loans.use: Purchase of beams and galvanized metal sheets to re-roof rental rooms.

loans.name: Rosa Micaela

texts.es:
Rosa Micaela is 36 years old. She lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood with her husband, who works at the University of Managua. They have two children - a 14 year old daughter and a 7 year old son. Rosa has worked as an executive secretary in a health center for 4 years. She plans on finding a better job, based on the experience that she hasacquired . She would like to be able to offer her children a better lifestyle, and for this reason she is investing in improving her home. With the money that she is requesting she will install a drop ceilins in three bedrooms.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa Micaela tiene 36 años de edad, habita en el barrio Memorial Sandino, es casada, su esposo trabaja en una Universidad de Managua, tiene 2 hijos una mujer de 14 años y un varón de 7 años. Rosa se desempeña como secretaria ejecutiva de un centro de salud, tiene 4 años de laborar en este centro. Sus planes son llegar a tener un mejor puesto producto de la experiencia que ha adquirido. Desea poder asegurarles a sus hijos un mejor patrimonio es por eso que invertirá en el mejoramiento de su vivienda. Con el dinero solicitado instalará cielo falso en tres habitaciones.

loans.use: Installation of drop ceilings in three bedrooms.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Senora Juana is a humble woman who has run her small business for many years. Her small cafe sells juices and snacks, and she generates enough income to help her family cover some basic costs to survive. Even though Juana is getting older, she is still very motivated to work.

Señora muy sencilla trabaja hace muchos años en el rubro del servicico D. jugos, sumos y ensaldas D. frutas con la cual ayuda a su familia a cubrir los gastos necesarios para sobrevivir, la señora ya es D. edad avanzada, pero aun tiene muchas ganas D. trabajar.

loans.use: TO REPLACE THE OLD UTENSILS IN THE CAFE KITCHEN, AND PURCHASE NEEDED INGREDIENTS AND MERCHANDISE AT WHOLESALE PRICES.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Senora D. Clases is a humble woman. Together with her ten year old daughter, they work making and selling traditional clothing. Her husband is always away working, and so she must take care of the children and play the role of both mother and father for her family.

Sra. D. Clase muy humilD., juntamente con su hijita D. 10 años se dedican a la comercializacion D. centros para señoras D. pollera es su hijita quien le ayuda a la señora, su esposo se encuentra constantemente D. viaje, por lo tanto la sra. Es quien mantiene a todos sus hijos y tiene el rol D. padre y madre al mismo tiempo.

loans.use: To purchase fabric needed to make the traditional skirts she sells.

loans.name: Tomas Benjamin

texts.es:
Tomas is a very responsible client who is dedicated to his work. He lives a simple and humble life with his family. His taxi business supports his family and is their only source of income. It's important that his car be in good condition for his business to be successful.

Cliente muy responsable y dedicado a su trabajo, vive en forma muy sencilla y humilde con su familia, el transporte es la actividad con la que vive su familia ya que es su unico ingreso en forma actual. Pero su responsablidad y su dedicación se ven reflrejados en su movilidad ya que se encuentra en un buen estado y en una buena condicion.

loans.use: To pay for maintenance on his taxi.  His transportation business is his family's only source of income.

loans.name: Ismael

texts.es:
Mr Ismael T. has a spare part business for. This business is the source of income for his family; he has 3 kids who are studying.

His business is lacking some spare parts and some more modern parts which he needs to give a better service to his clients, so they won't have to go elsewhere to repair their cars.

He has already had 2 loans with FVP which he has repaid punctually. Mr Ishmael T. would like a loan from Kiva to buy spare car parts.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Ismael T. tiene un negocio de reparación de automóviles. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando.

Al negocio le está haciendo falta refacciones y partes más modernos para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes y así sus clientes no tendrán que ir a otro lugar para que les reparen sus carros.

El ya ha tenido dos préstamos con FVP los cuales los pago puntualmente. El Sr. Ismael T. está solicitando un préstamo a Kiva para la compra de refacciones y partes de automóviles.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his business/Compra de refacciones y partes para el negocio

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas is divorced and lives with her 19-year-old daughter, who is a student. She is originally from the province of Ayaviri but has lived in Puno for the last four years, where her daughter studies at the local university. Three years ago, Ms. Felicitas rented a place to start a restaurant in order to make money to support herself and her daughter after she and her husband separated. She is very happy in her work, serving her customers her delicious stews. However, the hardest part of the job is earning enough money to buy the ingredients she needs since prices have gone up recently. Like any mother, what Felicitas most wants is to see her daughter have a good job. With the money from this loan, she plans to purchase additional ingredients so that she can prepare a wider variety of stews for her customers to enjoy. This will allow her to do more business and expand her restaurant in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Felicitas es divorciada, vive con su hija D. 19 años la cual es estudiante. Natural D. la provincia D. Ayaviri, Felicitas, resiD. en Puno hace cuatro años con su hija D. diecinueve años la cual estudia en una Universidad local, doña Felicitas desD. hace tres años alquiló un local donD. puso un restaurante para mantenerse y mantener a su hija desD. la separación D. su esposo.Ella es feliz atendiendo a la clientela a quien ofrece sus ricos potajes, la parte más difícil D. su trabajo es conseguir presupuesto para comprar los ingredientes, que en la actualidad han subido su precio. Doña Felicitas quiere ver a su hija como toda una profesional ese es su mas ansiado sueño Con el dinero, Felicitas quiere comprar más ingredientes para poder preparar diversidad D. potajes, y así deleitar a sus clientes, haciendo que su negocio sea más concurrido y en el futuro expandir su tamaño.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients needed to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Erika Sandra

texts.es:
Erika is 28 and lives with her cousins, Vanesa and Yadira. Erika is a very enthusiastic young woman and wants to get ahead in life. Even though she has a college degree, she hasn't been able to get a job in her field and that's why she currently sells beauty products. Erika is from Lima but moved to Juliaca seven years ago to go to school. She works all day selling her products, since her income directly depends on the amount of orders she receives. What she likes most about her work is interacting with and talking to her customers, convincing them to buy her products. Her least favorite aspect is going door to door to collect the money. Erika works every day to create a better future for herself and to have a family in the future. With the money from the loan she's requesting, Erika will purchase additional products so she can have a greater variety and increase her sales. In the near future she would like to have her own stand to sell cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Erika tiene 28 años, vive en la casa de sus primas Vanesa y Yadira. Es una entusiasta joven en busca de superación, a pesar de contar con una educación superior, no ha podido ejercer su carrera, por ello vende productos de belleza, es natural de la ciudad de Lima, pero desde hace siete años reside en Juliaca a causa de sus estudios.Erika se dedica a vender todo el día, ya que sus ganancias dependen de los pedidos que tenga, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es el tener que interactuar, conversar y convencer a las clientas de que compren sus productos y lo que menos le atrae es tener que caminar de casa en casa para cobrar. Erika trabaja todos los días para forjarse un prospero porvenir y formar una familia. Con el dinero solicitado comprara más productos de belleza para tener variedad de mercadería y vender aún más, y en un futuro cercano tener su propio stand de productos de belleza.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise (cosmetics) for her business.

loans.name: Glenny Sandra

texts.es:
Glenny is 20 and lives alone in the house that her parents left her. Glenny is very eager to support herself and be an independent young woman and to that end she started selling clothing a year ago. She works all week, in the morning and afternoon, as well as on weekends at the various markets in Juliaca. Being on her own is hard for Glenny since she was used to living with her family and not having to worry about supporting herself. However, Glenny enjoys her work because it brings her a sense of freedom and independence. Glenny wants to do well with her business in order to support herself, and in the future, raise a family and give them a comfortable life. With the money from the loan, Glenny will be able to purchase more clothing and increase her sales. Also, in the future she will be able to rent a stand in a store to sell her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Glenny tiene 20 años vive sola en la casa que le dejaron sus padres. En su afán de mantenerse por sí misma y ser una joven independiente, se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace un año, esta venta la realiza durante toda la semana por las mañanas y las tardes; los fines de semana en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca.Estar sola es muy difícil para Glenny ya que estuvo acostumbrada a vivir con su familia, y no preocuparse por su manutención, pero a Glenny le gusta su trabajo por que la hace sentirse libre e independizada. Glenny quiere prosperar en su negocio para auto mantenerse y formar una familia en el futuro a la cual pueda brindarle una vida confortable. Con el dinero que se facilite, Glenny podrá comprar más ropa e incrementar sus ventas, para en un futuro alquilar un stand en alguna tienda comercial y ofrecer su mercadería.

loans.use: Increase amount of merchandise (clothing) and rent a stand in the future.

loans.name: Julio César

texts.es:
Julio Cesar is 22 and was born in Juliaca. He is unmarried and lives with his grandparents and his aunt. He is a very lively and energetic young man. He has always lived in his hometown of Juliaca, where he grew up and went to school. He used to work at his sister's grocery store, but two years ago he decided to start his own business in order to pay for his studies. With his family's help, he set up public internet booths in his house. He runs the internet cafe in the afternoon. The best part about Julio Cesar's job is that it allows him to continue studying for a degree in civil engineering at the Juliaca city university, while at the same time earn money to cover the cost of school. He likes to use the Internet to look up information or surf the Web. The hardest part of the job is keeping the computers in good working order, since there are often problems with them. Julio Cesar works hard every day to shape a better future for himself. He plans to use the loan money to invest in the purchase of another computer. This will allow him to increase his number of customers and to start another business in the future, such as a hardware store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Julio César tiene 22 años, es juliaqueño de nacimiento, no es casado y vive en la casa de sus abuelos y tía. Es un joven vivaz y muy enérgico, siempre ha vivido en su ciudad natal Juliaca, donde creció y estudió, su hermana posee una tienda de abarrotes, en la cual trabajó, pero desde hace dos años decidió emprender su propio negocio para solventar los gastos de sus estudios.Con la ayuda de su familia, instaló unas cabinas de Internet en su casa, las cuales administra y atiende por las tardes.Lo bueno del trabajo de Julio César es que le permite estudiar su carrera de Ingeniería Civil en la Universidad de la ciudad de Juliaca y al mismo tiempo ganar dinero para solventar los gastos que ameritan sus estudios, le gusta aprovechar el Internet para buscar información y distraerse navegando, lo más difícil es tener que mantener las máquinas en buen funcionamiento ya que siempre se presenta algún desperfecto. Julio César se esfuerza día a día para forjarse un mejor futuro. El dinero del préstamo será invertido en comprar una computadora más y así aumentar la clientela, y en un futuro poner otro negocio, como una ferretería.

loans.use: Purchase of an additional computer for his public internet booths.

loans.name: Debora

texts.es:
Debora is 30 years old, separated and the mother of two children: Edison, who is 8, and Andres, who is 4. She currently lives with her two children in a rented home. Debora is from Lima, the capital, but has lived in Juliaca for the last 5 years.

After finishing her secondary studies, she started working various jobs, such as lingerie sales, which she has been doing now for 8 years. She does traveling sales, going to the different areas of Juliaca to sell her products. Debora's job allows her to take care of and spend time with her sons, since she works on weekends and during the morning on weekdays. The most challenging aspect of her work is having to take along her son Edison. Since he's so young, he needs a lot of attention but at the same time she has to carry and sell her merchandise. This is quite challenging, but she likes her job because it allows her to earn the money she needs to care for her sons and be able to spend time with them also.

Debora plans to use the loan money to buy additional lingerie and increase her inventory. The extra income will allow her to give her children a better education. In the future, Debora plans to have her own stand where she can sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Debora es una mujer de 30 años de edad, separada de su pareja y madre de dos hijos; Edison de 8 y Andrés de 4, con los que vive actualmente en una vivienda alquilada. Ella es de la ciudad capital, Lima reside en la ciudad de Juliaca hace cinco años, culminó sus estudios secundarios y desde entonces se ha dedicado a trabajar en diferentes labores, en el negocio de la venta de lencería tiene ocho años de experiencia, ofreciendo sus productos de forma ambulatoria por las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Juliaca. El trabajo de Debora le permite cuidar y pasar tiempo con sus hijos, ya que lo hace los días sábados y domingos y los demás días de la semana por las mañanas. Lo más difícil es tener que trabajar con su hijo Edison, ya que al ser pequeño necesita de sus cuidados, y al mismo tiempo manejar la mercadería y ofrecerla, esto se le hace complicado, pero le gusta su trabajo ya que le permite ganar dinero para mantener a sus hijos y poder pasar tiempo con ellos. Con el dinero que Débora solicita comprará más lencería para poder aumentar su mercadería y así poder brindarles una mejor educación a sus dos hijos, Débora planea en el futuro contar con su propio puesto, donde ofrecer sus prendas.

loans.use: Purchase of more merchandise (lingerie) to continue with her business.

loans.name: Alidian

texts.es:
Alidian tiene 28 años, está separada de su esposo y vive con sus dos hijos Deyanira de 10 y Abner de 8. Desde que se separó de su esposo - hace dos años - incursionó en la venta de Api (Bebida elaborada a base de maíz morado), negocio en que sale adelante gracias a la colaboración de sus dos pequeños niños, los cuales la apoyan incondicionalmente. La venta la realiza por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas se dedica a atender a sus hijos que van a la escuela.A Alidian siempre le ha gustado trabajar, le gusta mucho interactuar con la gente, ofreciendo su rico Api, pero a veces resulta difícil atenderlos a todos, ya que ella y sus niños no se abastecen para atender a toda la gente que concurre a su pequeño establecimiento. Alidian trabaja duro y parejo para darles una profesión a sus hijos y que así puedan sostenerse cuando sean adultos. El dinero que solicita será invertido netamente en su para el crecimiento de su negocio y si le va bien contratar a alguien que la ayude en la atención. En el futuro Alidian piensa tener sucursales de su negocio de venta de Api, por diferentes zonas de la ciudad de Juliaca.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Alidian is 28 years old; she is separated from her husband and lives with her two sons, Deyanira, 10, and Abner, 8. Since she separated from her husband two years ago she began selling Api (drink produced from purple maize); she has been able to get ahead in this business thanks to the support of her two small children who unconditionally support it. She does the selling in the afternoons since in the mornings she devotes her time to her children who go to school. Alidian has always liked to work, interact with people, and offer them her rich Api, but at the same time it is difficult for her (with the help of her children) to serve everyone who comes to her small business. Alidian works hard to give her children the chance at a profession that will enable them to sustain themselves when they are older. The money that she asks for in a loan will be invested in her business and if all goes well she hopes to hire someone who can assist in sales. In the future Alidian hopes to have other branches of her business for the sale of Api in different areas of Juliaca.

loans.use: Increase her capital for her business.

loans.name: Edgar Eloy

texts.es:
Edgar tiene 22 años, vive en casa con su madre. Aprendió desde muy niño - viendo a su madre - el negocio de los tejidos a máquina, del cual ahora es partícipe, poniéndole muchas ganas, ya que toda la experiencia ganada durante todos estos años le han servido para crear sus peculiares modelos.Edgar trabaja durante toda la semana para confeccionar sus prendas y las vende los días sábado y domingos en las ferias de la ciudad. Aunque resulte extraño - en un hombre - a Edgar le gusta el tejer, solo que algunas veces le resulta complicado la combinación de colores y puntos para lo cual le pide ayuda a su madre. Con el dinero que se le pueda facilitar, Edgar invertirá en comprar otras máquinas, además de variedades de lanas para poder hacer crecer su producción y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre que con los años ya no puede trabajar como lo hacia en su juventud.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Edgar is 22 years old and lives at home with his mother. As a child he learned to machine weave textiles by watching his mother; now he uses his experience to create interesting models, weaving with much enthusiasm. Edgar works all week to make his garments and sells them on Saturday and Sunday in fairs throughout the city. Although it is strange for a man, Edgar enjoys weaving; however he often asks his mother for help as he has trouble creating combination of colors. With the money he is asking for as a loan, Edgar plans to invest in the purchase of another weaving machine as well as a variety of wool that will allow him to help increase their production and provide a better quality of life to his mother since she can no longer work as she did in her youth.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material for the production of their textiles.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 28 años, vive con su esposo Francisco y sus tres hijos de ocho, cinco y dos años. Desde muy niña aprendió y ayudó en el trabajo de sus padres con el ganado, teniendo que dejar la escuela primaria en cuarto grado, es así que hoy en día, con una familia por mantener se dedica a la a la venta de ganado ovino y a la elaboración de quesos que fabrica en su casa, de la leche que dan sus animales, los cuales vende los días domingos en la feria.A Isabel siempre le ha gustado el comercio, su soltura y su manera de convencer a la gente para que compre sus productos, se han convertido en sus armas fundamentales para su negocio, lamentablemente los ingredientes para fabricar sus quesos y el poco ganado que le queda hace que el negocio sea más difícil de mantener. Sus tres hijos son su razón de ser, por la que ella trabaja tan duramente día a día. Isabel con el dinero que pide prestado piensa comprar muchas más cabezas de ganado para incrementar la venta y la producción de queso, y así concretizar su sueño de un negocio más rentable y productivo.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel is 28 years old and lives with her husband Francisco and their three sons who are 8, 5, and 2 years old. Since she was a very little girl she began helping her parents with their cows, thus having to leave primary school in fourth grade. Today, with a family to maintain, she less cows, sheep and cheese at the markets on Sunday. She makes the cheese at home from the milk of her animals. Isabel has always liked business and her ability to convince people to buy her products has become a critical weapon for her business; unfortunately the ingredients needed to manufacture the cheeses and the few cows that she has left have made it more difficult for her to maintain her business. Her three children are her reason for being and for them she works hard every day. With the money that Isabel is asking for as a loan she is considering buying more heads of cattle to increase the sale and production of her cheese and as such realize her dream of making her business more profitable and productive.

loans.use: Increase her number of heads of cattle.

loans.name: Ela

texts.es:
Ela tiene 33 años, vive en la casa de su madre, a la cual considera su mayor fuente de apoyo. Se dedica esporádicamente a la venta ropa, pero la labor que le genera mejores ingresos económicos es la venta de leña, la cual vende desde su casa, con la ayuda de su madre.Ela viene realizando este trabajo desde hace 7 años, tiempo en el cual reside en la ciudad de Juliaca, ya que nació en una comunidad en las afueras de la ciudad, aún es soltera y disfruta de su trabajo, el cual le permite ayudar a su mamá, lo difícil es tener que partir la leña, esto le genera un mayor esfuerzo físico. Ela se esfuerza demasiado para poder brindarle a su madre una vida digna y un esperanzador futuro para ella. Piensa invertir el dinero que se le facilite en comprar más leña para poder hacer más productivo su negocio y tener en el futuro un local y otro negocio.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Ela is 33 years old; she lives in her mother's house which she considers to be her greatest source of support. She has sporadically worked selling clothes, but the work that generates the majority of her income is the sale of firewood which she sells from her home with the help of her mother. Ela has been doing this since she moved to the city of Juliaca, 7 years; she was born in a community on the outskirts of the city. She is still unmarried and enjoys her work, which allows her to help her mother; the most difficult part is splitting the wood, which requires significant physical effort. Ela strives to give her mother a decent life and a hopeful future for herself. She is considering investing her money so that she can purchase more firewood which would allow their business to be more productive and in the future they would be able to have another location and another business.

loans.use: Increase the amount of firewood for her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 31 años, vive con su esposo Enrique de 25 años, el cual es artesano y su hijo Miguel de 6 años. Nancy se dedica desde hace cinco años al tejido de chompas, pantalones, etc. en su casa donde tiene su máquina de tejer, para luego vender estas prendas en el mercado donde tiene su pequeño puesto.Usualmente vende las prendas confeccionadas los días sábados y en la feria dominical donde gustosamente ofrece la mercadería elaborada durante la semana, lo más difícil de su trabajo es la confección de las prendas, las cuales demandan tiempo y dedicación. El motivo de tanto trabajo es apoyar a su esposo Enrique y su pequeño hijo Miguel de tan solo 6 años a los cuales quiere ofrecer una vida digna y feliz.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Nancy is 31 years old and lives with her husband Henry who is 25 and works as an artisan; she also lives with her son Michael who is 6 years old. For the past five years Nancy has woven sweaters and pants from her home where she has her weaving machine; she then sells these garments in the market where she has a small stand. She usually sells the woven garments at the fair where she gladly offers the merchandise that is produced during the week; the most difficult part of her job is the production of the garments, which requires time and dedication. The reason she is so dedicated to this work is that she works to support her husband and her son Miguel who is only 6 years old since she wants to offer him a happy and dignified life.

loans.use: Purchase of raw material (wool) for the production of her clothing.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina es madre soltera, vive con sus dos hijos Mariana de 12 años y Owen de 5. Alejandrina dejó su natal Patambuco, para buscarse un mejor porvenir en la ciudad de Juliaca, donde reside hace un año con sus dos pequeños hijos, para solventar sus gastos se dedica al negocio de la venta de ropa durante todo el día, de forma ambulatoria.Le gusta vender ropa ya que es un trabajo que le permite ser independiente, la desventaja es que a veces, por falta de presupuesto, no puede adquirir las cantidades de ropa que el público demanda. Alejandrina se esfuerza día a día con el único propósito de sacar adelante y ver profesionales a sus dos menores hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Alejandrina is a single mother who lives with her two sons Mariana, 12, and Owen, 5. Alejandrina left her home, Patambuco, to look for a better future in the city of Juliaca where she has lived for over a year with her two young children. In order to pay for their expenses she sells clothing all day in the informal market. She likes selling clothes because it is a job that allows her to be independent; the disadvantage is that sometimes, due to her lack of capital, she is not able to acquire the amount of clothing that the public demands. Alejandrina works ever day for the sole purpose of giving her children a better life and allowing them to become professionals.

loans.use: Increase the amount of clothing she sells in order to increase her profits.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is 42 years old, divorced, and now lives on her own. She has lived in the city of Juliaca for 31 years, having left her own village to look for a better life in a bigger city. Since then, she has worked making and selling textiles, a business which has supported her all these years. As she was unable to finish her education, she was not able to pursue a more formal profession.

Alejandrina likes her work. She first learned to sew from her mother, who taught her many important things such as believing in herself. She works hard to make sure she has a good future as she gets older. With the loan, she will be able to grow her business, purchase the material she needs and maybe even open her own small shop in the future, where she could work with other women who like Alejandrina, have been strong and capable on their own.

Alejandrina tiene 42 años, es divorciada y vive sola, ya que no tuvo hijos. Ella reside en Juliaca hace 31 años, partió de su pueblo para buscarse una mejor vida en la ciudad, desde entonces se ha dedicado a la venta de prendas tejidas a máquina, negocio que le ha servido para mantenerse durante toda su vida, ya que al no terminar su primaria no se pudo valer de armas para forjarse un futuro profesional.A Alejandrina le gusta su trabajo, el tejer se lo enseñó su madre, de la cual aprendió muchas cosas, como valerse por sí misma, pero como toda labor también tiene su parte difícil, en este caso es terminar la producción de sus prendas. Alejandrina trabaja para forjarse un mejor futuro y asegurar su vejez. Con el préstamo, esta valiente mujer podrá agrandar su negocio, comprando materiales y si es posible poner un taller en el futuro, donde pueda dar trabajo a otras mujeres que como ella que siempre se han valido solas.

a Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIAL NEEDED TO MAKE HER TEXTILES, GROW HER BUSINESS, AND CONTINUE TO SUPPORT HERSELF.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana is 39 years old. She is separated from her husband and lives with her two sons; Guido, who is 20, and Joel, who is 12, both of whom attend school. To help support her family, Ana has worked for 20 years selling shoes around the city of Juliaca. Her business has grown thanks to the various styles of shoes she offers to her customers. She travels to other cities such as Ayaviri, Puno to sell her shoes, and also works in local city markets.

Ana likes her work, but the constant travel makes things difficult for her. She would like to set up small stands in the main markets she visits, and so she is requesting a loan to purchase inventory and continue to grow her business.

Ana tiene 39 años, es separada y vive con sus dos hijos, Guido D. 20 años y Joel D. 12, quienes son estudiantes. Ella se dedica, desD. hace 20 años, a la venta D. calzado, para poder mantener a su familia, ella venD. D. forma ambulatoria al por mayor y menor en la ciudad D. Juliaca, los novedosos y variados diseños hacen que el negocio D. Ana esté creciendo y obtenga más clientela D. la que ya tiene. Ella viaja a ofrecer su mercadería a las ciudades D. Ayaviri, Puno y venD. en las ferias dominicales D. la ciudad, le gusta su trabajo, pero el tener que viajar tanto con su mercadería, la cual es un poco pesada se le hace difícil. Ana quiere tener un puesto en cada uno D. los diferentes mercados D. las ciudades que ella visita, es así que con el dinero que ella solicita piensa comprar mucha más mercadería y poder incrementar su capital y su negocio.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INVENTORY TO EXPAND HER BUSINESS SELLING SHOES.   AS A SINGLE MOTHER, ANA IS RESPONSIBLE FOR EDUCATING AND TAKING CARE OF HER TWO SONS ON HER OWN.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina is 51 years old. She's a single mother and lives with her 22 year old daughter, who is attending college. Cristina is a native of the city of Desaguadero. She was not able to complete her education because she had to work to help her family's economic situation. She's lived in the city of Juliaca for 17 years now, during which she's worked at different jobs. But for the last 10 years, thanks to a lot of hard work, she was able to open her own small shop in her house selling everyday grocery and household items.

Cristina likes her work in the shop as it allows her to work from home. The difficult part is always having to stock more products to sell, as it's hard to predict how much she needs and it's expensive to overstock. Cristina works hard to make sure her daughter has an education and can pursue a profession. With the requested loan, she will be able to stock her small store with many more products, better serve her customers and grow the business.

Cristina tiene 51 años, es madre soltera y vive con su hija de 22 años, la cual está cursando sus estudios universitarios. Cristina es natural de la ciudad de Desaguadero, no pudo terminar sus estudios primarios porque desde muy pequeña tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar para ayudar en la economía familiar, vive en la ciudad de Juliaca hace 17 años, tiempo en el cual ha venido trabajando en diferentes actividades, pero desde hace 10 años y gracias a su duro esfuerzo Cristina pudo poner una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.A Cristina le gusta trabajar en su tiendita, ya que le permite estar en casa y tener un trabajo más tranquilo, lo difícil es tener que abastecerse cada mes de los productos que venderá en su tienda, ya que a veces el presupuesto no le alcanza para poder surtirla como ella quisiera. Cristina trabaja con el fiel pensamiento de sacar a su hija profesional y que pueda desarrollarse como tal. Con el dinero que solicita desea abastecer su tiendita con muchos más productos y variados para complacer a su clientela, así poder tener un negocio más rentable y que le dé mayores frutos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO GROW HER PRODUCT INVENTORY, OFFER MORE SELECTION TO HER CUSTOMERS AND GROW HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Mrs. Sin Sophea"s Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin S. is the Village Bank President of a group of nine people who live in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. She is a pig breeder who is raising only one pig right now because she does not have enough money to purchase more pigs. Since her business has been going well, Mrs. Sin S. decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets. She plans to use any remainder of the loan to purchase pig feed to feed them.

Her husband, Mr. Ly Mak, is a construction worker. Mrs. Sin S. is 28 years old and the mother of two children one of whom is attending school while the other is still too young because that child is under the age of five years old.

loans.use: to buy piglets and to purchase pig feed

loans.name: Mrs. Chea Chanthoeun's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea C. is the Village Bank President of a group of eight members who are all in Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province. She is a cake seller in the local village. Since her business activity is going well, Mrs. Chea C. is requesting a loan to buy more cakes to resell them.

Her husband, Mr. Sin Saron, is a motorbike taxi driver who can only make a small income, not enough to support his family. Mrs. Chea C. is 29 years old and the mother of two children one of whom is attending primary school while the younger one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to buy more cakes to resell

loans.name: Mrs. Korng Oeun's Group

texts.en: This group consists of four members who live in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Korng O. is the group leader and she is a fruit seller. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Korng O. wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more fruit in order to reach her customers' demand. Her husband, Mr. Srey Khorn, is a house construction foreman. Mrs. Korng O. has two children who are both attending school.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to re-sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi H. is 55 years old. After losing her husband at a young age, she struggled to raise her children who now all have finished school and have grown. She has been a member since 2006. Her initial loan of 2.000.000d was used to purchase hogs in hope to support her family financially. After seeing the success of her business, she became more confident and seeks more loans to help with her business. The profits gained and loan she received thereafter was used to expand her business and she was even able to buy hens-to lay eggs. At this present time, her livestock consists of 7 pigs and 200 hens. Her daily income is about 200.000d. Three of her five children are grown and are living on their own. The other 2 children reside with her and both have steady jobs with a 3.000.000d/month income. This time she is requesting a loan of 6.000.000 to invest in farm animals. Her average income is 5.000.000d/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Huệ 55 tuổi. Chồng mất sớm một mình chị vất vả nuôi các con ăn học và trưởng thành. Tham gia Quỹ năm 2006 Số vốn vay lần đầu 2.000.000đ để đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn nhằm tăng thêm thu nhập trong gia đình. Qua viêc đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn có hiệu quả chị lại càng mạnh dạn hơn trong việc vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Các vòng vốn sau mức vốn chị vay cao hơn và đầu tư lớn hơn không chỉ chăn nuôi lợn mà chị còn đầu tư chăn nuôi thêm gà đẻ trứng. Hiện tại chị đang nuôi 7 con lợn và 200 con gà đẻ trứng thu nhập bình quân 200.000đ/ ngày. Các con chị hiện đã lớn, 3 con đã trưởng thành và ra ở riêng, 2 con đang sống cùng chị và có công việc ổn định thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 6.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Mr. Chea Kark's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chea K. is the group leader of four people who all live in Srae Ampil Village in Kandal Province. He is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. In the rainy season, Mr. Chea K. grows rice, while he grows vegetables in the dry season. On his plantation, Mr. Chea K. now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to purchase fertilizer to support the rice field. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and he would use part of the loan to buy pesticide to kill insects in order to make his crop more productive.

Mr. Chea K. is a widower with eight children, one of whom is working as a construction worker while six others are attending school. The youngest one is too young to work or study because that child is five years old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to buy pesticide

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms. Nguyen Thi N., 25 years of age, has been a member since 2003. Since becoming a member of this loan program, she has invested in mat making and livestock. The family income has rise and fluctuates daily. Her first loan of 1.000.000d was used to invest in livestock and mat making. As a result, she was able to invest more capital into her livestock business and purchased more materials for mat weaving. Every day her husband works as a construction worker with an average daily income of 80.000d. Presently, she plans to borrow this loan to help remodel the animals’ pen. She is requesting a loan of 6.000.000d. Her average monthly income is 4.000.000d.

Translated from Vietnamese by Lynn Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thi Nguyệt 25 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003. Từ năm tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn làm ăn đầu tư vào làm chiếu và chăn nuôi. Kinh tế gia đình được thay đổi từng ngày. Vòng vốn ban đầu gia đình chị vay 1.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và làm chiếu kết quả từ việc chăn nuôi được anh chị đầu tư tái chăn nuôi và thêm vốn mua lác chiếu, hàng ngày chồng chị đi làm thợ xây bình quân mỗi ngày 80.000đ. Tới đây gia đình chị có kết hoạch vay vốn về sửa chữa công trình phụ và chuồng trại phục vụ cho chăn nuôi được tôt hơn. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 6.000.000đ Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Tuấn 49 tuổi. Trước khi trưa tham gia Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị còn găp nhiều khó khăn, con đông lại không có công ăn việc làm ổn định nên không giúp được nhiều cho chị trong kinh tế . Năm 2007 chị đã tham gia vào Quỹ, vòng vốn đầu  tiên  chị vay 2.000.000đ cùng với vốn tự có chị mua bò chăn nuôi, sau 1 năm chị bán 2 con bò con được 3.000.000đ. Số tiền bán bò được chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và vịt đẻ. Hiện tai gia đình chị đang nuôi 2 con bò sinh sản, 8 con lợn thịt, 200 vịt. Với mô hình chăn nuôi kết hợp như vậy hàng năm gia đình chị cho thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gần 50.000.000đ. Các con chị hiện đã lớn và đều có công việc ổn định thu nhâp hàng tháng 4.000.000đ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 7.000.000đ đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs Nguyễn Thị Tuấn is 49 years old. Before joining TYM fund, her family was going through difficult time: big family, her children did not have stable jobs so they could not help her much. In 2007, she joined TYM fund. Her first loan was for 2.000.000 VND. She bought 2 calves, kept them for a year then sold them for 3.000.000 VND. Then with the money from the sale, she invested in raising pigs & ducks. Currently she has 2 breeding cows, 8 pigs and a paddle of 200 egg laying ducks. Now her family annual income is 50.000.000 VND. Her children are all grown up and hold a stable job, their income is 4.000.000 VND a month. This time she is requesting a loan of 7.000.000 to invest more in her pig & duck business. Her family monthly income is 6.000.000 VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise pigs & ducks

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phạm Thị Quyết 46 tuổi, Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2004. Trải qua 4 vòng vốn vay kinh tế gia đình chị đã có nhiều thay đổi. Những năm trước khi trưa tham gia vào Quỹ kinh tế gia đình chị còn gặp nhiều khó khăn nguồn thu nhập chính chủ yếu trông vào mấy sào ruộng. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà và vịt. Từ khi gia đình chị tập chung vào chăn nuôi nên kinh tế đã phát triển hơn, thu nhập từ chăn nuôi được anh chị đầu tư mua sắm các đồ dùng trong gia đình và kiến thiết nhà cửa. Các con chị hiện đã lớn thu nhập ổn đinh phụ giúp gia đình 3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs Phạm Thị Quyết is 46 years old. She's aTYM fund member since 2004. After 4 rounds of loans, her family financial situation has improved. Before joining TYM, her family living condition was difficult since their only income is from their land. When she joined TYM, she used her loan to raise pigs, chickens and ducks. Their living condition has improved, they are now able to buy things that they need and repairtheir house. Her children are all grown up and they chip in financially. They contribute 3.000.000 a month. This time Mrs Quyết is requesting a loan of 9.000.000 vnd. Her family income is 6.000.000 vnd a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Phan Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Phan Thị C. 41 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2005. Cũng giống bao gia đình khác ở vùng nông thôn nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị chủ yếu trông vào mấy sào ruộng và chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ. Do thiếu vốn nên việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị không đem lại nhiều về hiệu quả kinh tế. Năm 2005 chị tham gia vào Quỹ Vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế. Từ khi tham gia vay vốn chị đã đầu tư vào chăn nuôi với mô hình lớn hơn, chuồng trại phục vụ cho chăn nuôi cũng được gia đình chị tu sửa do vậy kết quả chăn nuôi của gia đình chị rất tốt. Từ những kết quả chăn nuôi đem lại mấy năm gần đây kinh tế gia đình chị đã từng buớc thay đổi, chị đã mua sắm đựoc nhiều tiện nghi trong gia đình phục vụ sinh họat hàng ngày. Là người chịu khó nên những lúc nhàn dỗi vợ chồng chị lại đi làm thuê thu nhập bình quân mỗi ngày 100.000đ. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 6.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
Thu nhập bình quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Mrs Phan Thị C. is 41 years old. She's a TYM fund member since 2005. Like many other families in the region, her family income comes from their exploited land and their pig raising business. Because they did not have enough capital to invest in the pig business, it did not yield enough income for her family. In 2005, she joined TYM to get a loan and she invested all in her pig business. She built new pig pen and expanded the operation. This has been a success. Things have changed for the better. Her family financial situation has improved a lot. She has been able to buy all the necesary goods for her household. She and her husband work hard, when they have free time they go to work for other farmers. This could bring in extra 100.000 VND a day. This time Ms C. is requesting a loan of 6.000.000 to invest in her pig business. Her family income is 5.000.000 VND a month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise pigs

loans.name: Thi Huong

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Huong, 42 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2003. She borrowed the first loan of 2,000,000VND (125USD) to invest in her small general store in the market. Her daily income from this is about 100,000VND (6.25USD). Since joining the Fund, the income from this business has been higher. Besides the store, she also invests in rearing pigs. This is also the main source of income for her family, as every year she can sell 3 rounds of pigs, each round 3 tonnes, yielding a profit of about 35,000,000VND (2187.50USD). This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to continue investing in rearing pigs. Her average monthly income is 5,000,000VND (312.50USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thi Hương 42 tuổi, Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003. Vòng vốn ban đầu gia đình chị xin vay 2.000.000đ đầu tư vào buôn bán nhỏ. Hàng ngày vợ chồng chị đi chợ thu nhập bình quân 100.000đ. Từ khivào Quỹ việc vay vốn của gia đình chị thuận lợi nên thu nhập từ buôn bán của gia đình chị cũng được cao hơn. Ngoài những lúc đi chợ anh chi vẫn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn đây cũng là nguồn thu nhập chính của gia đình chị, bình quân mỗi năm gia đình chị xuât 3 lứa lợn mỗi lứa. 3 tạ cho thu nhâp khoảng 35.000.000đ. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Thu nhập bình quân.5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Thi Ly

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Ly, 40 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2007 with the goal of improving her family's financial situation. Her first loan of 5,000,000VND (312.50USD) was used to invest in rearing pigs. Realizing the high profit gained, her family decided to renovate the pig sty to continue rearing pigs in a large scale. Since then, her family members have been putting more effort into work. Her husband also works as a construction worker with the monthly income of 2,000,000VND (125USD). Mrs. Ly sometimes works as cleaner for the village's administration house for the monthly income of 1,000,000VND (62.50USD). With these stable incomes, her family has always been able to repay the loan fully. This time, she would like to borrow 9,000,000VND (550USD) to invest in rearing pigs. Her family's average monthly income is 4,000,000VND (250USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vũ Thị Lý 40 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2007 với mục đích vay vốn phát triển kinh tế. Vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị vay 5000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, sau 1 vòng vốn vay thấy rằng việc chăn nuôi sẽ đem lại hiệu quả kinh tế, gia đình chị đã bàn bạc sửa chữa lại toàn bộ chuồng trại để tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi với mô hình lớn hơn. Từ khi tham gia vốn các thành viên trong gia đình đều cố gắng hơn trong công việc, chồng chị làm nghề thợ xây nên công việc của anh cũng rất đều đặn thu nhập bình quân hàng tháng 2.000.000đ, chị làm vệ sinh môi trường tại ủy ban xã công việc tranh thủ nhưng lương mỗi tháng 1.000.000đ. Với thu nhập ổn định như vậy nên việc hoàn trả vốn của gia đình luôn hoàn thành tốt. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Rearing pigs

loans.name: Thi Tho

texts.vi:
Mrs. V. Thi Tho, 44 years old, joined the TYM Fund in 2007. Her husband is a construction worker with the stable monthly income of 2,000,000VND (about 125USD). She has 2 children currently studying in college. She started borrowing loans to rear pigs so that her family's income could increase and that she would be able to send her children to school. Her effort is paid off as she is now able to sell the pigs after every 3 months. She wants to purchase breeding pigs so that she will not have to buy piglets to rear every time. This time round, she would like to borrow 6,000,000VND (375USD). Her average monthly income is 5,000,000VND (about 312.50USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Vương Thị Thơ 44 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2007, chồng chị là công nhân lương tháng ổn định 2.000.000đ, chị sinh được hai con hiện nay hai con chi đang học đai học. Tham gia vào Quỹ chị đã vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn để tăng thêm thu nhập có điều kiện cho các con ăn học. Sự cố gắng của chị và gia đình cũng được đền đáp công việc chăn nuôi rất tôt cứ 3 tháng chị lại xuất 1 lứa lợn. Chị mong muốn tới đây chị sẽ đầu tư vốn mua lợn nái để sinh sản khi chị nuôi lợn thịt không phải mua giống. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 6.000.000đ. Thu nhập binh quân 5.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Rearing Pigs

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji is the wife of M.A. G.. She lives in the small city of Kasur,Pakistan, famous for its sweetmeat and shoes. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 28 years. Suraiya is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. Her son works in a cloth factory where he maintains power loom machines. Her first two daughters make decorative embroidered dresses and sell them in the market. Suraiya baji's husband works in a clothing factory and he also takes care of the power loom machines. Suraiya baji is a housewife and also makes thread to order. She is the only woman who is an expert in thread making in her community. She successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a thread making machine which will make her effort less and increase her profit.

Suraiya baji is joined in her loan group by four other members. Rehana baji wants a loan to buy cloth to resell. Azizan baji wants a loan to buy fruits to resell. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy thread for her embroidery business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy material (thread, cloth) for her embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat Shahbaz baji is the wife of M.. She lives in the small city of Kasur, in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years. Farhat baji is a mother of three children: one son and two daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her husband has a electronics shop where he sells stoves and washing machines. Farhat baji is a housewife and also sews clothes for her neighbors. Farhat baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more stoves and washing machines for her husband's electronics shop.

Farhat baji is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Shaheen baji and Hamidan baji each want a loan to buy thread to resell. Amna baji wants a loan to buy decorative embroidery material (thread and cloth). Sakina baji wants a loan to buy woods to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electric supplies

loans.name: Mukhtaran's Group

texts.en:
Mukhtaran baji is the wife of S. A. and has been living in the small city of Kasur in Pakistan for the last 25 years. She owns a two room brick house. Mukhtaran baji is the mother of seven children: five daughters and two sons. Her older three daughters make decorative embroidery dresses. Her younger daughters and sons are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Mukhtaran baji's husband has a shop where he sells bicycles. She is a housewife and removes thread from sweaters and sells them in the market. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more bicycles to expand her husband's business.

Mukhtaran is joined in her loan group by a few members. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy handsets for her mobile phone shop. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy decorative embroidery material (thread, cloth).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more bicycles

loans.name: Zuhran's Group

texts.en:
Zuhran baji is the wife of M. and lives in the small city of Kasur, Pakistan. She lives in a one room house. She is the mother of four sons and two daughters. Zuhran's elder son is a medical worker in a clinic near her community. Her next eldest son and her daughters make decorative embroidered dresses. Her younger sons are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Zuhran makes embroidered dresses and takes care of her children. Her husband is a daily wage laborer. She has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute ). Now she is applying for a loan to buy embroidery material (thread, cloth) to enhance her embroidery business.

Zuhran is joined in her loan group by four other members. Asia baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, rice and cooking oil) for her grocery shop. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy thread to resell. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy electric supplies (switch boards and switches) for her electronic shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Rafia's Group

texts.en:
Rafia baji is the wife of M. and lives in the small city of Kasur in Pakistan. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the last 26 years. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. Her elder daughter and elder sons make embroidered clothes. Her younger daughter is in the 8th grade. Her younger son is in the 3rd grade. Rafia baji's husband is a mason and has been in this profession for the last 10 years. Rafia baji also makes embroidered dresses. She has successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a Pakistan microfinance institute ). Now she is applying for a loan to buy embroidery material (thread, cloth) to expand her embroidery business.

Rafia baji is joined in her loan group by four more members. Sakina baji wants a loan to buy school bags to resell. Bushra baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy fruits to resell. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy embroidery material (thread, cloth).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for her embroidery business

loans.name: Ezhar

texts.en:
Ezhar A. is 21; he lives in the Shewa district with his two children and his wife. Ezhar is uneducated, but clever and active. During the last three decades, because of the war in Afghanistan, Ezhar couldn't go to school and was unable to realize his dreams. His two small brothers are studying in a public school and Ezhar helps them and attempts to provide all the necessary things for them.

When Ezhar A. got married, his father gave him just 30,000 Afghanis ($600). He was tired of farming, so he changed his business and immediately opened a small retail shop with 18,000 Afghanis and purchased some goods with the remainin money. At the beginning, Ezhar encountered some difficulties because he was new to this business and didn't have previous experience in shopkeeping. He didn't know how to find customers and increase his sales, but after a few months he got this skill and was finally able to purchase more retail goods for his shop.

Ezhar A. is not just a breadwinner for his own family, but he must provide some medicines for his sick parents and support his small brothers also.

Two months ago he completed a mobile phone repair private course, and then he decided to change his business and started a mobile repair and sales shop. He thinks that there is much demand for these things, but he needs some money to purchase enough equipment and different models of mobile phones. Thereford he has applied to AFSG for a 50,000 Afghanis loan for 18 months.

Ezhar dreams that if he able to increase his daily income from 400 Afghanis ($8) to 700 Afghanis ( $14), he will learn some English and computer skills. He sincerely thanks the lenders who assist poor people hard times and encourage them to work.

loans.use: To buy phone repair equipments and mobiles

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en: Firuz D. is 21 years old, single, and went into business for himself right after finishing secondary school because his family could not afford to send him to university. His main goal now is to help his parents financially. Since 2004, he has done that in various ways, most recently by selling cell phones. He has been in this line of work for a year and has generated enough income to meet his goals. Business is very good, and Firuz needs to increase his inventory of phones to meet the needs of his clients. To do this, he is applying for a loan of $600. Because he is a young businessman and this is his first loan, Firuz is especially grateful to everyone who chooses to support him and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy cell phones from China to sell.

loans.name: Naimdjon

texts.en: Naimdjon D. is 21 years old, single, and has been in the business of selling cell phone accessories such as chargers, earphones and cases for the last two years. His business is located in the central market of Khujand City. Naimdjon runs his business very skillfully and has great prospects for growing it in the future. This year is crucial for Naimdjon because he plans to be married soon. To raise his income and support his new status as a husband, he is planning to expand his business and buy more accessories to sell. To make this possible, he is seeking a $600 loan which he will pay back in 12 months He promises to repay the loan in a timely manner and thanks everyone for their  support, which will help him tremendously and make his wedding possible.

loans.use: To buy additional cell phone accessories to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Askarjon

texts.en: P. Askarjon is 25 years old, single and lives with his large family, which consists of six people, including his parents, younger brothers and sisters. Although quite young, he is already the main bread-winner at home and widely know as a very active and responsible fellow. For the last six years, he has made a living selling types of candy that are very popular in this area. Today, his stand is one of the best-known places in the entire food market. He is a very cheerful person, always glad to meet everyone who comes to his shop. All of his clients are satisfied with his service. Askarjon is trying to make his assortment of candies more competitive and attractive to his customers. He has applied for a $600 loan, which he will pay back in 12 months, to buy more candies and increase the range of items he has to sell. Your support will be of great assistance, and he and his family thank you sincerely for your support.

loans.use: To buy more candy to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: A. Halima is 37 years old, married and has three children. Her husband is an entrepreneur, and she makes a living selling foodstuff like tea, sunflower oil, infant formula, mayonnaise, butter and sweets. She rents a stall in one of her town's central markets, and has been in business for 21 years. Her older son helps Halima with the business, and the income she produces helps her meet her family's expenses. Halima works very hard to give her children a good education and make them happy. In order to cover the higher education expenses of her elder son as begins university, Halima has applied for a loan of $1,000 to increase the range of goods she has to sell. She will repay the loan in 12 months. Halima thanks Kiva lenders for their support and promises to pay the loan in time. She is hoping for your help.

loans.use: To buy additional food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.en: Mavzuna B. is 26 years old, married and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. In order to help him support their family, Mavzuna has run her own business for the last four years, selling clothing for children in the local market. Once a week, on Friday, she sells her goods in a large market in a neighboring city. Those days, she works from 5 a.m. till the late in the evening. Mavzuna's husband helps her each Friday. She is seeking a loan for $600 for six months to increase her working capital and purchase goods for the current season. She is hoping to buy a good supply of new inventory and thereby increase her profits. This is Mavzuna’s first loan from IMON, and we are happy to have chance to help her with her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora S. is 39 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Gulnora makes a living selling children's clothing in the local market. She started her business eight years ago, with some help from her husband, who provided start-up funds. Gradually, Gulnora's business has expanded. Because she is hard-working and polite by nature, she has managed to obtain a devoted clientel that is happy with the goods and services she provides, and her business generates a stable income for the family. Gulnora loves her children very much and wants all of them to be well-educated. This year her daughter finished secondary school, and Gulnora wants her to enter university. To be able to do that, Gulnora has applied for a loan of $600, which she will pay back in 12 months. She will use the loan to buy additional clothing and increase the range of items she has for sale. Gulnora is hoping for your support, and she deeply appreciates any assistance you may choose to give her.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sharofat

texts.en: Sharofat Z. is 40 years old, married and has three children. For 19 years, she has worked as a vendor, selling popular plates and dishes from China in the central local market. These items widely prized for dowries and as gifts on special occasions. Because Sharofat loves her children deeply, she makes every effort possible to provide them with what they need. To increase her income and her ability to provide for them, Sharofat wants to enlarge the range of goods she has for sale, and to purchase china from the neighboring countries of Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan. To make this possible, she has applied for a loan of $1,000 for a term of 12 months. Sharofat has been an active and strongly motivated client of IMON since 2007. Her credit history makes her eligible to receive new and larger loans. The well being of Sharofat’s family and her business are in your hands, and she and her children are sincerely grateful for your support.

loans.use: Purchasing of the plates and dishes of the oriental style in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Abdul Khalaq

texts.en:
Abdul Khalaq lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and has 4 children. He has a metal shop, a business that he started 12 years ago, and still he is working. He has two workers in his shop. He loves his business. During the war in Kabul, he just had to stop his business for 1 year and after that, he started again.

Now he wants to enlarge his shop so he needs some money as capital to invest. When he found AFSG in Kabul and he learned about this process of small loans, then he requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani with a term of 18 months to buy a new generator so that he can work hard and keep his business going.

He is happy with this process of small loans in this poor country. This loan can change a lot in the life of every worker. Abdul Khalaq says that that he has worked in this business for 12 years and still he couldn't expand his business. Now he would like to say that this loan is very useful for every hard worker. They can expand their business. He wants to thank Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy a new generator and complete his stock

loans.name: Sayaad Shah

texts.en:
Sayaad Shah is 43 years old. He is married and is the father of 5 children. He lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a small retail shop that he started 6 years ago in Kabul. Still he is busy. Sayaad Shah is a very hard worker. He always wants to become strong in his business. He loves his business.

Shah wants to enlarge his business so he has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and buy more to sell such as baskets, shampoo, and Pepsi, to attract more customers and make a good monthly income for his family. He is sure that he can help his family after using this loan.
