Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

A travers les prets obtenus depuis deux (02) ans au prés de l U-IMCEC,les femmes de ce groupement sont aujourd'hui des exemples .chacune d 'entre elle a monté son propre commerce de détail ou les habitants du quartier viennent se ravitailler en produits de prmieres nécessites. Avec les revenus titrés de leurs activités elles s'assurent les frais médicaux et de scolarités de leursenfants et parents.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Najma's Group

texts.en:
Najma baji is a wife of N. A. and lives in a small city named Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in this city with her family for the last 22 years. Her house is based in one room where she and two more family members live. Najma baji is a housewife but she makes thread and sells it in market to earn profit. Her husband has an electronics shop. Najma baji has one son, and he is 16 years old. She successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy electronic supplies (washing machines, stoves) to expand her husband’s business.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Allah Rakhi baji and Sugran baji each want a loan to buy thread to resell. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy embroidery material (thread, cloth, and needles).

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods

loans.name: Les Lingueres De Falokh Group

texts.fr: A travers les prets obtenus depuis deux (02) au pres de l U-IMCEC,les femmes de ce groupement sont aujourd'hui  des exemples .chacune d 'entre elle a monté son propre commerce de détail ou les habitants du quartier viennent se ravitailler en produits  de prmieres nécessites. Avec les revenus titrés de leurs activités elles assurent les frais médicaux et de scolarités de leursenfants et parents.

loans.use: Fonds de Roulement

loans.name: Hotam

texts.ru:
Hotam A. is an inhabitant of Jalollidini Rumi. He is self-employed in the construction industry. Additionally, to provide for his family, he works in the market selling vegetables and fruit. This business seasonal, therefore he plans to takeout a loan for 3 months. It will help him make good money. He has two years of experience in this field. Hotam lives with his family. He is married and has five children.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer.

Ашуров Хотам житель района Джалоллидини Руми. Работает строителем по найму. Кроме того , для того , чтобы обеспечить семью он работает на рынке , продавая овощи и фрукты. Этот бизнес сезонный , поэтому он планирует получить кредит , сроком на 3 месяца. Это поможет получить неплохой доход . Опыт работы в данной сфере два года. Хотам живет со своей семьей . Он женат и имеет пятерых детей.

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Elishikaria's Fadhili Group

texts.en:
Elishikaria is 31 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 12, 8, and 4 years old. She is a farmer and milk seller since 2003. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Elishikaria now hopes for a loan to buy more farm equipment and milk for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Tasimbora and Elishiwaria, who have businesses dealing with chicken and milk sales and banana and eggs sale.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is married with 5 children ages 19, 15, 5, 3, and 1. She has been a vegetable seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 8am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Rebeca now hopes for a loan to buy more vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Sope Naby Group

texts.fr:
Ndèye G. and Omou Khairy K. are two very dynamic women. They formed a group to work together, and their main business is the sale of second-hand clothes. They have benefited from two previous loans, which they repaid without incident. It is with the goal of increasing their stock that they are asking for this new loan.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Ndèye G. et Oumou Khaïry K. sont deux femmes très dynamiques . Elles se sont constituées en groupe pour travailler ensemble et leur principale activité est la vente de fripperie. Elles ont eu à bénéficier de deux prêts qu'elles ont remboursé correctement. C'est dans le but de renforcer leur stock qu'elles contractent ce nouveau prêt.

loans.use: To buy and sell second-hand clothing

loans.name: Clementina's Ikunda Group

texts.en:
Clementina is 30 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 12 and 5 years old. She has been a milk and maize seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Clementina now hopes for a loan to buy more milk and maize for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with maize and beans sales, banana sales, milk, and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more milk and maize for her business.

loans.name: Ndeshifose's Mercy Group

texts.en:
Ndeshifose is married with 2 children aged 19 and 15 years old. She has been a banana seller since 1998. Every day, she works from 7am to 12pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Ndeshifose now hopes for a loan to buy more bananas for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Lightness, who has a business dealing with vegetables sales.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for her business

loans.name: Witnes's Eden Group

texts.en:
Witnes is 25 years old. She is married with 3 children. She has been a banana and maize seller since 2002. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $55 from her sales.

Witnes now hopes for a loan to buy more bananas and maize for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Anastazia , who has a business dealing with grocery ownership.

loans.use: To buy more bananas and maize for her business

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 40 years old. She is married with one child aged 6 years old. She has been running a small shop since 2002. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Eunice now hopes for a loan to buy more products for her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to increase her inventory

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en:
Rebeca is 26 years old. She is married with 2 children. She also takes care of 2 other children aged 13 and 10 years old. She has been a maize seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Rebeca now hopes for a loan to buy more maize for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more maize for resale

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 41 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 18, 15, and 10 years old. She has been a banana seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Anna now hopes for a loan to buy more bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas for her business

loans.name: Ndefisiwa

texts.en:
Ndefisiwa is married with 3 children aged 17, 15, and 10. She also takes care of 2 other children. She has been a beans seller since 1999. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Ndefisiwa now hopes for a loan to buy more beans for resale.

loans.use: To buy more beans for re-sale

loans.name: Ndetomariswa

texts.en:
Ndetomariswa is 49 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 18 and 14 years old. She is a milk and banana seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $135 from her sales.

Ndetomariswa now hopes for a loan to buy more milk and bananas for her business.

loans.use: To buy more milk and bananas for her business

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 44 years old. She is a widow with one child aged 16 years old. She has been a milk and maize seller since 1990. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Helena now hopes for a loan to buy more milk and maize for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more milk and maize for re-sale

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 28 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 10 and 5 years old. She has been running a small shop since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Janeth now hopes for a loan to buy more products for her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to increase her inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 16, 14, and 12 years old. She owns and has been running a small shop since 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Maria now hopes for a loan to buy more products for her business.

loans.use: To buy more products to increase her inventory

loans.name: Naisiligaki

texts.en:
Naisiligaki is 48 years old. She is married with one child aged 17 years old. She has been a tomato and vegetable seller since 1993. Every day, she works from 5am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Naisiligaki now hopes for a loan to buy more tomatoes and vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr:
Khady A. was born in 1966 in Thies. She is married and has one daughter. She lives in the Keur Ablaye Yakhine area with her husband. She has been commercially active for more than 15 years, with the help of her husband. Her business consists of buying merchandise in bulk, which she re-sells to retailers. With the coming of Ramadan, she is asking for this loan to increase her stock.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

KHADY A. est née en 1966 à thies .elle est mariée et mère d'une fille.elle vit au quartier keur ablaye yakhine avec son mari.elle s'active dans le commerce depuis plus de 15 ans avec l'aide de son mari .son activité consiste à acheter de la marchandises en quantité et qu'elle revend aux détaillants.avec l'approche du ramadan elle sollicite ce pret pour renforcer ses stocks.

loans.use: To buy and sell foodstuffs

loans.name: Ameth

texts.fr:
Mr. Ameth T. is a young unmarried man born on 15 May 1981 in Thies. He has been a member of the UIMCEC loan program for three years, and is a hairdresser by profession. He repaid two previous loans without incident. He is asking for this loan with the goal of supplying himself with hairstyling equipment and improving his salon.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

mr T. est un jeune célibataire né le 15/05/1981 à thies .il est societaire de U IMCEC dep trois ans et exerce la profession de coiffeur .il aeu à rembourser deux prets correctement .il demande cette somme dans le but de s'approvisionner en matériels de coiffure et améliorer le cadre de son salon.

loans.use: To buy hairstyling equipment and redo his salon

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Rehema S. is a twenty-eight-year-old married woman from Dar es Salaam. Rehema owns and operates a small stall, which she established six months ago, from which she sells roasted fish. She buys fresh fish daily from local fishermen as they come in with their morning catch. Rehema roasts and sells these fish either in the fish market or along the roads of Dar. Given its location along the Indian Ocean, fish is plentiful in the waters around Dar es Salaam and is a staple of the local Tanzanian diet. Rehema is an enterprising micro-entrepreneur who is taking advantage of a local need to make monthly profits of 120 USD. She is currently requesting a loan of 225 USD in order to purchase fish in larger quantities. In the future, Rehema plans to open another stall to sell her delectable treats.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of fish in bulk

loans.name: Boubou

texts.fr:
Boubou F. is a vulcanizer by trade who was born in 1974 in Ndary. He has a workshop in the Som quarter of Thiès where he runs his business with his brother. He is requesting this loan so he can increase his supply of tires and stock up on motor vehicle oil.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

boubou F. est un vulganisateur de profession né en 1974 à ndary .il a un atelier au quartier som de thies oui il mène ses activités avec son frère.il demande ce pret en vue de renforcer son stock de pneus et de s'approvisioner en huile pour les moteurs de véhicule.

loans.use: Purchase of tires, oil, and rims

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr:
Abdou D. has been a tailor for more than 10 years. He was born August 13, 1971 in Thiès and is single with no children. He is requesting this loan so he can buy a new sewing machine which will allow him to keep up with customer demand.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

abdou D. est un tailleur depuis plus de 10 ans.il est né le 13/08/01971 à thies et est célibataire sans enfants. il demande ce pret dans le but d'acheter une nouvelle machine à coudre pour satisfaire davantage sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Nessy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Nessy N. is thirty-two years old. She is married with a two-year-old child. She also takes care of two other dependents who live with her because they attend school in the area. Earlier this year, Nessy opened a small shop from which she sells African traditional cloth. Local Tanzanian women purchase cloth from Nessy’s shop and use it to make vitenge, the traditional dress worn by Tanzanian women. Nessy runs the store with one employee and earns about 100 USD in profit each month. Nessy is requesting a loan of 275 USD in order to purchase additional stock of African traditional cloth in bulk. Nessy expects to earn about 200 USD from increased sales after getting this loan. In the future she hopes to increase the quantity and range of the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of traditional African cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Moussa N. is a young disabled man who was born in 1982 in Thiès. After abandoning his studies, he decided to start selling spare parts so he would not have to resort to begging. He is requesting this loan so he can increase his supply of parts.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

moussa N. est un jeune handicapé né en 1982 à thies.après avoir abandonné les études il a préféré faire du petit commerce de pièces détachées pour ne pas se rabattre dans la mendicité .il veut renouveler ses stocks c'est pour cela qu'il demande ce pret.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a teenage son. She lives in Melitopol with her family and runs her business selling men’s clothing in the central market. She launched her enterprise 9 years ago. Presently, she already has about $4000 in merchandise. Her turnover capital is about $1800. Her net profit amounts to $800.

Irina has rich experience working in this business. The first time she applied for Nadiya Ukraine financial assistance was 6 years ago. Ever since, her business has expanded, and she gained a reputation as an entrepreneur of integrity and great potential. Irina has consistent credit history in Nadiya Ukraine. We believe her positive standing and strong determination to achieve even higher goals will help her succeed and repay her loan on time.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth M. is a married woman. She resides in the Temeke District in Dar es Salaam. She has a poultry business. She keeps both layers and broilers. It takes almost six months for layers to get the first harvest, while broilers take three years. She meets the daily demands of her family with her business. Her plan is to expand the business to increase sales. She needs a loan of $900 to meet her goals.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Selina Y. is thirty years old and is married with two children aged four and 11. She also supports an additional dependent who lives with her because this young girl’s parents cannot take care of her. Selina owns a shop where she sells rice, sugar, beans, wheat flour and maize flour. She is assisted by her husband and an employee in running her business. Selina earns about 600 USD from this business monthly. Selina is requesting a loan of 525 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, beans and wheat flour. In the future, Selina plans to open another business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase supplies in bulk for her store

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is divorced with two daughters and a son. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol where she sells leather goods in the central city market. She has been in this business for 10 years. Currently, Irina has about $2000 in inventory. Her net profit amounts to $600 a month.

Irina has been using Nadiya Ukraine's lending services for about 7 years. This time she is seeking a 5000 Grivna loan to purchase additional merchandise, increase her assortment of inventory, and generate additional income. We believe her ability to run the financial end of the enterprise and handle stress well will secure prompt loan repayment and consistent development of Irina’s enterprise.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Abdoulaye N. is a merchant by trade with five years experience. He is single and lives in the Randoulène Sud quarter. With Ramadan approaching, he is requesting this loan so he can increase his amount of stock.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

abdoulaye N. est un commerçant de profession qui a une expérience de cinq ans dans ce secteur d'activité .il est célibataire et vit au quartier randoulène sud. avec l'approche du ramadan ,il sollicite ce pret dans le but de renforcer ses stocks.

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana has two grown children. She started working as a market vendor 6 years ago. Today she runs her own business selling men’s suits in the central city market. Presently, Svetlana has about $4000 of working capital. Her monthly profit amounts to $600.

There are very few other businesses selling similar items in the market where Svetlana has her kiosk. Because of this, customer demand continues to grow all the time. Svetlana has established a reputation as an entrepreneur of integrity. She has repaid every loan she has received from Nadiya Ukraine without any defaults. Svetlana is requesting a loan for 3000 Grivnas to re-stock her inventory before the fall season. Compelling prices and a wide range of fashion choices to suit every taste and lifestyle will attract many new male clients to Svetlana’s business. An increase in sales will help her generate more profit and develop her trade even more.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Latifa R. was born thirty-five years ago; she's married with two children, ages 10 and 16. In 2005, Latifa established her poultry business (kuku) which enables her to earn a monthly profit of 500 USD. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Who or what are "kuku," you may ask. Kuku means "chickens" in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. They require little start-up capital: you can start with two and wait for them to multiply naturally! They also require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Latifa is requesting the loan of 875 USD in order to purchase 400 chicks and additional feed. In the future, Latifa plans to buy even more chicks and expand her business further!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional chicks and feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Magdalena M. is twenty-seven years old. She is married with two children, ages one and five. She also has an additional dependent who lives with her because he is an orphan. In 2004, Magdalena established a business selling traditional African cloth that is used by local women to fashion their traditional outifts, called "vitenge." Magdalena runs her shop with the assistance of one employee and earns monthly profits of 400 USD. She is requesting a loan of 875 USD in order to purchase additional cloth and dye to manufacture this African traditional cloth. In the future, she hopes to make enough profit to open another business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. loans.use: To buy cloth in bulk for her business

loans.name: Sifa

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Sifa J. is from Dar es Salaam. She is married and has three children between the ages of four and 12. Sifa has been running a Mama Lishe or local café since 2005, from which she earns a monthly profit of 500 USD. Sifa is assisted by one employee and her husband in running the business. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is "restaurant" or "café," you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces. Sifa is requesting a loan of 275 USD in order to purchase additional stocks of rice, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies for her cafe

loans.name: Rosmeri

texts.es:
Rosmeri is 29 years old and lives with her sister L., who dedicates herself to selling ceramic. Currently, Rosmeri is a seamstress who makes clothes using a knitting machine. She has always liked to work, and has been doing it for two years. She has a knitting machine in her home, which she uses to make hats, sweaters, pants, etc. She offers her goods for sale at the markets in the city of Juliaca. Her work is very well-received among the area’s residents. What she enjoys most is her knitting, an art she’s been inclined toward since she was a young girl. The most difficult aspect of her work is finishing her clothing on time, given that many of the items require a great deal of effort and she works alone. Rosmeri would like to start a family, for whom she wants to be able to offer a stable financial future.

With the money she is asking for, she will purchase more raw materials for making clothing and – if possible – another machine so someone can help her with her work. In the future, Rosmeri would like to have a small general store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Rosmeri tiene 29 años, vive con su hermana L., quien se dedica a la venta de cerámica. Actualmente, Rosmeri se dedica al tejido a máquina de prendas de vestir, a ella siempre le ha gustado trabajar y lo viene haciendo desde hace ya doce años atrás.En su casa, ella posee una máquina de tejer, en la cual elabora diferentes tipos de prendas entre gorritos, chompas, pantalones, etc. que ofrece en los mercados de la ciudad de Juliaca, los cuales tienen gran acogida dentro de la población.Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es el tejer, ya que desde niña siempre tuvo inclinación ante este arte, lo más difícil de su trabajo es terminar a tiempo las prendas que venderá, ya que en muchos casos la elaboración demora un poco ya que lo hace sola. Rosmeri quiere formar una familia, a la cual poder ofrecerle un buen futuro económico. Con el dinero que solicita comprara más materia prima para la producción de sus prendas y si es posible otra máquina, para que alguien la ayude en el trabajo, en el futuro Rosmeri quisiera tener una pequeña tienda de abarrotes.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials (yarn) and another knitting machine.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Gloria M. lives in Dar es Salaam where she owns a Mama Lishe (local cafe) that she established in 2004. She is assisted by three employees in the running of her café and earns monthly profit of about 300 USD. When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is "restaurant" or "café," you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all local: rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces. Gloria is requesting a loan of 800 USD in order to purchase a microwave and to make renovations to her café. Gloria hopes that her larger café will be able to hold more customers and thus enable her to expand her business and earn increased profits in the near future.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. loans.use: To buy additional supplies for her cafe

loans.name: Yanet Rosa

texts.es:
Yanet is 33 years old and a single mother who lives with her four children: Mery, who is 12, Yeni, 10 years old, Esther, 4 years of age, and Albino, who is only one. Yanet was born in the Pusi district, but has lived in the city of Juliaca for four years now. She did not finish her education given that she had to start work at a young age to help out her family financially. Yanet has dedicated herself to a number of occupations which is how, two years ago, she began selling clothing door-to-door throughout Juliaca. She enjoys this business because the clothing is much sought-after by local residents. The most difficult part is moving her merchandise around to sell. Thanks to God, she counts on the support of her children who are always close to help her with her daily sales which she carries out all day. Yanet had to help her children get ahead single-handedly, and wants to bring them better opportunities as they grow and become men and women. With the money from her loan, she thinks she will purchase more merchandise so she can in that way increase her income. In addition, she would like to open a clothing store so she can feel successful as a person and to provide a better quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Yanet tiene 33 años, es madre soltera, vive con sus cuatro hijos; Mery de 12, Yeni de 10, Esther de 4 y Albino de 1 añito. Yanet nació en el distrito de Pusi, pero reside en la ciudad de Juliaca hace 4 años, no terminó sus estudios primarios debido a que se tuvo que trabajar para ayudar a su familia con la economía. Yanet se ha dedicado a trabajar en diferentes ocupaciones, es así, que hace dos años se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Juliaca, gustándole este negocio ya que la ropa es muy solicitada por la gente, lo más difícil es tener que trasladar la mercadería hasta el lugar de venta, gracias a Dios cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, los cuales siempre están cerca para ayudarla durante la venta que es todo el día. Yanet tuvo que sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos sola, ella quiere brindarles un mejor porvenir para que sean hombres y mujeres de provecho. Con el dinero del préstamo piensa adquirir mercadería y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos, además desea abrir una tienda de ropa, para sentirse exitosa como persona y para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell (clothing) and, later own, establish her own store.

loans.name: Josephene

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is thirty-eight-year-old Josephene M.. She is married with four children between the ages of two and 18. Josephene operates a stall from which she sells traditional African cloth; she opened the stall in 2006. Josephine’s business sells a wide variety of colorful cloth with different patterns that Tanzanian women buy to fashion vitenge, their traditional outfit. The stall earns her about 100 USD per month in profits. Josephene is now requesting a loan of 875 USD to purchase large stocks of traditional African cloth in bulk. This will allow her to expand her customer base and thus earn increased profits. In the future, Josephene hopes to increase the quantity and range of cloth offered at her store even further.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies of cloth in bulk

loans.name: Jessica Yeniz

texts.es:
Jessica is a member of the communal bank “Amor Divino”.

Jessica is single and 29 years old. She studies communications sciences and, along with her mother, sells clothes and shoes which they offer to friends and family on credit. Jessica sells to her friends and schoolmates at the university, while her mother sells to her workmates. Her products are purchased in the city of Lima, which they visit on a monthly basis. In addition, Jessica works as an administrative assistant at the Magdalena parish.

Jessica needs a loan of 1,500 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of blouses, sweaters and pants.

Jessica’s dreams include wanting a stable business for her mother, having a store of her own, and getting her professional title.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Jessica es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.

Jessica es soltera y tiene 29 años, Jessica estudia ciencias de la comunicación, Jessica junto a su mama, venden ropa, calzados que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Jessica vende a sus amigos, compañeras de universidad, mientras que su mama lo ofrece a sus compañeras de trabajo, sus productos son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima a donde viajan mensualmente. Además Jessica trabaja como personal administrativo en la parroquia de la Magdalena.

Jessica necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de blusas, chompas, pantalones.

Los sueños de Jessica son que su mamá tenga un negocio estable, tener una tienda y sacar su titulo profesional.

loans.use: Jessica needs a loan of 1,500 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of blouses, sweaters and pants.

loans.name: Anatolia

texts.es:
Anatolia is a member of the communal bank “Amor Divino”.

Anatolia is married, 43 years old and has six children. Anatolia sells natural medicines at the wholesale food market of the city of Ayacucho. Anatolia locates herself at the same spot each day from 5:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m. She learned this activity from her husband who is a native of the Peruvian jungle. Anatolia travels to the central jungle on a monthly basis to purchase medicinal plants, tree resin and bark.

Anatolia needs a loan of 2,000 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of dry herbs, resin and rubber plant.

Anatolia dreams of having a home, a well-stocked store, making more sales and providing an education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Anatolia es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.

Anatolia es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 6 hijos, Anatolia vende medicinas naturales de manera ambulatoria en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Anatolia se ubica diariamente en el mismo lugar a las 5 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la mañana, actividad que aprendió de su esposo que es nativo de la selva peruana, Anatolia viaja mensualmente a la selva central a comprar plantas medicinales, resinas de árboles, cortezas.

Anatolia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de hierbas secas, resinas y palo de goma.

Anatolia sueña con tener una casa, una tienda surtida, vender por mayor y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Anatolia needs a loan of 2,000 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of dry herbs, resin and rubber plant.

loans.name: Orfelinda, Alejandra Y Graciela Group

texts.es:
Orfelinda, Alejandra and GracieL. are members of the communal bank “Amor Divino”.

Orfelinda is partnered, 43 years old and has three children. Orfelinda sells clothing that she offers to friends and relatives on credit. Orfelinda also makes cakes and chocolates, which she sells at wholesale to stores and she also takes orders.

Alejandra is married, 27 years old and has two children. Alejandra used to sell chickens and vegetables from a rented stand, but has had to leave the business due to the fact that her son is too small.

Meanwhile, GracieL. is married, 39 years old and has four children. GracieL. sells fish and trout in an ambulatory manner at the market of the city of Ayacucho and also door-to-door.

Orfelinda, Alejandra and GracieL. need a loan of 900 soles, 600 soles and 1,000 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of sweaters, jackets and trout. Alejandra will use the funds to make improvements to her home.

Orfelinda, Alejandra and GracieL. dream of having a bakery, a restaurant, traveling abroad to work, and having their own home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Orfelinda, Alejandra y GracieL. son socias del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.

Orfelinda es conviviente, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Orfelinda venD. ropa que ofrece a amigos familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Además Orfelinda elabora tortas, chocolates que venD. por mayor a las tiendas y también atienD. pedidos.

Por otro lado Alejandra es casada, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Alejandra vendía pollos y verduras en un puesto alquilado y actualmente ha dejado D. realizar su negocio porque su hijo esta muy pequeño.

Mientras que GracieL. es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, GracieL. venD. pescado y truchas D. manera ambulatoria en el mercado D. abastos D. L. ciudad D. Ayacucho y también D. casa en casa.

Orfelinda, Alejandra y GracieL. necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en L. compra D. chompas, casacas, truchas y Alejandra lo utilizara realizando mejoras en su casa.

Los sueños D. Orfelinda, Alejandra y GracieL. son tener una pastelería, un restaurante, viajar al extranjero a trabajar y tener casa propia

loans.use: Orfelinda, Alejandra and Graciela need a loan of 900 soles, 600 soles, and 1,000 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of sweaters, jackets, and trout.  Alejandra will use the funds to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia is a member of the communal bank “Urpicha”, which means “little bird” in Quechua.

Felicia is married, 35 years old, and has three children. Felicia lives in a rented house located on a busy street. Felicia has a store in her house where, along with her husband’s help, she sells groceries, vegetables, fruit, meats, ice creams, drinks and office supplies from 6:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m. every day.

Felicia needs a loan of 1,000 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of rice and sugar.

Felicia dreams of running a well-stocked mini-mart, of owning her own home with all the necessary amenities, and of her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Felicia es socia del Banco Comunal Urpicha que significa pajarito en quechua.

Felicia es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 3 hijos, Felicia vive en una casa alquilado ubicada en una avenida concurrida, Felicia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, carnes, helados, bebidas, útiles de escritorio, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo.

Felicia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.

Felicia sueña con tener un minimarket surtido, casa propia con todas las comodidades y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Felicia needs a loan of 1,000 soles, to be invested into the purchase of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila is a member of the communal bank “Urpicha”, which means “little bird” in Quechua.

Teofila is married, 45 years old and has nine children of whom five still live with her. Teofila lives in a rustic home in the San José neighborhood, a zone that was invaded a few years ago. Teofila has a small store where she sells groceries, vegetables, fruit, wood and drinks. Teofila also has laborers make clay bricks for her, which she also sells in her store. On Saturdays and Sundays she travels to the markets of the region where she sells her groceries and fruit. In turn, at those markets she buys cereals and cheeses which she sells in her neighborhood and in the markets in Ayacucho.

Teofila needs a loan of 1,000 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of wood and clay from which to make her bricks.

Teofila dreams of improving her business, expanding her store and having her own working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Urpicha que significa pajarito en quechua.

Teofila es casada, tiene 45 años y tiene 9 hijos de los cuales 5 viven con ella, Teofila vive en casa rustica en el barrio de San José zona que fue invadida hace algunos años. Teofila tiene una pequeña tienda en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, leña y bebidas. Además Teofila manda elaborar adobes con peones, los cuales son vendidos en el mismo lugar. Los días sábados y domingos viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes, frutas y de las ferias compra cereales, quesos que vende en su barrio y en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Teofila necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que fue invertido en la compra de leña y tierra para hacer los adobes.

Teofila sueña con mejorar sus negocios, ampliar su tienda y tener un capital propio.

loans.use: Teofila needs a loan of 1,000 soles, funds that will be invested into the purchase of wood and clay from which to make bricks.

loans.name: Antonieta, Liliana Y Tabiña Group

texts.es:
Antonieta, Liliana and Tabiña are members of the communal bank “Urpicha”, which means “little bird” in Quechua.

Antonieta is partnered, 25 years old and has one child. Antonieta sells canned condiments that she hand makes herself at home with the help of her brothers. She sells her products at wholesale from store-to-store.

Liliana is also partnered, 21 years old and has two children. Liliana sells “salchipollos” (a typical Peruvian food prepared with chicken and potatoes) in the afternoons on a busy street in her neighborhood.

In the meantime, Tabiña is partnered, 20 years old and has a one daughter. Tabiña sells wood from her parents’ home, which is where she lives.

Antonieta, Liliana and Tabiña need loans of 600 soles, 600 soles, and 400 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of cinnamon, potatoes and wood.

Antonieta, Liliana and Tabiña’s dreams include building their own houses, having all the necessary comforts of home, providing a good education for their children, and having a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva volunteer.

Antonieta, Liliana y Tabiña son socias del Banco Comunal Urpicha que significa pajarito en quechua.

Antonieta es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Antonieta vende condimentos envasados que ella misma elabora de manera artesanal en su casa con la ayuda de sus hermanos, sus ventas los realiza al por mayor de tienda en tienda.

Por otro lado Liliana es conviviente, tiene 21 años y 2 hijos, Liliana vende salchipollos por las tardes en una calle concurrida de su barrio.

Mientras que Tabiña es conviviente, tiene 20 años y una hija, Tabiña vende leña en la casa de sus padres en donde vive.

Antonieta, Liliana y Tabiña necesitan prestamos de 600 soles, 600 soles, 400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de canela, papa y leña.

Los sueños de Antonieta, Liliana y Tabiña son construir su casa, tener todas las comodidades, brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, tener un restaurante.

loans.use: Antonieta, Liliana and Tabiña need loans of 600 soles, 600 soles, and 400 soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of cinnamon, potatoes and wood.

loans.name: Coura

texts.fr:
Mrs. Coura G. has been a restaurant owner for about ten years. She has a good reputation thanks to the quality of her meals.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Mme coura G. est restauratrice depuis une dizaine d'annee. Elle a une bonne reputation grace a la qualite de ses repas.

loans.use: Catering

loans.name: Yacine

texts.fr:
Yacine N. is a seamstress who was born in 1962 in Thies. She is married with three children and has opened her shop near the UIMCEC office in Thies. She has recruited two tailors who make women’s clothing and she is responsible for the sale of this clothing to her clients. In preparation for the religious holidays, she would like to increase her stock of cloth and sewing supplies.

Translated by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

yacine N. est une couturière née en 1962 à thies .elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants.elle a ouvert un atelier pres du bureau de UIMCEC DE THIES.elle a recruté deux tailleurs qui font de la confection d'habits de femmes et c'est elle qui est chargée de la revente à ses clients .c'est dans le but de préparer les fetes religieuses qu'elle veut renforcer ses stocks de tissus et de fournitures de couture.

loans.use: The sale of ready-to-wear women's clothing

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Mrs. Fatoumata S. is an experienced merchant who sells in-season fruits and vegetables. She is married and with the income she earns she helps her husband in providing for their family (the education of their children and medical bills). With this loan she hopes to increase her stock of fruits and vegetables to meet the demand of her clientele.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Fatoumata S. est une commercante experimentee dans son activite de vente de fruits et legumes en fonction des saisons. Elle est mariee et avec les revenus generes par son activite et elle aide son maridans la prise en charge des besoins familiaux (education des enfants et frais medicaux). Elle envisage avec le credit qu'elle sollicite de renforcer son stock de fruits et legumes pour mieux fideliser sa clientele.

loans.use: To increase her stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Dieyla

texts.fr:
Mrs. Dieyla N. earns a living selling vegetables with a quick turnover of stock. To satisfy a strong demand for her products, she is requesting a loan to increase her stock.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Mme Dieyla N. exploite un commerce de legumes avec une forte rotation de stock . Pour satisfaire une forte demande , elle sollicite un credit pour renforcer son stock

loans.use: Increase of stock

loans.name: Les Lingueres De Falokh Serre Group

texts.fr:
Working together as a group named « Les Lingueres », these women, each whom is married with children, have started a business selling food products (rice, grains, milk, soap, peanut butter) to earn a living and to free themselves from the financial authority of their husbands. For two years they have been working with UIMCEC thanks to the various loans that they have been granted. The loans they obtain help strengthen the business income that they each earn by allowing them to purchase increased amounts of product to sell.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Réunues au sein d'un groupement dénommé les lingueres ,ces femmes toute mariée et mére de plusieurs enfants ont initié des activités de vente de produits alimentaires (riz ,céréales ,lait,savon, pattes d 'arachide ) pour gagner leur vie et s'affrachire financierement de la tutelle de leur mari.Pendant deux (02); elles sont accompagnées par l ' UIMCEC grace à differents prets qui leur sont octroyer.Les prets obtenus servent à renforcer le fonds de commerce de chacune d'elle par l "achat de quantités plus importante de marchandises.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Diana Zoraida

texts.es:
Diana is 24 years old and lives with her husband and children. Each day she sells snacks to people from a corner near her house. A while ago she was able to get a small grill which was sufficient to prepare the kebabs she sells. In the morning, she usually goes to purchase the meat and then prepares the kebabs, and in the afternoons and evenings she sells them in the street. She's been doing this work for 3 years and she likes that she still has time to take care of her children.

6 months ago, she had to stop her work as she gave birth to her baby at only 7 months, and she needed to care for the baby's health. Now she is returning to her work as her baby has grown stronger. Even with the rough climate and cold days, she bundles up in a coat and continues her work. Her desire to take care of her children and improve their quality of life is her great motivation. Diana is requesting a loan to purchase more of the ingredients she needs to prepare the kebabs, such as meat and sausage. She would like to continue to grow her business and increase her income in the future.

Diana tiene 24 años, vive con 3 de sus 4 hijos y con su esposo. Diariamente vende anticuchos (brochetas) en una esquina cercana a su casa, hace poco pudo adquirir una parrilla adecuada para su actividad. Por lo general, en las mañanas va a comprar el corazón y las salchichas para la preparación, y sale por las tardes y noches a vender.Esto lo viene haciendo desde hace 3 años, a ella le agrada esta actividad porque no requiere de todo su tiempo y puede atender a sus hijas, pero hace 6 meses ella dejó su trabajo porque dio a luz una bebe sietemesina y tuvo que cuidar de su salud, ahora volverá a retomar su negocio porque su bebe ya se ha fortalecido.Una dificultad, pero que no la detiene, es el clima, algunos días suelen ser muy fríos, para ello Diana sale bien abrigada y con una pequeña carpa. Su esfuerza para tener mayores recursos para sostener a sus hijas y a futuro mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar. Diana solicita un préstamo para implementarse con palitos, carne y salchichas. Ella se ven el un futuro con un negocio más grande y con mejores ganancias.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE INGREDIENTS SUCH AS MEAT AND SAUSAGE FOR THE KEBABS SHE SELLS .  SHE WOULD LIKE TO GROW HER SMALL BUSINESS AND INCREASE HER INCOME SO THAT SHE CAN CONTINUE TO TAKE CARE OF HER FAMILY.

loans.name: Auria Nancy

texts.es:
Auria is 46 years old and lives with her husband and their 4 children. She works selling various brands of beer from a small bar she runs. She's had the business for a year and a half, and she works at the bar all day. In addition to the bar, she also has a business where they provide computer services and copies. That shop is staffed with employees, so that Auria can run the bar. She knows that running the bar requires a great deal of responsibility, because you have to be careful about your customers when you sell alcohol. Most of her customers are workers, who come to have a chat with friends.

Auria works hard at these businesses so that she can pay for her children's education. She is requesting a loan to purchase beer in greater quantities so that her bar is better stocked and the business continues to grow.

Auria tiene 46 años, actualmente vive con sus 4 hijos y su esposo. Su trabajo es la venta de cerveza de todas las marcas en un local que ha adecuado para ello. Viene haciendo esto cerca de un año y medio, atiende en su bar casi todo el día, paralelo a esto tiene un negocio de impresiones a computadora, contrata personal para esto, mientras ella se dedica enteramente a la atención de su bar.Auria sabe que se debe haber mucha responsabilidad en la vende de bebidas alcohólicas, por lo cual es exigente en seleccionar a su clientela, que por lo general son personas que trabajan y vienen a su bar para poder charlar y beber de manera amistosa, cada cliente tiene un tiempo limitado para estar allí y de esa manera evita que se embriaguen. El esfuerzo de Auria se debe al sostenimiento de la educación para sus hijos. Solicita un préstamo para obtener mayor cantidad de cajas de cerveza, desea seguir adelante y poder mejorar las instalaciones de su bar.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE BEER FOR THE SMALL BAR SHE RUNS, AND CONTINUE TO GROW HER BUSINESS WHICH PROVIDES INCOME FOR HER FAMILY.

loans.name: Celina Dalila

texts.es:
Celina is 22 years old and lives with her husband and their 9 year old son. After completing a program in cosmetology, she set up a small salon in her home. She runs the business every day, offering all kinds of hair cuts, color treatments, make up, etc. Her prices are fair and she offers good quality. The salon is now 2 years old thanks to a lot of hard work. This motivates Celina to work even harder and she likes her business, but her expenses are also growing as the business grows. Now there are new regulations from the city to file different papers. She is requesting the loan to purchase necessary items for her salon like a new hair dryer, as well as pay the necessary fees to the city so that she can operate her business

Celina tiene 32 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo de 9 años. Luego de prepararse en un centro de educación ocupacional en la especialidad de cosmetología, ella decidió instalar su fuente de ingreso en su casa, es así, que tiene su propio salón de belleza, donde atiende todos los días, durante todo el día, ofrece todo tipo de cortes de cabello, tintes, maquillaje, etc. sus precios son módicos y su trabajo de calidad.El salón de Celina ya ha cumplido 2 años de intensa labor, esto le anima a seguir adelante ya que le gusta mucho lo que hace, además cada vez tiene mejores ingresos, ahora está en los todos los trámites de regulación y permisos municipales para tener todos sus papeles en regla. Celina solicita este préstamo porque con ello implementará su salón, podrá adquirir una nueva secadora de cabello y culminar el pago para el permiso municipal.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A NEW HAIR DRYER FOR HER SALON, AS WELL AS PAY THE NEW FEES IMPOSED BY THE CITY TO RUN HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Isabel Violeta

texts.es:
Isabel is 23 years old and lives with her brother and father. Half a year ago, she opened her phone shop realizing that there was an opportunity in her area for phone service as well as internet access. She runs her shop from Monday to Friday, resting on the weekends as she is pregnant. Her brother takes care of the shop on Saturdays and Sundays. isabel likes the business which allows her to take care of her family. As the baby's father is irresponsible, she will have to take care of her baby on her own. In the future she would like to open more locations for her business.

She is requesting a loan to purchase phone cards, as well as apply for the licensing she needs from her municipality.

Isabel tiene 23 años, vive con su hermana y su padre, ella está actualmente embarazada. En sus enormes deseos de superación decide abrir su locutorio hace mas de medio año, invirtiendo así, adecuadamente su capital, con buen ojo se percató que ese servicio era lo que necesitaba su localidad.También agregó cabinas de Internet, atiende de lunes a viernes, los fines de semana descansa dejando a su hermana en el cuidado y atención, Isabel está satisfecha de este trabajo que le permite el sustento de su familia y con el que podrá mantener a su bebe, ya que se valdrá sola, debido a la irresponsabilidad del que fue su pareja. En el futuro quiere tener varios establecimientos, y adicionalmente una botica. Isabel solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas, recargas virtuales y también realizar el trámite para la licencia de funcionamiento municipal.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE PHONE CARDS FOR HER BUSINESS, AS WELL AS PAY FOR THE APPLICATION TO OBTAIN A LICENSE FOR HER BUSINESS.

loans.name: Charita Mercedes

texts.es:
Charita is 33 years and lives with her 4 children and her elderly parents. She is a hardworking woman and for two years now she's worked selling grains and dried corn. Twice a week she travels to the jungle region to sell her merchandise in the city market. Once there, she can purchase fruit at wholesale prices and take it back with her to sell in her city of Huancayo. This work allows her to support her 4 children who all attend school. As she is separated from her husband, Charita has sole responsibility for her family's support

Her work becomes difficult during the rainy season, when she can't get to the places she needs to go to buy and sell her merchandise. If the roads are impassable, the fruit often goes bad before she can sell it. She is requesting this loan to invest in more stock and grow her business. She would like to be able to move her products by car or truck in the future, and sell them from her own small shop.

Charita tiene 33 años, vive con sus 4 hijos y sus ancianos padres. Ella es una mujer de mucho esfuerzo, desde hace 2 años se viene dedicando a la venta de granos; tales como habas y maíz seco, viaja a la selva dos veces por semana para vender sus granos en el mercado de esa ciudad.Allí en la selva compra fruta al por mayor para venderla en su ciudad, Huancayo. De esta manera puede sostener a sus 4 hijos que están estudiando, ya que ella es el único sostén que ellos tienen. Charita es separada de su esposo y sola corre con la economía de su hogar, por lo que cada día trabaja con mucho empeño en su casa seleccionando los granos de que ha vender y de esa manera, tener lista la mercadería para salir de viaje. Le agrada ver de cerca lo que puede comprar para luego vender, las dificultades se presentan cuando en la época de lluvia, las carreteras se hacen inaccesibles, lo cual puede ocasionarle pérdidas y deterioro de la fruta. Solicita este préstamo para adquirir más mercadería, que le permita mayores ganancias, ella se ve un futuro moviendo un gran capital y traer por camionadas sus productos para venderlos en un local exclusivo para ello.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK TO HELP GROW HER BUSINESS SELLING GRAIN, DRIED CORN AND  FRUIT.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
hjdhfghfdgn
fgjfjgnfg

fgjnfng

loans.use: Venta de comida, biens, higenicos

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel lives in the 3-80 neighborhood of Managua. She runs a convenience store out of her home. She is married, and she also cares for her 78-year-old mother. The loans she is requesting will be used to build a room for her mother, because in to her advanced age she needs comfort and privacy. Maria Isabel has had her business for 12 years, starting out by selling caramels and beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Doña Maria Isabel habita en el barrio 3-80 de Managua, en su casa de habitación tiene una pulpería la cual es atendida por ella misma. Es casada y a su cargo tiene a su madre de 78 años de edad. El préstamo será usado para la construcción de una habitación para su mamá, ya que por su avanzada edad, necesita de comodidad y privacidad. Doña Maria Isabel tiene 12 años de tener su pequeño negocio el cual empezó con ventas de caramelos y refrescos.

loans.use: Build a room for her mother / Construcción de un cuarto para su madre

loans.name: Hermes

texts.es:
Heremes is 37 years old and lives in the 3-80 neighborhood of Managua. He is married, and his wife takes care of the home and their two daughters, ages 6 and 8, during the day. Hermes is a taxi driver, and he also has rooms in his home that he rents out to different people. He has been driving taxis for 13 years, and hopes that within a short amount of time he'll be able to upgrade his cab for a newer model. The loan he is requesting will be used to remodel his tenants' rooms to provide them more services and make them feel more comfortable. With the money, he will purchase beams and zinc sheets to re-roof these rooms, since over time it has deteriorated.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

Hermes tiene 37 años de edad, habita en el barrio 3-80 de Managua, es casado, su esposa es ama de casa, tiene 2 hijas de 6 y 8 años de edad. Hermes es taxista, y también tiene un su vivienda habitaciones que alquila a diferentes personas. Tiene 13 años de ser taxista y espera dentro de muy poco tiempo poder cambiar su unidad de taxi por una más nueva. El motivo del préstamo es para la remodelación de las habitaciones de sus inquilinos para así darles un mejor servicio y que sus clientes se sientan más cómodos. Con el dinero comprará perlines y zinc para cambirles el techo a estas habitaciones, ya que el paso del tiempo los ha deteriorado.

loans.use: Put up a new roof and beams over the rooms he rents / Cambiar techo y perlines de una habitación de alquiler

loans.name: Norma Y Maria Group

texts.es:
Norma is single, 34 years old and has 1 child. Norma sells food in the settlement of Yanama, she prepares breakfast and dinner. She is planning to open a new business; a grocery store.

On the other hand Maria is married, 47 years old and has 6 children. Every week Maria travels to the “Ayacuchana” jungle where she sells vegetables and buys fruit to be sold at the market in the town of Ayacucho.

Norma and Maria need loans of 1500 and 600 soles respectively to be invested in the purchase of groceries, oranges and pineapples. Their dream is to educate their children as professionals, improve their businesses and build their houses.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Norma es soltera, tiene 34 años y 1 hijo, Norma vende comida en el asentamiento humano de Yanama, prepara desayuno y cena, Norma tiene proyectado iniciar un nuevo negocio que es una tienda de abarrotes.

Mientras que Maria es casada, tiene 47 años y 6 hijos, Maria viaja a la selva ayacuchana todas las semanas en donde vende verduras y de la selva compra frutas que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Norma y Maria necesitan prestamos de 1500 soles, 600 soles, respectivamente, dinero que será invertido en la compra de abarrotes, naranja, piña. Los sueños de Norma y Maria son educar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, mejorar sus negocios, construir su casa.

loans.use: Norma and Maria need loans of 1500 and 600 soles respectively to buy groceries, oranges and pineapples in order to increase sales.

loans.name: Felipa Del Socorro

texts.es:
L. is 36 years old, single and has no children. She lives in a small home built on her own efforts with plank walls and earthen floors. She is requesting a loan to tile her home and thus improve her living conditions. She works for Asunción Hospital and the San Ramón Clinic. In her home, she uses solar energy and when it's cloudy she doesn't turn on her lights, but she still is able to use electric appliances like her TV and speakers. She repaid her first loan before the allotted time and has an excellent credit history. She wants to improve her home because the rainy season has made it very muddy. Eventually, she hopes to put up concrete walls to add more security. Currently she is not concerned about a robbery because her mother lives next door, who takes care of it while she is at work.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La joven L., soltera con 36 años de edad, sin hijos, habita en una casita pequeña construida por esfuerzo propio es de paredes de tabla, pizo de tierra, su crédito lo está solicitando para embaldozar y asi tener mejores condiciones, trabaja para el hospital Asunción y la clínica San Ramón, en su vivienda utiliza energía solar y cuando está nublado no encienden las lámparas, pero sí sus aparatos eléctricos como T.V. y equipo de sonido. Esta señora su primer crédito lo canceló antes de la fecha establecida, presentando un excelente récord créditicio, moral de pago y responsabilidad ante los compromisos asumidos, desea mejorar su vivienda porque en la época lluviosa se le hace mucho lodo, posteriormente desea levantar las paredes de concreto, para dar mayor seguridad a su vivienda, en estos momentos no se le han presentado problemas de robo porque junto a su casita está la casa de su mamá, quien le cuida cuando ella está en su trabajo.

loans.use: Tile the floor of her home / Embaldozar piso de su vivienda

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia is a member of the Banco Comunal Las Alondras. She is married, 48 years old and has 4 children. Herminia lives in the District of San Juan Bautista. She sells meat at a stand located on the very popular market, F. Vivanco, in the center of the town of Ayacucho. Herminia, assisted by her husband and daughter, travels to the regional fairs three times a week to buy animals such as cattle, sheep, and pigs to be slaughtered at the town’s slaughterhouse.

Herminia needs a loan of 1600 soles to be invested in buying pigs and sheep. It is her dream to place a roof on the second floor of her house, start a business for her daughter, and set up a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Herminia es socia del Banco Comunal Las Alondras. Herminia es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos. Vive en el distrito D. San Juan Bautista donD. venD. carne en un puesto ubicado en el mercado F. Vivanco, un mercado con mucha concurrencia porque se ubica en el centro D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Herminia viaja a las ferias D. la región 3 veces por semana donD. compra animales como ganado vacuno, porcino, caprino, luego lo beneficia en el camal D. la ciudad. Actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo e hija.

Herminia necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cerdos, carnero. Los sueños D. Herminia son techar el segundo piso D. su casa, implementar un negocio para su hija y tener una tienda D. abarrotes.

loans.use: Herminia needs a loan of 1600 soles to be invested in the purchase of cattle, pigs, and sheep.

loans.name: Fidelia Paola

texts.es:
Fidelia Paola is a grocery store clerk at the San Antonio Super. She is 34 years old, married with a 2 1/2 years old girl. She works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. Her niece takes care of her daughter and her only free day during the week is Tuesdays. She has been working for this business for 10 years. She is asking for her 6th loan to repair the floors of her sister's house where she lives and to repair the windows. In the future, she will build her home. She already has purchased the lot with the previous loans. Her husband helps her a little. Fidelia's wish is to be able to apply for a bigger loan in the future to start the construction of her house. She is a very responsible woman. Her previous five loans have been paid properly and on time. She is very satisfied for the courtesy and attention that the personnel of AFODENIC has given her

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Fidelia Paola trabajadora del Súper San Antonio, con 34 años de edad, casada, con una niña de 2½ años, ella trabaja de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm, su hija se la cuida una sobrina, el único día libre es el martes de cada semana, tiene 10 años de laborar para este lugar. Está solicitando su 6to crédito el que utilizará para embaldozar el piso de la casa de su hermana que es donde ella habita y componer las ventanas, en el futuro construirá su casa pues ya compró el terreno con los créditos anteriores; su esposo le ayuda un poco y su mayor ilusión es en el futuro solicitar un crédito mayor para iniciar la construcción de su vivienda. Es una joven muy responsable, sus 5 créditos los ha cancelado en tiempo y forma, se siente satisfecha por la atención con que ha sido atendida por el personal de AFODENIC.

loans.use: Floor repairs and restoring the windows.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma is a member of Banco Comunal Alondras. She has a partner, is 32 years old and has 1 daughter. She lives with her parents in the traditional neighborhood of Yaracc Yuracc. Together with her spouse she weaves handcrafted fabrics which she learned from her parents and she also has help from workers depending on the demand. She sells to intermediaries who sell to different department stores in the country. Vilma makes carpets, place mats, blankets or other products depending on orders.

Vilma needs a loan of 1600 soles to be invested in buying wool, thread and dye. It is Vilma’s dream to build her house, sell her fabrics directly to the department stores, and set up a stand at the handicrafts market of the town.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras. Vilma es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 1 hija, Vilma vive aun en la casa de sus padres ubicado en el barrio tradicional de Yuracc Yuracc, Vilma junto a su esposo realizan tejidos artesanales en telar, actividad que aprendió de sus padres, Vilma cuenta además con la ayuda de operarios, dependiendo de la demanda que tiene, sus ventas lo realiza a intermediarios que venden en diferentes departamentos del país. Vilma produce, tapices, individuales, frazadas y otros productos dependiendo de los pedidos.

Vilma necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de lana, hilo y tintes. Vilma sueña son construir su casa, vender sus productos directamente a otros departamentos y tener un puesto en el mercado artesanal de la ciudad.

loans.use: Vilma needs a loan of 1600 soles to be invested in buying wool, thread, and dye.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a member of the Alondras Community Bank.

Julia is 39 years old and lives with her partner and 4 children. She travels to regional fairs where she purchases potatoes and grains which she later processes with a rented mill. Julia sells the final product in the San Felipe fair, where she goes every 15 days. While at the same fair, she purchases cheese which she sells for a profit to shopkeepers in Ayacucho.

Julia needs a 1,400 soles loan, which she will use to purchase grains and fruits. Julia's dream is to build and furnish her house, increase the size of her business and develop her own capital stock.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva volunteer.

Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.

Julia es conviviente, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Julia viaja a las ferias D. la región donD. compra papa, cereales que luego los procesa en un molino alquilado, estos productos los comercializa en la feria D. San Felipe a donD. viaja cada 15 días, y D. la feria compra quesos que venD. por mayor a los comerciantes D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho y también venD. en la selva ayacuchana a donD. viaja cada 15 días.

Julia necesita un préstamo D. 1400 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cereales y frutas variadas. Los sueños D. Julia son construir su casa, amoblar su vivienda, ampliar su negocio y tener capital propio.

loans.use: Purchase grains and fruits.

loans.name: Haydee Berta

texts.es:
Haydee is a member of the communal bank called "Alondras."

Haydee is separated from her husband. She's 37 years old. She has 2 kids and one in the way. Haydee used to go to the city of Chincha every week to purchase eggs, but now that she's expecting she can no longer travel long distances. She gets the eggs delivered to her and she sells them by foot at the local supermarket in the city of Ayacucho.

Aside from that, she sells bread, which she purchases at wholesale price from local bakeries, and sells it every weekend with the help of her daughter.

Haydee would like to use this loan to purchase eggs. Haydee dreams to own a home, to continue to work and move ahead, and to own a car to lease and make more money.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.

Haydee es separada, tiene 37 años, 2 hijos y esta esperando a su tercer hijo, Haydee viajaba semanalmente a la ciudad de Chincha en donde compra huevos, pero debido a su estado ya no puede viajar y solamente le envían, sus ventas lo realiza ambulantemente en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Además Haydee los días sábados y domingos vende panes que compra de las panaderías por mayor, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hija.

Haydee necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de huevos. Haydee sueña con tener casa propia, seguir trabajando para salir adelante y tener un carro que le genere mayores ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase eggs

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
Mr. C. is a pharmaceutical sales executive. He is 40 years old and married to his wife, Marlene Amador. They have 5 children: 4 girls and 1 boy. Their eldest daughter studies at the high school, 2 go to elementary school, one of the girls goes to pre-school and the other is 2 years old and doesn't go to school yet. He has worked for Dicegsa Enterprises selling medicines for 9 years and traveling outside Juigalpa as part of his job . He is asking for his fourth loan which will be use to expand his home. It was constructed as part of a project and now it is too small for a family of 7. He will start the room construction because his children are growing and need independence. His wife is helping out a little since she elaborates bedding, mosquito nets, etc. She is a traveling salesperson and gets help from her father. She has worked at this job for 11 years and it has enable them to fulfill the household needs. Mr. C. is a client with an excellent credit record since he has paid the previous three loans in full and on time. He expresses that he will continue with the same disposition and ethic that he has shown before

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. C. es ejecutivo de ventas de fármacos, casado con 40 años de edad, su esposa Marlene Amador, con 5 hijos, 4 niñas y un 1varón, su hija mayor estudia la secundaria, 2 cursan la primaria y una niña en pre-escolar, 1niña de 2 años no estudia, trabaja para la empresa Dicegsa desde hace 9 años, teniendo que salir fuera de Juigalpa a vender los medicamentos. Está solicitando su 4to. crédito el que utilizará para realizar ampliación de su vivienda, ya que ésta fue construida por un proyecto y en estos momentos se hace muy pequeña para la familia de 7 personas. Iniciará la construcción de un cuarto ya que sus hijas e hijos están creciendo y necesita independencia. Su esposa le apoya un poco ya que se dedica a la elaboración de ropa de cama, mosquiteros, etc. además es comerciante ambulante, su papá le ayuda con la venta, tiene 11 años de estar en el negocio, lo que les ha permitido cumplir con las necesidades del hogar. El señor C. es un cliente con un excelente récord créditicio pues ha cancelado sus 3 créditos anteriores en tiempo y forma, manifiesta que continuará con la misma disposición y moral de pago que ha presentado.

loans.use: Expand his home.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia is a member of the communal bank called " Alondras".

She's 34 years old. She's married and has 4 children. Julia owns a locale at the supermarket called "F. Vivanco" where she sells her vegetables, fruits and any other products she purchases in the city of Ayacucho. She goes there very early in the morning each day to buy all her supplies. Aside from that, Julia, together with her husband, have a 'mototaxi' which her husband uses to drive locals everyday in the city.

Julia needs a loan to purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes and corn

Julia's dreams are to one day expand her business and to make a profit this year, to buy a house and to provide the basic necessities for her family.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.

Julia es casada, tiene 34 años y 4 hijos, Julia tiene un puesto en el mercado F. Vivanco en donde vende verduras, tubérculos, sus productos los adquiere en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho a donde acude diariamente por la madrugada. Además Julia junto a su esposo tienen un mototaxi con el cual trabaja su esposo haciendo transporte urbano.

Julia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de tomate, cebolla, papa y maíz.

Los sueños de Julia son ampliar su negocio, tener más capital, casa propia y brindar todo lo necesario a sus hijos.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes and corn

loans.name: Nery Dolores

texts.es:
Nery is an energetic person that works every day of the week as a high school teacher from 1:00 p.m. until 10:00 p.m. On Satudays, she goes to college in Managua to obtain her college degree and on Sundays she instructs from 8:00 a.m. until 4 p.m. She has 3 children, which study, 2 of them at the university (17 & 18 years old) and one that is on first grade. She has been married for 6 years and receives the support of her husband. She is asking for her 3rd loan which she will use to build the walls of a room and give more security and comfort to her children who are reaching adulthood. With the previous loans Mrs. S. was able to cover the bedrooms with plywood, but this time she wants to build concrete walls. She states that the loans have helped her very much and is the only way that they can get ahead because it is very difficult for them to save a certain amount of money to make the much needed home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Nery es una persona muy esforzada que trabaja todos los días de la semana como profesora de secundaria desde la 1:00pm hasta las 10:00pm, los sábados estudia su licenciatura, en managua y los domingos da clase de 8:00am a 4:00pm; tiene 3 hijos, los cuales estudian, dos de ellos en la universidad (17y18 años) uno estudia el 1er. grado. Ella tiene 6 años de estar casada y recibe apoyo de su esposo, está solicitando su 3er. crédito el que utilizará para levantar las paredes de un cuarto y darle mayor seguridad y comodidad a sus hijos ya que están alcanzando la mayoria de edad. La profesora S. con los créditos anteriores logró forrar sus dormitorios con plycen, en esta oportunidad quiere hacer las paredes de concreto. Manifiesta que los créditos le han ayudado mucho y que los asalariados es de la única forma que pueden salir adelante porque se les hace muy difícil reunir una cierta cantidad de dinero para realizar las mejoras de su vivienda.

loans.use: Build the walls for a room.

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es:
Rebeca is a member of the communal bank called " Alondras".

She's 46 years old. She's married and has 4 children, 3 of them are going to school.
