Rebeca goes to 2 local fairs, one located in Julcamarca and the other in Quinua, to sell her products such as vegetables and fruit. She purchases wheat/cereal products and leather material at the fairs to later sell in bulk in the city of Ayacucho. Aside from this, Rebeca also grows alfalfa in her land located in Totora which she later sells at the local supermarket in the city of Ayacucho.

Rebeca needs a loan to purchase rice, sugar and more fruit.

Rebeca's dreams are to one day buy a car so that her son can use to go to work, expand her business and to have financial stability.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

Primer Préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=29927&_tpos=5&_tpg=1

Rebeca es socia del Banco Comunal Alondras.

Rebeca es casada, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos, 3 de ellos estudian, Rebeca vive en el pequeño valle de totora que se ubica a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho, Rebeca viaja a dos ferias de la región de los distritos de Julcamarca y Quinua en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, y de las ferias compra cereales, cueros, cochinilla que vende a mayoristas en la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Rebeca se dedica a la agricultura de alfalfa en sus terrenos de Totora, los cuales son vendidos en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Rebeca necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, frutas.

Los sueños de Rebeca son comprar un carro para que trabaje su hijo, ampliar sus negocios y tener estabilidad.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar and fruit

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa is 33 years old and married. She works as a teacher and administrator of the Colegio San Pablo, a private center, with 5 years of service. She has 3 daughters: 15 , 8, and 2 years old, respectively. One of them is a Senior in high school and the 2 year old girl is taken care by someone she employs as a caretaker. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. daily. She is asking for her second loan which she will use to make an addition to the back of her home to be more comfortable and add space to her house. Presently, she is by herself since her husband is in the United States and sends her a monthly stipend to help out with the family's needs.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramreiz-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La profesora María Teresa es casada, de 33 años de edad, trabaja como administradora del Colegio San Pablo, centro privado, con 5 años de servicio, tiene 3 hijas de 15, 8 y 2 años, 1 estudia el 4to año de secundaria, la niña de 2 años no estudia la cuida una empleada; los turnos de trabajo son de 8:00am a 5:00 pm. Está solicitando su 2do crédito el que utilizará para la construcción de un anexo al fondo de su vivienda para dar mas comodidad y espacio a su casa, en estos momentos se encuentran sola, ya que su esposo está en EE.UU quien le envia remesa mensual para que pueda salir adelante con sus hijas.

loans.use: Construction of a small addition to the house to place a washer.

loans.name: Lucila Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucila is 41 years old, single, and a health care worker. She has an 18 years old son who lives with his father. He is a college student and although he lives with his father, she supports him with his expenses. She has 17 years of service and at the present time works for the Asuncion Hospital and for the San Ramon Clinic where she has daytime and evening shifts. She lives at her sister's house where she is going to make the improvement to the home (doors and windows, floor, ceiling, painting, etc.) At this time the room serves as a cellar. Mrs. Suarez is asking for her sixth loan, the other five that she has taken before had been paid on time and had served her to improve the home that she lives in with her sister little by little. Mrs. Suarez states that up to date she has constructed 2 rooms with all the furnishings and even if this loan doesn't allow her to make all the planned improvements, she will continue to apply for loans until her goal is fulfilled. Her sister works on making and selling tamales on Saturdays and Sundays and she contributes to the monthly payments. This is the reason that she will continue to pay for this loan as she did before.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Lucila es trabajadora del sector salud, soltera, de 41 años de edad, con 1 hijo de 18 años que vive con su padre, su hijo es estudiante universitario, pero aunque vive con el papá ella le da todos los gastos, tiene 17 años de servicio, actualmente labora para el Hospital Asunción y para la clínica San Ramón donde hace turnos diurnos y nocturnos, habita en casa de su hermana donde se realizará la mejora de vivienda ( puertas y ventanas, piso, cielo razo, pintura, etc.) en estos momentos el cuarto está de bodega. La Sra. S. está solicitando su crédito número seis, los cinco anteriores los ha pagado en tiempo y forma y le han servido para ir poco a poco mejorando la vivienda donde ella habita junto a su hermana. La señora S. manifiesta que hasta la fecha ha construido 2 cuartos con todas las condiciones y que si este crédito no le permite hacer todas las mejoras que tiene planificado, continuará haciendo créditos hasta cumplir con la meta que se ha planteado, su hermana trabaja haciendo nacatamales que los vende sabado y domingos y le ayuda un poco con el pago de las cuotas por esta razón continuará pagando en tiempo y forma este crédito al igual que los anteriores

loans.use: Furnish a room to live in.

loans.name: Bernardina Delia

texts.es:
Delia is a member of the communal bank called "Divine Love". She's 54 years old. She's married and a has 3 children. Delia runs a bakery out of her own home where she makes a local type of bread called 'Chapla' which is native to the area. She has a wood burning oven. She has hired some help to relieve her from running the bakery. She also has a small grocery store and phone booths where the locals can make long-distance phone calls. Her hours of operation are 5 in the morning to 10 at night.

Delia would like to purchase flour in bulk with this loan. Her dreams are to be able to continue to work and to provide a college education for her children.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

Primer Préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=15172&_tpos=8&_tpg=2

Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Amor Divino.

Delia es casada, tiene 54 años y 3 hijos, Delia tiene una panadería en su casa, en donde elabora el pan típico de la zona llamado “Chapla”, el horno es rustico de leña, para lo cual cuenta con la ayuda de operarios, sus ventas lo realiza en el mismo horno. Además Delia tiene una tienda de abarrotes y también tiene locutorios telefónicos, el horario de atención son de 5 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.

Delia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de sacos de harina. Los sueños de Delia son seguir trabajando para salir adelante, sus hijos sigan estudiando hasta ser profesionales.

loans.use: To purchase flour in bulk

loans.name: Francisca Susana

texts.es:
Mrs. Francisca Susana is 48 years old and single. She had 4 children: 2 girls and 2 boys, 3 of them are married but live with her and she is also in charge of the youngest son who is 16 years old. He is the one in charge of contracting the meat and search for the person that will slaughter the pig. It has a cost of C$100(Nicaraguan currency). Francisca Susana has worked as a janitor at the "Josefa Toledo de Aguerri" National Institute of Chontales for 5 years beginning her labor at 6:00 a.m. and finishing at 3:00 p.m. She has to wake up every day at 4:00 a.m. to fulfill her other responsibility. She works on the pig processing business on Saturdays starting the activity a 3:00 a.m. to deliver the meat starting at 6 a.m. She has been developing this business for 3 years which allows her to have a small income of C$200 (Nicaraguan currency) to cover the family's needs and it also provides some leftover product that the family consumes. The earnings are better when she processes 2 pigs but she generally processes one due to lack of cash. She is asking for her third loan because she wants to expand the market and have better earnings. The loans that she had before have been paid in a responsible manner since she is an honest person.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Francisca Susana, sotera, 48 años de edad, tubo 4 hijos, 2 mujeres, 2 varones, 3 de ellos casados pero conviven con ella, está a su cargo su hijo menor de 16 años, quien es el encargado de contratar la carne y buscar la persona que sacrifica al cerdo, tiene un costo de C$100.Francisca Susana trabaja como conserje en el Instituto Nacional de Chontales "Josefa Toledo de Aguerri" desde hace 5 años iniciando labores a las 6:00 am finalizando a las 3:00 pm teniendo que levantarse todos los días a las 4:00 am para luego cumplir con su otra responsabilidad.Los días que dedica para el destace son los sábados iniciando la actividad a las 3:00 am para entregar la carne a partir de las 6:00 am, tiene 3 años de estar desarrollando este trabajo lo que le permite tener un pequeño ingreso de C$200 para completar los costos familiares, pero además le queda del producto para que la familia coma. La ganancia es mejor cuando mata 2 cerdos, pero generalmente es uno por falta de efectivo.Está solicitando su tercer crédito porque quiere ampliar el mercado y obtener mejores ganancias. Sus créditos anteriores los pagó con responsabilidad, ya que es una persona que se caracteriza por su honestidad y honradez.

loans.use: Investment on the pig processing business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina has a business making children's toys. She has three children who help her with her work. Their only source of income comes from selling the toys form a small stand they keep in the central market of La Paz. They rent a small home which also serves as the shop for assembling the toys. Justina works very hard to take care of her family and improve their quality of life.

La Sra. Justina trabaja en la fabricacion D. juguetes D. peluches, tiene tres hijos los cuales le ayudan con la costura, el unico ingreso que tiene es por la venta D. estos juguetes, que los venD. en un puesto que tiene en una galeria en la zona central D. La Paz la cual atienD. su hija. Vive en alquiler en uno pequeños cuartos los que utiliza tambien como taller, es una señora muy trabajadora que mantiene sus hijos con su trabajo. se encuentar trabajando en brasil para dar mejores condiciones D. vida a esta.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE A SEWING MACHINE TO HELP MAKE THE TOYS SHE SELLS.  THE INCOME FROM THESE SALES PROVIDE THE ONLY SOURCE OF INCOME FOR HER FAMILY.

loans.name: Fabian Pedro

texts.es:
Fabian Pedro T. is 59 years old and from the village of Xolsacmaljá in the municipality and city of Totonicapán. He came to the offices of ASDIR to obtain financing to purchase construction tools, specifically for providing his services in masonry and home construction, a trade that her inherited from his father who did the same work for many years. Initially, he built adobe homes, tile or laminate zinc roofs, and cement floors. Currently, he builds block homes with flat roofs and ceramic floors. With financing, he will improve his job and use it to purchase a floor polisher.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

El Señor Fabian Pedro T. de 59 años del cantón Xolsacmaljá municipio y departamento de Totonicapán. Acudió a las oficinas de ASDIR para poder obtener un financiamiento para la compra de herramientas para construccion , específicamente se dedica a la prestación de sus servicios como albañil, construcción de casa, el cual es un oficio que heredó de su padre quien laboró en la misma hace ya varios años. En un principio se dedicaba a construir casas de adobe, techo de teja o lamina de zinc, piso con torta de cemento, en la actualidad se dedica a construir casas de block, techo de terraza y piso cerámico, con el financiamiento pretende mejorar su trabajo ya que lo utilizará para la compra de una pulidora de pisos

loans.use: To purchase tools for construction.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio P. Tebalán is 29 years old and from the village of Chirrenox in the municipality of San Francisco in the department of Totonicapan. His family makes canvas trousers, and he works in his father's workshop. He came to the offices of ASDIR so that we could provide a loan for him to launch his own studio. With his acquired knowledge and the help of his wife and family, he will be able to launch such as business.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Antonio P. Tebalán de 29 años de la aldea Chirrenox municipio de San Francisco el Alto departamento de Totonicapán. La familia de dicha persona se dedica a la confección de pantalones de lona, él trabaja como operario en el taller de su padre, acude a las oficinas de ASDIR para que podamos brindarle un crédito para emprender su taller, con el conocimiento adquirido y con la ayuda de su esposa y familia podrán emprender tal negocio.

loans.use: To start his own tailoring studio.

loans.name: Mujeres Group

texts.en:
The trust banks Mujeres Nahuala is made up by a group of women who come from three different remote villages around Nahualá called Patzig, Palenqeuch and Rakantela.

Although these groups of women are used to live in their villages and like their lifestyles a lot, they have to leave their towns in order to earn some money. These towns are very poor and commercial activity is very scarce. There are very few shops out there, maybe one or two convenience store per town. Running water is a novelty and men often leave the towns to work in far away cities, even the United States. Most of the "Mujeres Nahuala" travel 3 days a week for 4 hours as far as the coast and Totonícapan to sell their products in the main markets over there.

The number three is a perpetual factor with this group. This is because the women have to travel 3 days a week, they come from 3 different town, and the ladies work in 3 different economic activities. One group of 3 women are buying and selling skirts and huipilles (traditional blouses), 3 of them are buying and selling other typical clothes, and the last 3 including the president, make and embroider skirts and pañuelos. The pañuelos are the pieces fabric women use to carry their babies, their goods from the markets, and during a chilly day they will wrap the panuelos around them to stay a bit warmer.

The president of the group who herself sows and embroiders skirts and huipilles was the one who formed the group. She was inspired by the success of other people who asked for loans before, so she wanted request one too so she can in her own business and improved her life this way. So, she went to recruit all of the members one by one. The group members went to the office and attended the pre-credit orientation session and after a couple of months later the group was formed.

For all of them this will be their first credit, and they are all very excited to get this opportunity to invest in their businesses and through that; in their lives and the lives of their family members.

loans.use: To invest in a more diverse stock

loans.name: Las Rosas Semetabaj Group

texts.en:
The villagers from San Andres Semetabaj breathe the peaceful environment of this small lovely town. Most of the villagers know each other very well which creates an environment of trust. Walking down the clean streets of San Andres one can see many people chatting and children playing. This is a typical village where people help each other out with their daily tasks. 
Fortunately, this cultural factor is also reflected in Las Rosas´ organization. Some members of the group are better doing the paperwork and arrange the meetings, whereas others have more acquaintances that can help the younger ones of the group to sell their products to a bigger group of customers.
This is how Doña Manuela C., who is one of oldest of the group, helps the younger members. She has a store in one of the main streets at which she sells traditional blouses. Doña Manuela is very well known in the village because of her store. When a customer asks her about clothes she doesn't sell in her store, she refers them to group members like Ami. Ami is one of the younger members of the group. She also sells blouses, but from a different type, they are called croshet blouses, they have a very different look from the traditional ones.
Alma G. is the president of the group. She has a sister in another group who enthusiastically told her about Friendship Bridge. Alma, formed a group with her friends and neighbours who, like her, mostly work in buying and selling clothes. 
They all want to invest their credit in purchasing a more diverse repertoire of clothes. The other four women, who own a food store, also want to expand the diversity of products in order to capture more clients and increase their sales. 
Las Rosas want to keep working hard in order to keep building their new improved life. They wish to have a solid business so they don't have to leave their families behind in order to go and sell their goods at far away markets. That's why they try to communicate well to one another about their business ideas so they are not over-supply San Andres with the same goods, says Catalina. 
 Las Rosas are doing a great job a working together and accomplishing unity within their trust bank, with your support they will keep working in this manner and accomplishing their dreams. Thanks!

loans.use: Invest in the store itself and a bigger range of products

loans.name: Houng

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị Hương 29 tuổi, tham gia Quỹ năm 2006 bản thân chị hiện đang là giáo viên mần non thu nhập hàng tháng tương đối ổn định, Chồng chị làm nghề đông y chuyên cắt thuốc bắc. Khi tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị đã đầu tư vốn vào mua các sản phẩn cây, lá chế làm thuốc. Nối nghiệp ông và bố chồng chị  đi học nghề Y ra trường và chữa bệnh được 3 năm nay. Lúc nào anh cũng là người nhiệt tình, chu đáo với bệnh nhân, nên anh được nhân dân tin tưởng và yên tâm khi được anh điều trị. Ngoài nhưng công việc chính ra vợ chồng anh chị vẫn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi cho tăng thu nhập gia đình. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ.
Thu nhâp bình quân. 6.000.000đ/ tháng
texts.en:
Ms. L. Thi Houng is 29 yrs old. She joined TYM fund in 2006. She is a school teacher and her monthly income is fairly stabL.. Her husband practices Oriental medicine & prescribes Chinese herbs. When she joined the fund, she borrowed money to buy those plants for which the leaves can be used for the Chinese herbs. Her husband and his father studied medicine and had been practicing medicine for 3 years now. He is always enthusiastic and thoughtful with his patients, and thus peopL. trust him and feel assured when he treats them. In addition to their main jobs, she and her husband also raise animals to supplement their income. For this loan, her family wishes to borrow 550.00 USD. Their average monthly income is 365.00 USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thi N. 38 tuổi tham gia Quỹ năm 2004. Trải qua 4 năm vay vốn kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển rõ rệt, gia đình chị đã vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và vịt đẻ. Hiện tai gia đình chị đang nuôi 8 con lợn thịt và 200 con vịt đẻ, với 200 con vịt đẻ thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị hàng ngày là 200.000đ, năm 2007 gia đình chị đã mua được 1 chiếc máy cày phục vụ nộng nghiệp của gia đình và cày thuê bà còn trong vùng khi vào vụ thu nhập bình quân từ mày cày mỗi vụ đuợc 15.000.000đ. Chồng chị còn có nghề thợ xây những lúc nhàn dỗi anh chanh thủ đi làm bình quân mỗi ngày 70.000đ. Với thu nhập đều đặn như vậy gia đình chị đã xây được ngôi nhà khang trang. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000 đầu tư vào chăn nuôi vịt đẻ.
Thu nhập bình quân 6.000.000đ/ tháng
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thi N. is 38 years old and joined the Fund in 2004. Over the 4 years of membership, her family has seen a visible improvement in its economy, by investing in pig and duck farming. Currently, her family is raising 8 pigs and 200 ducks. With 200 ducks, the average income of her family is 200.000đ. In 2007, the family was able to buy 1 ploughing machine for its own use and to provide ploughing services to other people in the region. The average income every season is 15.000.000đ. Her husband still has a job of construction worker. In idle times, he can expect to earn a daily average of 70.000đ. With such a regular income, the family was already able to build a spacious house. For this round, the family would like to borrow 9.000.000 to invest further into duck farming. The average income is 6.000.000đ per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi:
Tham gia vào Quỹ năm 2003, chị Hoàng Thị Lãn 40 tuổi đã bước sang năm thứ 6  vay vốn. Nghề nghiệp chính của gia đình chị là làm ruộng và nghề phụ là làm chiếu. Những năm trước khi trưa tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị còn thiếu vốn nên không phát huy được nghề phụ. Được vay vốn chính là cơ hội để gia đình chị phát triển kinh tế, Vòng vốn đầu tiên gia đình chị vay đầu tư vốn vào chăn nuôi lợn. Từ những dư án chăn nuôi nhỏ lẻ gia đình chị dần dần phát triển mô hình chăn nuôi lớn hơn. Sau nhiều năm vay vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi có hiệu quả, gia đình chị đã có số tiền tiết kiệm kha khá chị đã quyết định đầu tư vốn vào nghề phụ sẵn có của gia đình, mua máy móc và các sản phẩm làm chiếu. Hiện tại công việc của gia đình chị rất phát triển. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư chăn nuôi lợn.
Thu nhập bình quân. 6.000.000đ
texts.en:
A member of the Fund since 2003, Mrs. Hoàng Thị Lãn is 40 years old and starting her sixth borrowing year. The main source of income of the family is farming, with mat making as side activity. Prior to joining the Fund, her family did not have enough capital to avoid this side activity. The loans provided an opportunity for her family to develop its economy. The family invested the first loan into pig farming, and the activity has expanded. After several years, the investments are producing results. The family manages to generate profit that Mrs. Lãn would like to invest into the family's side activity, by buying a machine and running a mat making business. Currently, the activity of her family is developing well. For this round, her family would like to borrow 9.000.000đ to invest further in pig farming. Its income is 6.000.000đ on average

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Yokub

texts.en:
Yokub K., 45 years old, is married with two children, a 22-year-old son and a married 20-year-old daughter. A hardworking man who started his business in 1998 with $100, his activities include repairing and embroidering shoes. Through his enterprise he was able to pay for the schooling of his children, and is now supporting his son’s university education. His services are helping many families in his community.  

With many clients and much demand for his services, Yokub’s business is very successful and earns a stable and significant income. However, his working capital is not sufficient to meet current demand, so he is requesting a loan of $1000 for a term of twelve months. Yokub is planning to purchase materials such as leather, soles, heels, and glue for repairing and embroidering shoes. His dream is to make this business his life-long career.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as leather, soles, heels, and glue for the repair and embroidery of shoes

loans.name: Kutfikhon

texts.en:
Kutfikhon R., 41 years old, is married and the loving mother of two children. Unfortunately, the difficult economic conditions of the country forced her husband to leave Russia in order to search for work. Kutfikhon has been a seamstress since she was very young, learning in her mother's office, and with a great deal of effort has been able to open a shop in her home, establishing a thriving business because her customers recognize the high quality of her products. 
 
Today Kutfikhon is applying for a loan of $900 for the term of 12 months to purchase  new fabrics for sewing the national dresses. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Kutfikhon and her children are grateful for your generosity and support.

loans.use: To purchase new fabrics for sewing the national dresses.

loans.name: Phanit

texts.en:
Mrs. C. Phanit, 22, is a farmer living in Svay Ath Commune, Pursat Province. She also raises pigs to sell. Her husband works in a small private enterprise and earns income monthly. They have two children, both of whom are living in the family’s home.

Her pig-raising business has been going well, and she wants to purchase more piglets to raise. She will use the remainder of the loan to purchase pig food and fertilizer for her rice crop. She doesn’t have enough capital, so Phanit decided to request a loan to achieve her goals.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, pig food, and fertilizer

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en:
This is Abdullah W.. He is 20 and a resident of the Sorkhrood district in Ningarhar province. Abdullah and his family have been living in their village since the Taliban regime in Afghanistan. Before that they lived in Pakistan. Abdullah has two brothers and a sister and they all live with their parents. His father is about 55, and he lost his left arm in a mine explosion during the war in Afghanistan.

When Abdullah's family returned to their homeland, Abdullah was 14 and his brothers were about 12 and 10. His father has faced some serious illnesses, so Abdullah had to accept all responsibility for being the only breadwinner for his family.

Abdullah was studying in class 7, but he had to leave school and start working. So he opened a small catering shop (tent service) in the Sorkhrood bazaar. First he made some shelves, and then purchased different equipment like plates, spoons, carpets, and other goods for his shop with capital he had of 45,000 Afghanis.

Abdullah is a hard-working man. He was able to enroll his elder brothers in a private educational course in addition to their schooling. Meanwhile, he is attempting to resume his education. But he thinks that first he must expand his business and buy enough materials for his shop, and through it increase his daily income from $8 to $12.

This young man seems have good capability, and he tries to utilize it in his business. He has requested a 50,000 Afghanis loan from AFSG. He decided to purchase some generators, chairs and tables with this money and after a few months he will open a new shop near the old one.

Abdullah dreams about starting in his new shop, and then sesuming his remaining education. He wants to express his appreciation in advance to his lenders, and wishes them good luck.

loans.use: To buy generators, chairs and tables to rent

loans.name: Joyce's Ekenywa Group

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old. She is married, and has 6 children between the ages of 5 and 17. She has owned her own livestock business since 1994. Every day, she begins work at 7AM and finishes at around 6PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $50.

In the past, Joyce has successfully completed one loan from BRAC Tanzania. She used her first loan to expand her business. Joyce is now requesting a loan in order to improve her current stock. She will also share her loan with her current subgroup members, who sell various foods such as maize and produce.

loans.use: To expand her business by increases the  number of livestock.

loans.name: Aman Allah

texts.en:
Aman Allah is responsible for a household of 9 members. He is 52 years old and married. Aman allah lost one of his brother during an explosion in Kabul 5 years ago and he also supports his brother's family. He is an audiovisual engineer for electronic equipment like videos, televisions, radios, and keyboards, and he has good experience and a good number of customers.

Aman Allah needs some money to rent a big shop so he has requested an individual loan of 30,000 Afghanis to further his business and complete his stock so that he can make a good income to help both families and make a better future for them.

He is happy that with this loan he can enlarge his shop. He loves his business and wants to see it grow. He would like to thank both Kiva and AFSG.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Esther's Livestock Store Group

texts.en:
Esther is 40 years old. She is married, and has 8 children between the ages of 9 and 24. She has owned a small livestock shop since 1983. She begins work every day from 6AM and ends at 10PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of $40.

Esther is now requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits for resale. She will also share this loan with her subgroup members Zulfa and Rehema.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits for resale

loans.name: Mariam's Harakati Group

texts.en:
Mariam is 45 years old, married, and has 6 children between the ages of 9 and 22. She has owned her own fruits store since 2002. Every day, she begins work at 8AM and finishes at 7PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $40.

In the past, Mariam has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mariam now hopes for a loan to buy more fruits for resale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Salma, Rahel and Veronica, who have businesses dealing with food sales.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for her business.

loans.name: Mary's Ushirika Group

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old, married, and has 3 children between the ages of 7 and 12. She owns her own clothing store. Every day, she begins work at 8AM and finishes at 6PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $225.

Mary is now requesting a loan in order to expand her current stock. She will also share her loan with her current subgroup members, who have various businesses such as tailoring and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Joyce's Sayuni Group

texts.en:
Joyce is 30 years old. She is married and has 2 children, ages 8 and 12. She has owned her own grocery store since 2001. Every day, she begins work at 6AM and finishes at around 10PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $350.

Joyce is now requesting a loan in order to expand her current stock. She will also share her loan with her current subgroup members, who have various businesses such as tailoring and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to increase her inventory

loans.name: Rose's Sayuni Group

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and married with 2 children, aged 10 and 8. She has been a tailor since 1995. Every day, she works from 10am to 6.30pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Rose now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with tailoring and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business.

loans.name: Lucy's Food Store Group

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has 3 children, ages 2, 7 and 12. She has owned her own food store since 2007. Every day, she begins work at 6AM and finishes at 7PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $40.

Joyce is now requesting a loan in order to buy more items, such as maize and flour. She will also share her loan with her current subgroup members, who have various businesses such as clothing stores and salons.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Lay Kunthea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank which is located in Ta Reab Doun Sar Village in the Kandal Province consists of fifteen members. Mrs. Lay K., 30, is the village bank president who has been selected by the members in the village bank. She sells different kinds of vegetable in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Hem V., is a farmer who cultivates rice and vegetable. Aside from this business, he is soldier who has been retired and he can get a small salary to support his family. The couple has four children, three of whom are attending school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Since her business is going well, Mrs. Lay K. wants to expand and is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables for resale. (Mrs.Tat S. is not shown in the picture but her husband is because he came to take a loan instead of her while Mrs.Tat S. is very busy with her work.)

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables for resale at the local market.

loans.name: Mr. San Sarin Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mr. San Sarim, 39, is the father of three children and a motorbike taxi driver. He is also the village bank President in Yok Bath Village in the Kandal Province. This village bank is made up of nine members. His wife, Mrs. Mork Koemseng, is a fish seller in the local market. One child is enrolled in school and the other two are too young to attend and stay at home.

Mr. San Sarim cannot operate his business because his motorbike needs to be repaired. He is requesting a loan to fix his motorbike in order to start his business activity again.

loans.use: To fix a motorbike in order to continue being a motortaxi driver

loans.name: Pan

texts.en:
Mr. B. Pan is a 43-year-old fisherman who lives in Chyroe2 Commune, Kampong Cham Province. He fishes in Trohs Lake near his village, and his wife sells fish in the market. He lives with his wife and three children, one of whom is working as waitress in a restaurant. Mr. Pan and his wife are pictured.

To add income to support her family, Pan’s wife is opening a small tailoring business. She faces the obstacle of lacking money to purchase a sewing machine and cloth to sew. Pan decide to request a loan for his wife’s business, and he plans to use the remainder of the loan to purchase fishing tools such as a net and resin for caulking his boat.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and cloth

loans.name: Raya

texts.en:
Raya is 32 years old, married, and has 3 children ages 2, 11 and 14. She owns her own charcoal and clothing business. Every day, she works from 5AM to 4PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $25 from her sales.

In the past, Raya has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Raya is now requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal and clothing to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Semeni

texts.en:
Semeni is 40 years old, married, and has 7 children, between the ages of 2 and 20. She has owned her own fruits and spices business since 2006. Every day, she works from 6AM to 4PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $20 from her sales.

In the past, Semeni has successfully completed one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Semeni is now requesting a loan to purchase more fruits to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy  more fruits for her business.

loans.name: Mrs. Neth Yoeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Village Bank located in Sdao Kanlaeng Village in the Kandal Province consists of fourteen members.Mrs. Neth Y. is the Village Bank President. She was born in 1946 and is a widow with three children and sells grocery products. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, another is selling groceries in Phnom Penh, a Cambodian city, and the youngest child who is 23-years-old, assists Mrs. Neth Y. with her business.

Becuase her business is going well, Mrs. Neth Y. wants to expand her inventory and is requesting a loan to buy dry fish to meet her customers demands. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy dry fish to increase inventory and meet customers demands

loans.name: Kasiza's Tailoring & Soaps Group

texts.en:
Kazisa is 43 years old. She is married and has 5 children, between ages 7 and 19. She has owned her own soap and tailoring store since 2005. Every day, she begins work at 6AM and finishes at 6PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $40.

In the past, Kazisa has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania. She used her previous loans to expand her business. Joyce is now requesting a loan in order to purchase more tailoring materials and soaps. She will also share her loan with her current subgroup member, Waohra, who sells various foods.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items and soap for her business

loans.name: Sarah Nabukenya's Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is 38 years old and married with 2 children. They are ages 15 and 10. Both of them are in school. The community she resides in and works in is semi-urban with a neighboring slum.

She makes local brew out of sugar and wheat flour, which she sells retail and wholesale. Her clients are the village members and residents of the nearby slum.

Her main challenges are the unstable prices, high rental fees, and limited capital.

She has been able to increase her stock and to contribute to her family's welfare.

She would like to increase her stock, to start selling beer and soft drinks, to buy a plot of land, and to build herself a house. Sarah has successfully paid back more than 3 loans.

loans.use: To start selling beer and soda

loans.name: Mtumwa's Clothing Shop Group

texts.en:
Mtumwa is 22 years old, married, and has two children ages 1 and 3. She opened her own clothes selling business in 2008. Every day, she works from 10AM to 6PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $20 from her sales.

In the past, Mtumwa has successfully completed one loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mtumwa is now requesting a loan to purchase more clothes to expand her business. She will also share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling domestic utensils, snacks, and clothing.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase one cow and cow feed

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is 22 years old. She is the single mother of two children, ages 2 and 4. She currently sells snacks and small food items to her community. Every day, she begins work at 8AM and ends at 5PM. On average, her business can earn a monthly profit of around $20.

In the past, Amina has successfully completed one loan from BRAC Tanzania. Amina used her first loan to expand her business, and is now requesting a second loan in order to expand her stock and customer base.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Grace Adong's Group

texts.en:
Grace is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 41-year-old widow with no children. All her children died. She rents a 1-room house and lives with 4 people. There is neither electricity nor water. She takes care of 2 orphans and is self-reliant. The family gets 3 meals a day.

She buys raw materials for making alcohol from Owino Market, one of the big markets in Kampala, and uses public transport to get back to her business. She resides and works in a semi-urban and slum area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Grace works 7 days a week and also rents her business premises. She gets an average of 9 customers per day and sells to all categories of people. She has been running this business for the last 6 years and has been with MCDT and the same group members for 6 years. This is her 12th loan.

Grace's major challenge is the rainy season, as her customers are inconvenienced and at times stop going to her for a drink. This is so because her place of business is covered with mud and water during the rains. Thieves also break into her business and go away with her brew. She is boastful of the improved standards of living and her business progress. Grace is aspiring to buy land, construct a commercial house, and earn some money from tenants.

loans.use: To expand her business for more profits

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 31 years old, married, and has four children ages 2, 6, 8 and 12. In addition, she also cares for another 18 year old child. She owns her own charcoal and firewood business. Every day, she works from 6AM to 10PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $35 from her sales.

In the past, Pili has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Pili is now requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal and firewood to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Salma's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Salma is 35 years old, married, and has 1 child, age 2. She has owned her own clothing business since 2006. Every day, she works from 10AM to 8PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $65 from her sales.

In the past, Salma has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Salma is now requesting a loan to purchase more clothing items to expand her business. She will also share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling clothing, cosmetics goods, and firewood.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 49 years old, married, and has two children ages 20 and 30. She opened her own food selling business in 2004. Every day, she works from 6AM to 2PM. On average, she can earn a monthly profit of around $35 from her sales.

In the past, Maryam has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Maryam is now requesting a loan to purchase more items, such as flour, beans, and firewood to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Mohammad Halam

texts.en:
Mohammad Halam is responsible for his father and mother as well as his own family. He is married. He is busy in agriculture. He learned this business from his father, but now his father is unable to work in agriculture. Mohammad Halam works hard at growing his crops and he has plenty of land for cultivation but he is unable to make use of it all.

So Halam wants to take out an individual loan of 50000 Afghani with a term of 12 months to complete his stock and buy more seeds to plant all his land and get ready for next year's cultivation. This is the season to prepare their lands for cultivation next year. He wants to make a better life for his family in the future.

So Halam is very happy that with this loan he can further his business and help his family in the future. His father and all his family want to thank those that help people through making Kiva loans.

loans.use: To be able to cultivate all his land

loans.name: Mchanga's Jitahidini Group

texts.en:
Mchanga is 30 years and married with 3 children aged 2, 4 and 3. She also takes care of 2 other children aged 6 and 8 years old. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

In the past, Mchanga has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mchanga now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for resale and to start a new business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses dealing with bicycle spare sales, snacks sales, juice sales, charcoal and firewood sales.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale and to start new business.

loans.name: Edith Namirembe's Group

texts.en:
Edith is a leader of 4 members of a group. She is a 33-year-old married woman with 5 children. They are aged between 3 and 17 years. Four are in school.

She rents a 2-room house in which she lives with 6 people. There is piped water and electricity. She resides and works in a semi-urban and slum area, which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Edith works 7 days a week and has a retail shop. She buys her merchandise from Kampala twice a week and uses public transport. Her customers are the people of her community and those passing through.

Edith's challenges include paying high taxes, high rental charges, and high transport costs. Flooding during the rainy season is yet another challenge, as the area where she is operating is prone to floods, and this destroys her merchandise. She has been operating this business for the last 5 years and was inspired by the other shopkeepers around, and she has been able to pay school fees for her children and also improve her standard of living.

Her main inspiration is owning a permanent house/home so that she can stop paying rent. She would also want to see her business progress.

loans.use: To increase stock

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra baji, the wife of A. M., lives in the small city of Chichawatni, Pakistan where she is the mother of five children: four sons and one daughter, all enrolled in a local school. This housewife successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan) whereby she purchased an auto-rickshaw for her husband; her brother-in-law is now operating the rickshaw while her husband works as a security guard. Bushra baji is requesting a loan to start a new fruit-selling business, which her husband will operate.

She is joined in this group loan by four other members: Sakina baji requests a loan to buy goats and sheep to resell; Hanifan baji and Kalsoom baji each request a loan to buy a donkey cart; Bashiran baji requests a loan to buy some groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy fruits

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Mrs. O. Chanthy, 41, sells Cambodian noodles (Nom Banhchok). It is a popular food in her town market. She makes noodles and mixes them with ingredients such as vegetables. She always gets up early in the morning to take her noodles to sell in the market. She lives with her husband and four children. All of her children are young and attend school. Her husband, Mr. Svay Sokhom, is a soldier.

Because of the family’s increasing expenses, Chanthy needs to expand her business to increase her income. She wants a motorcycle taxi for her husband to drive. She would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle. She will use the remainder of the loan to purchase more rice to make noodles. Chanthy's husband is pictured with the noodle-making mill because Chanthy was not available.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle and more rice to make noodles

loans.name: Niaz Mohammad

texts.en:
Niaz Mohammad is married and lives with his own family. He is uneducated but he is a carpenter and he has good experience in his business. He has been involved in this business for more than 10 years and is supporting his family with this income. However, this is the second year that his business has not grown because of economic problems.

Therefore he requested an individual loan to complete his stock and attract his clients back so that he can stand on his own feet and conduct his business very well.

He is happy with all members of his family, especially his wife who found AFSG and told her husband about this process. Now he is very happy with this loan process in this poor country and he would like to thank lenders.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Shumbana's Hatutaki Ukorofi Group

texts.en:
Shumbana is 22 years old. She is married with one child aged 1 year old. She has been a charcoal, firewood, and cooking oil seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Shumbana has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Shumbana now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal, firewood, and cooking oil for re-sale. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal sales, shop ownership, children's clothing sales, firewood sales, and bites sales.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Mary Busingye's Group

texts.en:
Mary B. is the leader of a group of 5 women. She is 45 and married with 3 children, who are 20, 12, and 10 years old. All of her children are in school. Mary lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Mary has been a midwife in the Kiwunya Zone for the past 22 years. The market for her business is good; however, she faces the challenges of high taxes, women who don't pay, and high transportation fees.

Mary plans to use this loan to purchase medicine for her patients. Since she began working with MCDT, Mary has been able to expand her business to include a laboratory. In addition, she has been able to use her profits to educate her children.

Mary hopes to one day be able to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase medicine

loans.name: Marn

texts.en:
Mr. Marn S. I, 25, and his wife, Mrs.Loa Soknear, 25, live in Preak Daung Village in Kandal Province. He is a construction worker and she is a vegetable farmer. They do not have any children.

Her field is located away from a water source, but with pump she would be able to irrigate her vegetable plants. Mr. Marn S. I is requesting a loan to buy a pump to achieve his wife goals. The rest of the money would be used to buy vegetable seeds. This is the second time Mr. Marn S. I has used a loan to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a pump for irrigating crops and purchase vegetable seeds

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru:
Safargul R. lives in Vakhsh with her family. She is married and has three children. She works as a high school teacher. Additionally, she has a shop near her home where she sells clothes and fabrics. She has been doing this business for 3 years. Besides her salary as a teacher, this is the chief source of income for their large family. Still, she is not discouraged. Safargul is a very cheerful and active woman.

Translated from Russian by Melissa, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахимова Сафаргуль живет в Вахшском районе со своей семьей . Она замужем , имеет троих детей. Работает учителем в средней школе. Кроме того имеет магази рядом с домом , где торгует одеждой и тканями. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 3 года. Кроме школы бизнес является основным источником дохода их не маленькой семьи. Но она не унывает . Сафаргуль очень жизнерадостная и активная женщина.

loans.use: To deliver goods

loans.name: Turabek

texts.ru:
Turabek A. lives in the Vakhsh region of Tajikistan. Turabek is married with 7 children. Although he is a hairdresser by training, he has been working in animal husbandry for the past ten years. He raises and sells livestock. Turabek would like to obtain a loan for buying sheep and goats. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Азимов Турабек проживает в Вахшском районе. Занимается торговлей крупно-рогатого скота, а так же их разведением. Женат и имеет семерых детей. По образованию парикмахер. Но уже 10 лет занимается животноводством. Теперь он хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить овец и коз. Это увеличит поголовье скота. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Mr. Nou B., 39, is a broom maker in Srae Ampil Village in Kandal Province. His wife, Mrs. Chum Pan, assists her husband in the business so that they can improve their living conditions together. The couple has five children; one is employed in a garment factory, three are attending school and the fifth child, age four, is too young to attend school and stays at home.

Mr. Nou B.'s business is going well but he would like to sell his product door-to-door. He is requesting a loan to purchase more raw materials to make more brooms and increase his inventory. His wife is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for brooms and allow enough inventory to sell door-to-door.

loans.name: Zikrullo

texts.ru:
Zikrullo Nazarov lives in the Vakhsh region of Tajikistan. He is 21 years old and single. He works as a barman at the Hatlon restaurant of the Vakhsh region. He has been renting this bar for two years. The sales of refreshments and ice-cream are profitable but towards the fall Zikrullo would like to increase the assortment and sell food. This would help him develop his business. He would like to obtain a loan for 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Назаров Зикрулло проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст 21 год. Холост. Работает барменом в ресторане «Хатлон» Вахшского района. Арендует бар уже 2 года. Бизнес приносит прибыль. Реализация прохладительных напитков и мороженного прибыльное дело , но ближе к осени он планирует увеличить ассортимент напитков и кроме того завезти продукты питания. Это поможет ему развивать свой бизнес. Для этого он хочет получить кредит, сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Hadia

texts.en:
Hadia is 39 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 15, 13, 11 and 7. She has been a food (rice & fish) seller since 2004. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Hadia has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Hadia now hopes for a loan to buy more rice and fish for her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying more rice and fish

loans.name: Mtumwa

texts.en:
Mtumwa is 26 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 10, 8, and 5 years old, and one is only 3 months old. She has been a clothes seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 10am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Mtumwa has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Mtumwa now hopes for a loan to buy more items (bedsheets) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets for re-sale

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru:
Ibrohim T. lives in the Huroson region. He is 44 years old and is married with 4 children. He has a university degree and works as a culturologist at the House of Culture of the Huroson region. In addition, for the past two years he has been running a livestock business. Ibrohim would like to obtain a loan for purchasing mixed fodder. He would be able to pay off the loan within12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Турдиев Иброхим проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 44 года, женат и имеет 4 детей. Имеет высшее образование и работает культурологом в доме культуры Хуросонского района. Кроме того имеет бизнес по купле-продаже крупного рогатого скота. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 2 года. Хочет получить кредит для закупки комбикорма. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase mixed fodder

loans.name: Sorng

texts.en:
Mr. S. Sorng and Mrs. Chhem May are farmers who live in Trean Commune, Kampong Cham Province. They are married and have two young children. Sorng is the head of the family so he has to work hard every day to support his family’s expenses. He has many jobs to generate income such as fishing and growing a rice crop.

For his rice crop, he faces the obstacle of renting expensive equipment to plow his farmland. He and his wife decided to request a loan to purchase two oxen to plow his farmland. Sorng is requesting a loan of $300.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen to plow his farmland

loans.name: Gulnisso

texts.ru:
Gulnisso B. lives in the Gissar region of Tajikistan. She travels to Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan to buy clothes and shoes that she then sells at her vending spot at the market. She has been involved in this business for nine years and would like to obtain a loan to buy more goods for sale. Gulnisso is 29 years old. She is married but her husband is unemployed. Therefore Gulnisso works hard to provide for her children. She plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Болтаева Гульниссо проживает в районе Гиссар. Занимается торговлей одежды и обуви. Привозит товар из Бишкека. Торгует на своей торговой точке в центре района на рынке. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 9 лет. Хочет получить кредит и использовать для того, чтобы завезти товар. Гульниссо 29 лет, она замужем, но муж нигде не работает, поэтому она много работает, чтобы обеспечить своих двоих детей. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase goods for sale

loans.name: Salma's Tushirikiane Group

texts.en:
Salma is 25 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 6 months. She became a bites seller in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Salma has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Salma now hopes for a loan to expand her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with bites sales, charcoal and firewood sales, and clothing sales.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mirzomurod

texts.ru:
Mirzomurod H. lives in the Gissar region of Tajikistan and is married with two children. He has a small shop where he sells refreshments. Mirzomurod would like to obtain a credit for renovating his shop. A cozier shop would attract new customers and make his business more stable. He plans to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Холов Мирзомурод житель Гиссарского района. Женат, имеет двоих детей. Имеет небольшой магазин, где торгует напитками. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы сделать небольшой ремонт в помещении. Это поможет создать уют в магазине и привлечь новых клиентов. Таким образом он создаст для себя обеспеченный бизнес . Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to renovate the shop

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 21 years old. She is married with 2 children. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2007. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Asha has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Anora

texts.ru:
Anora A. lives in the Gissar region of Tajikistan. She is 22 years old and single. She is involved in trade. She works at a wholesale city market where she sells rice and vegetable oil. She has been working there for three years. She lives with elderly parents and therefore tries to provide for the family on her own. Anora is asking for a loan in order to purchase more goods for sale. She would be able to pay off the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva volunteer.

Астанакулова Анора проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 22 года, не замужем. Занимается торговлей. Работает на оптовом рынке района , где продает оптом рис и растительное масло. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 3 года. Она живет с родителями, которые находятся в преклонном возрасте. Поэтому она старается сама обеспечивать семью. Просит кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to purchase goods for sale

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru:
Robiya S., 41, lives with her two children in the Gissar District. She is divorced and bears all responsibility for raising the children, so she must work very hard to support them. Robiya owns a bakery where she makes a range of pastries, and she also sells various sweets for children from a table next to her building. She plans to use a loan to buy an oven. The loan will be repaid over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Шарипова Робия жительница Гиссарского района. Живет одна с двумя детьми. Ей 41 год и он разведена. Вся ответственность за детей лежит на ней. Поэтому ей приходится много работать , для того чтобы обеспечить детей. У нее имеется частная пекарня , где она печет различного вида кондитерские изделия. Кроме того у нее рядом с домом имеется столик , где она торгует различными сладостями для детей. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы купить печь . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of an oven

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji*, wife of M., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children who are too young to attend school.Shahnaz baji is a housewife who takes care of her children. Her husband is a driver by profession and drives his own auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle, similar to a "tuk-tuk"). Shahnaz baji is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. She wants to buy another auto-rickshaw to increase their profits.

She is joined in her loan group by five more members. Naseem baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw. Nargis baji wants a loan to buy groceries (wheat, rice, sugar) for her grocery shop. Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy stock animals (cows, goats) for her meat business. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy ingredients for her food business. Shahida baji wants a loan to buy more clothes for her clothing business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

*"Baji," which literally means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle)

loans.name: Sojida

texts.ru:
Sojida N. lives in the Gissar District. She is 40 years old, married, and has three children. She has a vocational education in health care, and works in the Gissar District's dental department. She decided to take out a loan in order to buy equipment and products for treating and preventing dental problems. She is paid for her work, and the quality of the services she offers depends on this. With the loan, she will be able to attract clients, and help local residents by providing medical services. She will repay the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Носирова Соджида жительница Гиссарского района. Возраст 40 лет, замужем и имеет троих детей. Имеет средне-медицинское образование. Работает в стоматологическом отделении Гиссарского района. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы закупить стомотологический инвентарь и препараты для лечения и профилактики зубов. Услуги у нее платные , поэтому от этого зависит качество обслуживания и наладив его она сможет привлечь клиентов , а так же помочь населению , предоставляя медицинские услуги. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Inventory purchases

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji is the wife of Muhammad Bota and lives in a city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She is the mother of nine children: four sons and five daughters. Her daughters are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Her elder son has a bicycle shop where he sells bicycles. Jamila baji is a housewife and takes care of her children. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan for her younger son who wants to start a "wooden cot" business at his house where he makes wooden cots and sells them at good prices. For this business he requires wood.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Sakina baji and Zuhra baji each want a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Buhran baji wants a loan to repair her workshop. Razia baji wants a loan to buy material (rice and chick-peas) for her food business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood for her son's business

loans.name: Naseem M. Manzoor Group

texts.en:
Naseem baji is the wife of Manzoor A. and lives in a city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 5 years. Naseem baji's husband sells wooden sticks in various places as well as his community. He has been in this work for the last 3 years. Naseem baji successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more wooden sticks to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Salma baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Nishan baji wants a loan to buy more wood to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more wooden sticks for re-sale

loans.name: Zebonisso

texts.ru:
Zebonisso H. lives in the Vakhsh district. She is 33 years old, married, and has three children. She works at the Kurgan-Tube city market, selling cottonseed oil. She buys from the oil factory in the city Dushanbe and brings it to Kurgan-Tube to sell at a profitable price. Still, she does not set her prices too high; they are the lowest in the market, and because of that she has the most customers. She does not have enough goods to satisfy everyone, so she decided to increase sales volume by taking out a loan. She will repay the loan in 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Ходжакулова Зебониссо жительница Вахшского района. Возраст 33 года , замужем и имеет троих детей. Работает на рынке города Курган-Тюбе. Торгует хлопковым маслом. Закупает на масложирном комбинате города Душанбе и привозит в Курган-Тюбе продавать по выгодной цене. Но Зебониссо ставит наценку не большую , поэтому цены у нее самые низкие и по этой причине у нее много клиентов. Для того , чтобы обслужить всех у нее не хватает товара , поэтому она решила увеличить товарооборот путем получения кредита. Погасить кредит сможет в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of M. H. and lives in a city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children: three sons and one daughter. Her eldest son is in 10th standard. Her next eldest son is in 5th standard. Her younger son is in 4th class. Her daughter is in 7th standard. Nasreen baji is a very responsible woman; she knows her responsibilities so well. Her husband sells clothes and has been in this profession for the last 3 years. Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy more clothes to expand her husband's business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Zareena baji wants a loan to buy cloth to resell. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Manzoran baji and Sakina baji each want a loan to buy grocery items (wheat, rice, sugar) for their grocery shops.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Mahmadaub

texts.ru:
Mahmadaub F. lives in the Khuroson district, and works as a middle school teacher. He has also been raising animals for 4 years. He buys thin, unfinished bull calves, and after fattening them, sells them at a profit. He found out about the availability of loans, and came to us for one. He decided to take out a loan with a 15 month term in order to buy another calf. This will help him increase sales and income. Mahmadaub is married and has four children.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Файзов Махмадаюб проживает в районе Хуросон. Работает учителем в средней школе . Кроме того уже 4 года занимается животноводством. Поакупает худых , неоткормленных бычков и после откормки продает по выгодной цене. Узнал про возможность получить кредит , обратился к нам за кредитом. Планирует получить кредит сроком на 15 месяцев , для того , чтобы купить еще одного бычка . Это поможет увеличить товарооборот и получить прибыль.Махмадаюб женат и имеет четверых детей.

loans.use: Purchase of a calf

loans.name: Ikhtayar's Group

texts.en:
Ikhtayar baji is the wife of M. and the mother of seven children: five sons and two daughters. She lives in a city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 15 years.

Ikhtayar baji wakes up at 4 AM to milk the buffalos and fills the milk into big steel jars and hands it over to her husband who goes to several shops to sell the milk. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo to expand her milk business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics for her beauty parlor. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Bashiran baji and Shakeela baji each want a loan to buy vegetables to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for her milk business

loans.name: Munaza's Group

texts.en:
Munaza baji is the wife of M. A. and the mother of four children. All of her children are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. She lives in a city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. Munaza baji's husband has a business in cable networking. The definition of cable networking is "he provides tv channels to the community through satellite". Munaza baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy wire to expand her husband's cable networking business.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Tanvir baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit to resell. Kalsoom baji wants a loan to buy mason's tools. Safia baji wants a loan to buy computer parts to resell. Shamim baji wants a loan to buy leather for her leather business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy cable wires for her husband's business

loans.name: Hilolbi

texts.ru:
Hilolbi G. lives in the Vahdat district of Tajikistan with her five children. They all live happily together. Her husband left for Russia to find work. She practices animal husbandry; raising cows on her plot of land. She would like to receive a loan so that she can purchase one more cow, which would increase her supply of milk. She would then be able to increase her income from selling the milk. She will pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

She herself raises animals. She has land to care for cows Ганиева Хилолби жительница Вахдатского района. Живет со своей семьей. У нее пятеро детей. Все живут дружно. Муж уехал на заработки в Россию.Сама она занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство , где ухаживет за коровами. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить еще одну корову, так как приобретение еще одной коровы даст возможность получать больше молока . А это поможет получать больше дохода от продаваемого молока. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials to keep operating her nails center.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a large amount of fruits and vegetables to resell in her community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in a large variety of goods to restock her grocery store.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Akram

texts.ru:
Akram H. lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 21 years old, married recently and has a child. Akram raises animals on his own land, and he would like to take out a loan to buy a cow. His business is the only source of income for the family, so he wants to develop it further. He will repay the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer.

Хошимов Акрам проживает вгороде Вахдат. Возраст 21 год. Недавно женился и имеет одного ребенка. Занимается животноводством. Имеет хозяйство. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы купить корову. Этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода его семьи. Поэтому он планирует развивать бизнес. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a new assortment of stylish pants to add to her inventory.

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Mme Amy T. est une marchande de poissons depuis cinq ans dans son quartier de Ouakam. Son produit fait l'objet d'une forte demande ce qui entraine un besoin en fonds de roulement important. Le present credit est destine a renforser son stock pour faire face a la demande.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amy Tioune has been a fish saleswoman for the last five years in her neighborhood of Ouakam. There has been a strong increase in the demand for her products that requires a significant increase in operating funds. This current loan will be used to increase her stock to meet this demand.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating funds

loans.name: Latifa

texts.en:
Latifa R., age 45, is married with 5 children (ages 22, 19, 15, 11, and 4). She has a general shop, which she started in 1996. She works from 7:00 AM to 3:00 PM daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $130.

She hopes to take a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase her capital.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of E. M. and lives in a small city named Chichawatni, Pakistan. She is the mother of two children. Nasreen baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She owns a two-room brick house and has been living in it for the last 5 years. She successfully completed her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy grocery items (lentils, rice, sugar) for her grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Abida baji wants a loan to buy cattle (goats, a cow) to re-sell. Naik baji wants a loan to buy cattle (a cow, goats) for her meat business. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy groceries (lentils, sugar, rice) for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her business

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Кахорова Робия проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст 50 лет, замужем и имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Домохозяйка . Но в помощь мужу занимается животноводством. Имеет корову. Получаемое молоко продает на базаре или соседям по низким ценам. К зиме ей необходимо перестроить сарай . Нужно закупить шифер и доски. Для этого она планирует получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Robiya K. lives in Vahdat. She is 50 years old, is married and has 5 children. Robiya has a high school education and is a homemaker. In order to help her husband she raises livestock. Robiya owns a dairy cow and sells the milk at the market and to neighbors at low prices. Robiya needs to rebuild her shed for the winter. She needs to purchase slate and boards. She plans to take out a 12 month loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase slate and boards

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji*, a wife of M., has been living in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children, one son and three daughters. Her eldest daughter and son are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood. Shahnaz baji is a housewife and prefers to do domestic chores. Her husband runs a grocery shop. 

Shahnaz baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah, a microfinance institute in Pakistan. Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries (lentils,rice,sugar) for her grocery shop. Shahnaz baji wishes to diversify her grocery shop into a general store.

She is joined in her loan group by a four more members. Shazia baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart. Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to repair an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle). Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo to produce milk to sell. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy more cloth to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

*"Baji," which literally means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy stock for grocery shop

loans.name: Dalanda

texts.fr: Mme Dalanda D. est une vendeuse de legumes tres dynamique . Elle est entreprenante mais ne dispose pas de assez de fonds pour augmenter son volume d'activite dans un secteur tres porteur. Elle sollicite ce credit pour renforcer son stock.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dalanda D. is an dynamic saleswoman of vegetable products. She is enterprising, but does not have the available funds to increase her sales volume in this very flourishing market. She is requesting this loan to increase her stock.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Aruwa

texts.en:
Aruwa is 32 years old, married, and has 5 children between the ages of 2 and 14. She has been selling clothes since 2005. Every day, she begins work at 9AM and ends at 9PM. She earns a monthly profit of around $40 from her sales.

In the past, Aruwa has successfully completed two loans from BRAC Tanzania, using them to expand her business. She is now requesting a loan in order to further expand her inventory and stock of clothing.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: Shagufta's Group

texts.en:
Shagufta baji*, the wife of E. I., lives in Chichawatni, Pakistan. She has one daughter who is 4 years old and in kindergarten. Shagufta baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.
