Her husband doesn't do anything. So, Shagufta baji is applying for a loan to buy a buffalo, which will be the start of a milk business for her husband.

She is joined in her loan group by four other women. Bilquis baji and Sajida baji also want loans to buy a buffalo for their milk businesses. Latifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries (lentils, rice, sugar) for her grocery shop. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled vehicle, like a "tuk-tuk").

In a group loan, the loan funds are distributed among the group members, each of whom invests in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

*Baji, which literally means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo

loans.name: Sadillo

texts.ru: Абдулхакимов Саъдилло проживает в районе Хуросон. Занимается животноводством. Имеет бычков , овец и коз. Разводит животных для продажи . Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 5 лет. Дело прибыльное и поэтому Садилло вплотную занялся только этим бизнесом. Сейчас он планирует получить кредит и на, полученные деньги хочет  закупить овец и коз. Откормив их он сможет выгодно продать  осенью и зимой. Погашать кредит планирует в течение 15 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sadillo A. lives in the Khuroson region. He raises livestock and owns calves, sheep and goats. He raises these animals for sale. Sadillo has been in this business for 5 years. The business is profitable and Sadillo decided to dedicate himself fulltime to it. He plans to take out a loan to purchase sheep and goats. After fattening them, he will be able to sell them for a profit in the fall and winter. Sadillo plans to pay back the loan over 15 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Inne's Yatakuwa Group

texts.en:
Inne is 38 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 7 and 3. She has been a charcoal and firewood seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

In the past, Inne has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Inne now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with charcoal sales and clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood for her business

loans.name: Oumy

texts.fr: Mme Oumy S. est tres experimentee dans la vente de parfums et de produits de beaute. Son marche est tres porteur mais elle manque de ressources pour renforcer son stock. Le present credit l'aidera beaucoup dans ce sens
texts.en:
Mrs. Oumy S. is very experienced in selling perfumes and beauty products. Her market is very strong, but she lacks the resources to grow her stock. This loan will help her greatly with this.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 34 years old. She is married with 5 children aged between 1 and 8. She owns a small shop and she has been a bites seller since 2002. Every day, she works from 6am to 10pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $550 from her sales.

Khadija now hopes for a loan to buy more products for her business.

loans.use: To buy more products for her business

loans.name: Mwandawa's Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Mwandawa is 33 years old and married with 3 children aged 9, 5 and 1. She has been a clothes and firewood seller since 2007. Every day she works from 7 AM to 8 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

Mwandawa now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Jina and Asia, who have businesses dealing with firewood & clothes sales, and cosmetics & food sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Rev. D.m.'s Group

texts.en:
These are Rev. D.S. S., Munda C. Sylvalie, Sulaiman J., Albert B. K., Jeremah L. S., and Christopher M. L.. They are all teachers at the Benevolent Islamic Secondary School Makeni. They are requesting a loan of Le 5,000,000.00.

Rev. D.M. S., Albert B. K., and Christopher M. L. are requesting this loan to help them purchase building materials. Munda C. Sylvalie is requesting a loan to invest in a business, and Sulaiman J. wants to use his loan to purchase pieces of furniture. At the end of each month, these teachers will get their salaries deducted to repay their loans to SMT.

Rev. D.M. S. is 40 years old, and he is married with 3 children. He has thought for the past 6 years now.

loans.use: To purchase building materials

loans.name: Moza

texts.en:
Moza is 20 years old and single. She has been a clothes seller since March, 2008. Every day she works in her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

Moza now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga & bedsheets) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 41 years old. She is married with 5 children, aged between 14 and 22. She has been a fish seller since 2000. Every day, she works from 9am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for re-sale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for re-sale

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is 35 years old. She is married with 2 children, aged 9 and 3. She is a juice, bread, and eggs seller since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $125 from her sales.

Asha now hopes for a loan to improve her business by increasing her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Aiah S.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the Benevolent Secondary School Makeni. These teachers are: Aiah Saspo K., Zainab K. and Brima Ironnsky T.. They are requesting a loan of Le 2,500,000.00. With this loan, Aiah will buy building materials to complete the building of a house he has begun constructing.

Zainab will invest her share of the loan in agriculture. She has been in agriculture for many years now. And Brima Ironnsky will use his to pay his childrens' school fees and other charges. Aiah is the leader of this group; he is now 52. He is married with 4 children. Aiah is today a senior teacher at the Benevolent Secondary School Makeni and has been in the teaching profession for over 15 years now.

loans.use: Buy building materials

loans.name: Marieme

texts.fr: Mme Marieme S. est active dans dans la vente de produits de beaute dans son quartier de Ouakam et dispose d'une clientele fidele et solvable. Son handicap est qu'elle ne peut pas satisfaire une demande croissante par manque de fonds . Elle sollicite un credit pour remedier a cela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marieme S. is active in selling beauty supplies in her neighborhood of Ouakam and has a faithful and creditworthy clientele. Her handicap is that she cannot satisfy a growing demand due to a lack of funds. She seeks a loan to remedy this.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase her stock

loans.name: Mwajuma's Uvivu Si Kazi Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 26 years old and married with 3 children, aged 10, 4 and 2. She has been a charcoal, firewood and snacks seller since in 2005. Every day she works from 6 AM to 10 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

Mwajuma now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Zuhura and Khadija, who also have businesses dealing with the sale of fish, clothes, and cosmetics.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal & firewood for her business.

loans.name: Daniel P.'s Group

texts.en:
These are Daniel P. K., Fatmata S., Ramatu B. K., Moses K., and John S. S.. They are teachers at the Benevolent Secondary School Makeni. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,700,000.00. With this loan, they will be able to meet their immediate needs and then repay it over a period of 10 months out of their monthly salaries.

Forty-one years old, Daniel P. K. would like to use his loan to pay school fees and other charges for his children. He is married with 6 children.

Fatmata S. will use hers to invest in a business. She is married with 3 children.

Ramatu B. K. is 39. She is married with 3 children. Ramatu will use her loan to pay her children's school fees and other related charges.

Moses K. too will use his to pay school fees for his children, while John S. S. will use his to purchase building materials.

loans.use: To pay school fees and other charges

loans.name: Semeni's Sote Tushikamane Group

texts.en:
Semeni is 25 years old. She is married with two children; one is four years old and the other is two. She has been a bites (snack) seller since 2002. Every day, she works from 6:00 A.M. to 9:00 P.M. at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $95 from her sales.

Semeni now hopes for a loan to improve her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Siwajibu, who has a business selling spices.

loans.use: To improve her business by increasing her stock.

loans.name: Pili

texts.en:
Pili is 28 years old. She is married with 1 child aged 2. She has been a clothes-seller since 2007. Every day, she works at her business.

Pili now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 30 years old. She is married with 2 children aged 10 and 8. She owns and has run a small beauty salon since 2001. Every day, she works from 9am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her work.

Janeth now hopes for a loan to buy more salon items for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items for expansion of her business

loans.name: Joseph S.'s Group

texts.en:
These are Joseph S. K., Sheka B., and Sorie Sas K.. They are all teachers at the Benevolent Secondary School Makeni. They want a loan of Le 2,300,000.00 to help them meet their immediate needs, and then they will repay it gradually with their monthly salaries.

Joseph S. K. is 43 years old. He is married with 4 children. He has taught for 2 years now. He wants a loan to buy himself some building materials.

Sheika is 32; he has taught for 5 years now. Sheika would like to invest his loan in a business.

Sorie would also like to invest his in a business. He is 50 years old and has been in the teaching profession for over 25 years now.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Fadhila's Wastara Group

texts.en:
Fadhila is 26 years old. She is single with 2 children aged 2 and 6 years old. She has owned a small stationery shop since 2007. Every day, she works from 9am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Fadhila now hopes for a loan to buy more stationery items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Sabah.

loans.use: buying more stationery items for her business

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila is married with a grown son named Yuryi. She sells office supplies and small necessities in the central city market in Pavlograd. She has a nice selection of items to offer to her customers. Moreover, she has rich experience and practical skills to present her merchandise in a way that will attract more clients. Ludmila has been in business for 14 years. Currently, her monthly turnover is about $4,000. Her net profit is about $500 a month.

Ludmila is seeking a loan for 1000 Grivnas to purchase additional office supplies for the upcoming school season, which starts as of Sept. 1 in Ukraine. She loves being self-employed and earning enough profit to support not only herself but also her son, who is saving money to purchase a separate apartment and solve his housing problem. Ludmila hasn't had a single delinquent payment ever since she got her first loan from Nadiya Ukraine.

Note: this is a short-term "express" loan that will be repaid in a month.

loans.use: To purchase office supplies to sell

loans.name: Yaroslav

texts.en:
Yaroslav is married with two sons, Volodya and Roman. He runs a small business selling dishware in Drogobych, where he's originally from. Moreover, Yaroslav also has another business offering transportation services in his region. He has been in business for 10 years. He gets about $4,000 of gross revenue each month.  

Yaroslav is requesting a loan of 2500 Grivnas to purchase dishware for his vending kiosk. A variety of good quality products will help him boost his sales and generate additional profit. Yaroslav believes that his business and marketing abilities, in combination with financial assistance, will help him increase his income and success.

Note: this is a short-term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina has two grown children. She runs a small business selling leather clothing, such as jackets, coats and vests, in one of the city markets. Her clothing sale business is successful. Irina has a unique talent for identifying new opportunities and determining appropriate growth policies for her business. She has been in the trade for 10 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about $6,000. Her monthly net profit is about $700.  

Irina would like to get a loan of 1500 Grivnas to increase her working capital. We believe her natural ability to please her customers, guessing their needs and offering speedy and courteous service, will help Irina achieve her goals, sustain her success and consequently win the entrepreneurial game.  

Note: this is a short term "express" loan that will be repaid in one month.

loans.use: To expand her trade

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana has a grown daughter. As a determined individual, Tatyana decided 10 years ago to find ways to support her family and start her own business selling men's and women's clothing. Tatyana has been in business now for many years and has two vending facilities located at the central city market. 

Tatyana is very sociable and cheerful. Her positive attitude and smiling face attract many customers. Quick responses to any change in customer demand have helped her be successful in business. Tatyana has demonstrated responsibility and integrity in her relations with her suppliers and customers, as well as when she has used lending services from Nadiya Ukraine. Prompt loan repayments and stability in her business have demonstrated her trustworthiness and capability of further loan repayment. Tatyana is requesting a loan of 3500 Grivnas to purchase inventory wholesale. She is planning to buy bulk quantities of seasonal clothing, which will sell really well this fall. Eventually Tatyana would like to expand her business and start selling at other locations. Increased inventory turnover will generate the necessary funds to sustain her business as well as meet her family's needs.

loans.use: To increase her seasonal stock

loans.name: Albert L.'s Group

texts.en:
These are Albert A. K., Eda B., Samuel S., Ibrahim M.S. F., and Mariama L. K.. They are all teachers at the Benevolent Secondary School Makeni. They are requesting a loan of Le 3,600,000 to help them solve their immediate needs, and then they will repay their loans gradually out of their monthly salaries.

Albert, Eda, and Ibrahim would like to use their loans to purchase building materials. Albert is 56, and he is married with 4 children. Samuel will use his to pay school fees and other charges for his children, and Mariama will use hers to invest in a business.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is single. She lives with her parents in Melitopol. Yelena runs a small business selling women's outerwear in the central marketplace. She has had this small business for six years. It has now become the main source of income for her family. 

Yelena is a cheerful, hard worker despite the difficulties she faces. She has repaid all loans from Nadiya Ukraine, and these have helped create stability for her business. Currently, Yelena has about $1,600 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to $600. Yelena is requesting a loan for 4000 Grivnas to resupply her inventory before the school season. In pursuit of her goal, Yelena plans to invest her extra profits into the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To resupply inventory

loans.name: Abdul Rahman's Fanaka Group

texts.en:
Abdul Rahman C., 44, is married with one daughter of 13 years. He has been selling broilers for 2 years. He works from 6am to 4pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about US$ 150.

He has taken out 4 previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase his business capital. He hopes for a new loan to start dealing with layers. Abdul will share his loan with his loan group Fanaka which totals 14 members. These members monitor and support each other in paying back the loan.

In the picture Abdul is the 1st in the front row on the right.

loans.use: to start selling layers

loans.name: Las Estrellas De Mollebamba Group

texts.es:
The community of Mollebamba is located approximately 15 minutes from Cangallo. A total of 30 families live in this community. Most of them are wheat and vegetable farmers. This community has access to the town fairs in Cangallo, Pampa and Ayacucho.

Catalina Oré buys wheat products and vegetables to sell in Ayacucho with the help of her son and her husband. She also has a restaurant in Huahua Puquio and a small grocery stO.. She buys her merchandise in Ayacucho and sells them at the local fairs in other communities nearby. Her children go to school in the city of Ayacucho. She would like for them to have a better future. She would like to save some money to proviD. a better education for her kids. She likes what she does and her family is doing fine but she would like to go to the city to proviD. a much better education for her children. Catalina is a new member with Finca Perú and would like to have some savings. She wants to learn how to love and value herself.

Felicitas T. has a small grocery stO., raises guinea pigs and she sells fruit in Pampa Cangallo where she buys cheese to sell in Huahua Puquio. Felicitas wishes to invest her savings in the college education of her only daughter and to one day own a business. Felicitas has learned the value of teamwork and to share daily challenges with the other members of the communal bank. She has learned how to confront daily problems and not to be afraid of the future.

Toribia has a small grocery stO.. She also buys wheat products and vegetables and sells them in Pisco. Toribia would like to buy a car so that she can travel to Ayacucho to sell her merchandise and therefO. improving her business. She never knew how to save until she joined Finca Perú, but now she has the opportunity and the knowledge to do it. She has learned how to love and to value herself and that she's as capable as a man to run her own business and to make as much money. She currently earns mO. than her husband and she's contributing mO. towards the montly bills.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

La comunidad D. Mollebamba, esta ubicada aproximadamente a 15 minutos D. Cangallo, esta Comunidad cuenta con 30 familias aproximadamente que viven en la comunidad, los comuneros se dedican a la siembra D. cereales como trigo, cebada, maíz, arveja y tubérculos como papa y a las plantaciones D. Frutales, etc. La comunidad tiene un acceso a la feria D. Cangallo, Pampa cangallo y Ayacucho

Catalina Oré, compra todo tipo D. cereales, tubérculos y tara y los lleva a Ayacucho para comercializar, pero lo hace con el apoyo D. su esposo y sus hijos. Catalina también tiene un restaurante en Huahua Puquío y una bodega, ella trae abarrotes D. Ayacucho y los lleva a las ferias D. las comunidades y/o anexos donD. la gente le compra sus productos. Sus hijos estudian en la ciudad D. Ayacucho, Catalina quiere tener el orgullo D. que sean mejores que ella y su familia. Catalina, quiere mejorar su trabajo, hasta el momento les va bien pero quiere capitalizarse un poco mas y hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, pero para ello quiere salir a la ciudad para darles mejores oportunidades. Catalina recién empieza a trabajar con Finca Perú y le gustaría tener ahorros, tambien quererse y valorarse como persona.

Felicitas T., tiene una tienda D. abarrotes, también cría cuyes y lleva frutas a Pampa Cangallo D. donD. trae queso para venderlo en Huahua Puquío Felicitas desea invertir sus ahorros en los estudios D. su hija y también quiere poner su negocio propio. Felicitas desea que su única hija termine sus estudios universitarios. Felicitas ha aprendido que las personas estando juntas aprenden a tener mayores responsabilidades y ser muy puntuales, en su bancomunal aprendió a compartir sus cosas y problemas familiares, ahí encuentra una orientación D. como superarlos y no tener miedo D. las cosas que vienen al futuro.

Toribia T., tiene una tienda D. abarrotes. También compra y venD. tara, cereales y las lleva a Pisco. Toribia, quiere comprarse un carro para poder hacer mejor su negocio, antes D. entrar a Finca Perú no sabia ahorrar, ahora tiene la oportunidad D. hacerlo pensando en su futuro. Toribia con sus ahorros comprará un carro, para poder viajar a Ayacucho y llevar los cereales y así mejorar su negocio. En su bancomunal a aprendido a respetarse a si misma y también sabe que ella tiene las mismas facultades que los varones, en su caso ella trabaja bien en su negocio y tiene más dinero que su esposo, ella aporta más a la casa en los gastos.

loans.use: The members of the communal bank called "The Stars of Mollebamba" are requesting a loan to purchase wheat products and to invest in their own individual businesses.

loans.name: Mujeres Para El Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
The community of Erusco is located 45 minutes from the capital in the district of Huancapi. This community concentrates mainly in the production of cereals but most people grow vegetables.

Hermelinda sells groceries and she also sells young livestock. She buys livestock and takes it to the local fairs to sell. Hermelinda would like to one day have an animal farm with chickens, ducks and turkeys. She would like to save some money and put it towards her kids' education. She would also like to stock up her grocery store. Hermelinda learned some saving techniques from her communal bank, and would like for FINCA Perú to teach her and educate her on business in general.

Alraidina sells vegetables and wheat products on weekends. Alraidina would like to take care of the monthly bills for her family and would like to proviD. for her children a roof over their heads. She's currently saving some money so that she can make some improvements to her home and to put up a store. Alraidina has learned from her communal bank to love and to value herself. She tells us that no other institution has taught her as much as FINCA Perú. She would like to one day proviD. a college education for her kids.

Mirtha sells clothes and she buys and sells wheat products which she takes to Ayacucho to sell. Her dream is to one day have a farm and to save money to be able to proviD. an education for her kids in the future. She has learned from her communal bank to love and to value herself.

Translated by a Kiva Volunteer.

L. comunidad D. Erusco esta ubicada a 45 minutos D. L. capital del distrito D. Huancapi, esta comunidad mayormente se dedican a L. producción D. cereales y tubérculos, pero es mas L. producción D. verduras y L. mayoría D. L. gente se dedica al negocio

Hermelinda, venD. abarrotes, tambien venD. animales menores, los compra y lleva a L. feria D. cangallo, a Hermelinda le gustaria tener uan granja D. gallinas, patos y pavos. ElL. desea ahorrar para L. educación D. sus hijos y comprar mas cosas para su bodega. En su bancomunal Hermelinda a aprendido a ahorrar y le gustaría que FINCA Perú le enseñe y eduque sobre los negocios.

Alraidina, venD. verduras, también venD. cereales los días sábados y domingos. A Alraidina le gustaría mejorar su familia, comprar las cosas D. L. casa y ver por sus hijos para que tengan un lugar donD. vivir. Ahora esta ahorrando para ampliar su casa y poder poner una tienda. Alraidina ha aprendido en su bancomunal a quererse y valorarse como persona, elL. dice que nunca ninguna institución le enseño y le lleva D. L. mano para caminar, con FINCA Perú elL. aprendió sobre las mejores herencias que tiene para dejarle a sus hijos que es el estudio.

Mirtha, venD. ropa, tambien compra y venta cereales, las que lleva a Ayacucho. Su sueño es tener una piscigranja, hacer estudiar a sus hijos para que sean profesionales, por ello va a ahorrar. En su bancomunal a aprendido a quererse y valorarse como persona, también recibe prestamos con mucha facilidad.

loans.use: The members of the communal bank called "Women for Development" are requesting a loan in the amount of $700 USD for the prodcution of wheat products and to start their own individual businesses.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Born on March 14, 1976 in Cotonou in the Littoral Department in the south of Benin, Mrs. Mariam A. is married and the mother of three children, all of whom are still in her care. Her three children are enrolled in school. She sells shoes and handbags that she buys in Togo, a country next door to Benin. She is requesting this loan to buy new styles of these products and answer the demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 14 mars 1976 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au Sud du Bénin, dame A. Mariam est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants tous à sa charge. Ses trois enfants sont tous scolarisés. Elle vend des chaussures et des sacs qu'elle achète du TOGO, un pays voisin au Bénin. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter les nouvelles gammes de ces produits et répondre aux exigences de ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 dozen shoes and 10 dozen handbags

Achat de 15 douzaines de chaussures et de 10 douzaines de sacs

loans.name: Agathe

texts.fr:
Mrs. Agathe A. was born on September 8, 1967 in Lomé, Togo. Living in Benin for about 10 years, she is married to Mr. Daniel Dohou and mother of three children: Boris, Gabriel, and Rita for whom she is still responsible. From her mother, Mrs. Abla Dogbe, she gained several years experience with selling corn. Three years ago she became independent, and she does her buying in the north of Benin, then distributes her merchandise to retailers.

In view of the present hikes in the price of corn due to the ever-increasing cost of living, she is requesting a loan of US$ 925 to stock up.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Dame A. Agathe est né le 8 Septembre 1967 à Lomé au TOGO. Résident au BENIN depuis une dizaine d'années, elle est mariée à monsieur DOHOU Daniel et mère de trois enfants: Boris, Gabriel et Rita tous encore à sa charge. Elle a déjà acquis auprès de sa maman dame DOGBE Abla, plusieurs années d'expérience dans la commercialisation du maïs. Devenue indépendante il y a trois ans, elle s'approvisionne au Nord du BENIN puis distribue sa marchandise à des détaillants.

Compte tenu de la hausse actuelle du prix du maïs due à la cherté de la vie, elle sollicite un financement de 400000FCFA afin de s'approvisionner.

loans.use:
Purchase of 15 sacks of corn

Achat de 15 sacs de maïs

loans.name: Aïchatou

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aïchatou A. was born on January 15, 1978 in Porto-Novo in Ouémé County. She is married and mother of 4 children who are all still in her care. She sells sacks of corn and sacks of rice. She is asking for this loan so that she will be able to satisfy the needs of her customers who are daily growing more numerous.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Dame A. Aïchatou est née le 15 janvier 1978 à Porto-Novo dans le département de l'Ouémé. Elle est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants qui sont tous à sa charge. Elle est revendeuse de sacs de maïs et de sacs de riz. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour satisfaire sa clientèle dont le nombre ne cesse d'augmenter tous les jours.

loans.use:
Purchase of 30 sacks of corn and 15 sacks of rice

Achat de 30 sacs de maïs et 15 sacs de riz.

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr:
Mrs. Florence A. was born around 1976 in Abomey in the counties of Zou-Colline. She is married and the mother of 2 children, Brice and Clarisse, 10 and 5 respectively and in 4th grade and kindergarten. She sells bowls and coolers that she purchases in the Dantokpa market. In order to reduce the cost of her goods, she has decided to go, herself, to Lomé, Togo, to make her purchases. She is requesting this loan with a view to achieving that goal.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Dame A. Florence est née vers les années 1976 à Abomey dans les départements du Zou-Colline. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, Brice et Clarisse âgés de 10 et 05 ans et respectivement en classe de CM1 et CP au cours primaire. Elle vend des bols et des glacières qu'elle achète au marché DANTOKPA. Pour amoindrir le prix de revient de ses marchandises, elle a décidé d'aller elle même à Lomé au TOGO pour faire ses achats. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour réaliser ce projet.

loans.use:
Purchase of 30 coolers and 10 dozen bowls

Achat de 30 glacières et de 10 douzaines de bols.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.fr:
Born January 13, 1978 in Porto-Novo in Ouémé County, Mrs. Françoise A. is married and the mother of 2 children, Enock and Pascaline, ages 10 and 6 respectively, and in fourth grade and first grade. She sells fried coco yams on the roadside. She is requesting this loan so as to meet increasing customer demand.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Née le 13 janvier 1978 à Porto-Novo dans le département de l'Ouémé, dame A. Françoise est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, Enock et Pascaline respectivement âgés de 10 ans et de 06 ans et en classe de CE2 et CI au cours primaire. Elle vend de l'igname frite au bord de la voie. Elle sollicite ce prêt afin de répondre à la hausse de la demande de ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 sacks of coco yams and 5 tins of vegetable oil

Achat de 10 sacs de tubercules d'ignames et de 05 bidons de huiles végétales.

loans.name: Rolande

texts.fr:
Born around 1979 in Adjohoun in Ouémé County in the south of Benin, Mrs. Rolande A. is married to Paulin Houssa, a transit agent in the Autonomous Port of Cotonou. She is the mother of 2 children: Rosine, 14, is in 8th grade and Romain, 8, is in third grade. Mrs. A. is specialized in selling cold (cooled) drinks. With a view to satisfying her ever growing clientele, she is presently requesting her second loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Née vers 1979 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin, dame A. Rolande est mariée à Paulin HOUSSA agent de transit au Port Autonome de Cotonou. Elle est mère de deux (02) enfants: Rosine âgée de 14 ans est en classe de cinquième et Romain âgé de 8 ans est en classe de CE2. Dame A. Rolande est spécialiste dans la distribution des boissons fraîche. Dans l'optique de donner satisfaction à sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, elle vient solliciter son deuxième crédit à ALIDé.

loans.use:
Purchase of a refrigerator

Achat d'un réfrigérateur.

loans.name: Felicite

texts.fr:
Mrs. Félicité A. is a native of Togo and was born around 1969 in Palimè, Togo. She is married to Mr. Ganiou da-Silva, a professional cook. She is mother of three children: Comlan, Fionou, and Ablawa, 18, 15, and 14 respectively. She does traveling sales, selling various items but principally soap. Mrs. A. was ill these past two months and so has had to spend a lot of money regaining her health. She is requesting this loan with a view to getting her traveling sales business started up again.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Dame A. Félicité est de nationalité togolaise et est née vers 1969 à Palimè au TOGO. Elle est mariée à monsieur da-SILVA Ganiou, cuisinier de profession. Elle est mère de trois (03) enfants: Comlan, Fionou et Ablawa agés respectivement de 18, 15 et 14 ans. Elle est ambulante et vend divers articles et principalement du savon. Dame A. Félicité a été malade courant les deux derniers mois et a donc énormément dépensé pour sa santé. Elle sollicite ce crédit en vue de relancer son commerce.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 cases of "Palmida" soap, 8 cases of "Fanico" soap, 2 cases of sugar and 1 case of "Mosquito" insecticide

Achat de 10 cartons de savon "PALMIDA"; de 8 cartons de savons "FANICO"; de 2 cartons de sucre et d'un carton d'insecticide "MOSQUITO".

loans.name: Sohanoude

texts.fr:
Mrs. Sohanoude A. was born around 1968 in Togo, a country that borders on Benin. Married to Mr. Constant Sanda, an employee of the Autonomous Port of Cotonou, she has two children, Femy and Vivien, 15 and 11 respectively, both enrolled in school. For 5 years she has been selling various items such as concentrated milk, evaporated milk, soap, sardines, sugar, etc. Soon, Mrs. A. would like to add on a metallic store, purchased with her own money, with a view to expanding her business. She is now requesting her fourth loan to allow her to better satisfy her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Dame A. Sohanoude est née vers 1968 au TOGO, un pays voisin au Bénin. Mariée à monsieur SANDA Constant, employé au Port Autonome de Cotonou. Elle a deux enfants à sa charge : Femy et Vivien âgés respectivement de 15 et 11 ans et tous deux scolarisés. Elle commercialise depuis cinq ans divers articles tels que du lait concentré sucré et non sucré, du savon, de la sardine, du sucre,etc. Dame A. Sohanoude veut intégrer prochainement une boutique métallique acquise sur fonds propres en vue de l'expansion de son activité. Elle vient solliciter son quatrième crédit pour satisfaire au mieux sa clientèle.

loans.use:
Purchase of 10 cases of soap, 10 tins of concentrated milk, 5 cases of insecticide, 2 sacks of granulated sugar

Achat de 10 cartons de Savon, de 10 boîtes de lait concentré, de 5 cartons de d'insecticide, de 2 sacs de sucre en poudre.

loans.name: Sira

texts.fr:
Sira D., 56, married and raising 4 children has been a member of the village bank Saré Yéroyel for 5 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase goats and rams in order to boast her livestock fattening business. She is intending to sell them during the Moslem feast commemorating Abraham's sacrifice (known in Senegal asTabaski) at which point animals are sold at much higher prices than usual. Her income allows her to support her family. The loan that she is requesting will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months, in one single payment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Sira D., âgée de 56 ans, mariée avec 04 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Saré Yéroyel depuis 5 ans. Elle veut un prêt pour acheter des chèvres et des béliers afin de renforcer son activité d’embouche caprine et ovine. Elle compte vendre pendant la période de fête de Tabaski ou les bêtes sont vendus à des prix très élevés. Ses revenus lui permettent de prendre en charges ses charges familiales.Le prêt qu'elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use:
Fattening goats and sheep

Embouche caprine et ovine.

loans.name: Mahougnon Chantal

texts.fr: Born around 1976 in Cotonou in Littoral County in South Benin, Mrs. Mahougnon Chantal C. is married and the mother of 3 children: Eric, 15, is in 7th grade, Josiane, 13, is in fifth grade, and Vivien, 9, is in third grade.  She is requesting this loan in order to bolster her business and satisfy her customer demand. Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva VolunteerNée vers 1976 à Cotonou dans le département du Littoral au Sud Bénin, dame C. Mahougnon Chantal est mariée et  mère de trois (03) enfants: Eric âgé de 15 ans est élève en classe de cinquième au cours secondaire, Josiane âgée de 13 ans est élève en classe de CM2 au cours primaire et Vivien 09 ans est élève en classe de CE2 au cours primaire. Elle demande ce crédit dans le soucis de renforcer son activité et de faire face à la demande de sa clientèle.

loans.use: Purchase of 2 cases of tins of milk, 25 crates of drinks, and 1 case of sardinesAchat de deux (02) cartons de boîtes de lait, de 25 casiers de boissons et d'un carton de sardine.

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.es:
Ms. L. is a very responsible client. Her business is the preparation and commercialization of various condiments that she then sells in the different street fairs in the cities of La Paz and Oruro. Ms. L. is a single mother who lives with her parents. She also gives them working helping out with the bottling of the different products.

Translated by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Staff

La Sra. L. es una cliente muy responsable, su actividad es la de los condimentos, los prepara y los comerializa en las diferentes ferias entre las ciudades de La Paz y Oruro. La Sra. Es madre soltera, vive junto a sus padres a los cuales los mantiene y les da trabajo, ya que ellos le ayudan en el envase de los diferentes productos.

loans.use: Working capital / Capitalización de su negocio

loans.name: Olga Sylvie A.

texts.fr:
A native of Benin, born November 30, 1971 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin, Mrs. Olga Sylvie A. G. is married to Mr. Roger Adankon and the mother of three children, all enrolled in school and all still living at home. Involved in distributing shoes for re-sale to retailers, she also displays a number in front of her home. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase other types of shoes (flip-flops) at the request of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

De nationalité béninoise et née le 30 Novembre 1971 à Porto-Novo, la capitale politique du BENIN, dame G. Olga Sylvie A. est mariée à monsieur ADANKON Roger et mère de 3 enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Revendeuse de chaussures, elle livre ses chaussures aux détaillants et en expose une partie à la devanture de sa maison. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour l'achat d'autres types de chaussures (tapettes) sur demande de ses clients.

loans.use:
Purchase of 9 dozen shoes

Achat de 9 douzaines de chaussures.

loans.name: Guillermo Willy

texts.es:
Wily is a very hardworking person. He manages a small restaurant with his wife where they serve both national and international dishes. They have sacrificed to get where they are in life, working from early in the morning until late at night. They have three children, all of which are now studying at inexpensive private schools. His children also work in the restaurant cleaning and waiting tables to earn tips.

Translated by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Staff

Don Wily es una persona muy trabajadora, junto con su esposa atienden un pequeño restaurante, en el, se sirven platos nacionales e internacionales; llevan una vida sacrificada, ya que atienden desde tempranas horas de la mañana hasta altas horas de la noche. Tiene tres hijos, los cuales se estudian en colegios particulares,con mensualidades bajas, sus hijos tambien trabajan el el restaurante atendiendo las mesas, llevandose para ellos la propinas.

loans.use: Capitalización de su negocio

loans.name: Aimée

texts.fr:
Mrs. Aimée G. was born around 1962 in Tchonvi, in Oueme County in the south of Benin. She is a widow raising her sister's child, a girl named Lucie, age 12, who is not enrolled in school.

Mrs. G. buys tree trunks that she has split and sells by the pile as firewood. She has been very successful in this business due to her geographic location, since she lives in an area where most people use firewood for cooking. She is presently experiencing great financial difficulty in satisfying her customers, so she is requesting her third loan from Alidé in order to maintain the confidence of her clientele.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

Dame G. Aimée est née vers les années 1962 à Tchonvi, dans le département de l'OUEME au Sud du BENIN. Veuve ayant à sa charge l'enfant à sa sœur Lucie âgée de 12 ans et non scolarisée, elle achète des troncs d'arbre qu'elle fait fendre et les revend en tas sous forme de bois de chauffage. Elle connaît une grande réussite dans cette activité à cause de sa situation géographique et du fait qu'elle réside dans un quartier dont la grande majorité utilise le bois de chauffage pour faire la cuisine. Eprouvant d'énormes difficultés financières dans la recherche de satisfaction de ses clients, elle vient demander son troisième crédit à ALIDé pour maintenir la confiance entre ses clients et elle.

loans.use:
Purchase of firewood

Achat de bois de chauffage.

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.fr: Née vers 1973 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au BENIN, dame D. Euphrasie est mariée et mère de quatre enfants: Euphrem, Didier, Nicole et Eric encore à sa charge. Gérante d'un mini supermarché, elle est en position de monopole dans son quartier et réalise un chiffre d'affaire journalier non négligeable. Elle éprouve des difficultés d'approvisionnement dans sa quête de satisfaction de la clientèle. Elle sollicite son premier crédit à ALIDé afin de s'approvisionner en produits  nouveaux afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Born around 1973 in Adjohoun, in the county of Ouémé in BENIN, Ms. Euphrasie D. is married and the mother of four children: Euphrem, Didier, Nicole, and Eric still in her care. As the manager of a mini-supermarket, she has a monopoly in her district and produces significant sales figures each day. She is experiencing supply problems in her quest to satisfy her customers. She is requesting her first loan with Alidé to supply herself with new products in order to satisfy her customers better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 boxes of sugar, 6 boxes of couscous, 10 boxes of insecticide, and 2 sacks of flour

loans.name: Brigitte

texts.fr: Née vers 1957 à Takon-Dra un village situé dans le département de l'OUEME au Sud du BENIN, dame H. Brigitte est mariée à monsieur VITOU Samuel et a à sa charge sept enfants. D'une grande expérience dans la commercialisation des bois de construction, elle éprouve actuellement l'envie d'expérimenter la vente de bois de teck. Le teck est un grand arbre d'origine asiatique fournissant un bois très dur et bien apprécié dans la construction. Elle sollicite donc ce crédit pour élargir son champ d'activités.
texts.en:
Born about 1957 in Takon-Dra, a village located in the county of OUEME in the south of Benin, Ms. Brigitte H. is married to Mr. Samuel VITOU. She has seven children in her care. With a great deal of experience in marketing lumber, she presently has a desire to try selling teak wood. Teak is a large tree of Asian origin providing a wood that is very hard and highly valued in construction. She is therefore requesting a loan to widen her field of business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 50 pieces of teak wood

loans.name: Genaro Carlos

texts.es:
Genaro’s entire family works in the clothing business, generally making different types of garments depending on the season. His wife sells these clothes at the markets that are held in the cities of La Paz, Oruro, Potosi and Chuquisaca. Most of his clients have been working with him for a long time (since 2004) and he has never had a problem making his loan payments on time, although recently he has had to deal with the loss of a family member.

Translated by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Staff

Toda la familia de Don Genaro trabaja en la confeccion de ropa de temporada, la esposa se dedica a la venta de ésta en las diferentes ferias que se realizan en las ciudades de La Paz, Oruro, Potosi y Chuquisaca. Son clientes antiguos, desde el año 2.004 y nunca tuvieron ningun tropiezo en cancelar sus cuotas, pese a que ultimamente tuvieron la perdida de un familiar.

loans.use: Increase the amount of working capital / Incremento de capital

loans.name: Emilienne

texts.fr: Dame H. Emilienne est née le 20 Décembre 1964 à Houéyogbé dans le département de l'OUEME au BENIN. D'ethnie XWLA, elle est mariée à monsieur ADAM Mathurin, agent comptable dans une société de Cotonou. Elle vend dans son quartier repas prêt à manger tels que de la pâte faite à base de farine de maïs et du riz au gras près d'un gros magasins de stockage de ferraille. Compte tenu de l'exigence de sa clientèle composée pour la grande majorité de chargeurs, elle compte varier son offre. Elle vient solliciter son troisième prêt pour répondre aux attentes de ses clients.
texts.en:
Mrs. Emilienne H. was born on December 29, 1964 in Houéyogbé in the department of OUEME in BENIN. She is an ethnic XWLA and is married to Mr.Mathurin ADAM, an accountant in a company in Cotonou. She sells ready to eat meals, such as a paste made with corn flour and fatty rice. She is located in her neighborhood, near a large scrap metal store. Recognising her highly demanding customers, who are for the most part loaders, she is hoping to vary her offerings. She is requesting her third loan to fulfill the expectations of her clients.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one bag of manioc, one bag of rice and half a bag of varied seasonings.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Née le 25  septembre 1957 à Grand-Popo dans les départements du Mono-Couffo, dame K. Julienne est mariée et mère de sept (07) enfants dont deux (02) sont encore à sa charge: Tobi et Junior respectivement âgés de 15 ans et de 12 ans et en classe de 5ème au cours secondaire et de CM2 au cours primaire. Elle dispose d'une cafétéria géographiquement bien située qu'elle gère elle même. En vue de répondre à la demande de sa clientèle afin de satisfaire celle-ci en boissons fraîches, elle a sollicité ce crédit pour acheter un réfrigérateur et des boissons.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julienne K. was born on September 25, 1957 in the department of Mono-Couffo. She is married and the mother of seven (07) children, she is still supporting two (02) of them: Tobi, 15, in 7th grade in middle school and Junior, 12, in 5th grade primary school. She has a cafeteria situated in a good location that she manages herself. In order to meet the needs of her customers and to supply them with fresh beverages, she is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator and beverages.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a refrigerator and of 10 beverage racks

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr: Née à Cotonou le 11 Janvier 1969 au sud du BENIN et d'ethnie Goun, dame L. Marcelline est mariée à monsieur BAKARI Mamadou, peintre automobile de profession et exerçant à Cotonou. Elle voyage régulièrement sur le GHANA, un pays de la sous région pour l'achat des ustensiles de cuisine, de plastiques, de glacières et de tissus qu'elle livre au détaillant à Cotonou. Il s'agit pour elle d'une activité bien rentable mais nécessitant beaucoup de moyens financiers. Elle vient demander ce prêt pour renforcer son fonds de roulement afin de satisfaire au mieux ses clients.
texts.en:
Born on January 11, 1969 in Cotonou, southern Benin, Mrs. Marcelline L. is from the Goun ethnic group and is married to Mr. Mamadou Bakari, a car painter by trade who works in Cotonou. She travels regularly to Ghana, a country in the West African sub-region, to buy cooking utensils, plastic containers, iceboxes and cloth, which she supplies to retailers in Cotonou. This is a very profitable business for her but requires considerable financial resources. She is requesting this loan in order to strengthen her working capital so that she can best satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 iceboxes, 3 dozen saucepans, 2 dozen plastic buckets and 15 pieces of cloth.

loans.name: Chakiratou

texts.fr: Dame O. Chakiratou est née le 28 novembre 1981 à Sakété dans le département du Plateau. Elle est célibataire sans enfants. Elle est revendeuse de sacs de riz , de plateaux d'œufs frais et de divers produits de consommation courante. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, elle a décidé de faire recourir à ALIDé pour se faire financer afin d'élargir sa gamme d'activité à d'autres secteurs porteurs de richesse.
texts.en:
Mrs. Chakiratou O. was born on November 28, 1981 in Sakété, in the department of Plateau. She is single and has no children. She sells bags of rice, trays of fresh eggs, and a variety of staples. To satisfy her ever-growing clientele, she decided to turn to Alidé for financing in order to extend her business activity into other profitable sectors.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 8 bags of rice and 30 trays of eggs.

loans.name: Estelle

texts.fr: De nationalité togolaise, dame S. Estelle est née le 10 Juillet 1967 à Accra au GHANA. Mariée à Monsieur KPOSSI Fiacre et ayant cinq (05) enfants à charge dont deux scolarisés, elle réside au BENIN depuis 2001 à Akpakpa-Dodomey, un bidonville de Cotonou. Ayant acquis déjà deux années d'expérience dans la vente de friperies, elle lave les vêtements de friperie qui constituent ses marchandises, les parfume puis les repasse avant de les exposer pour la vente. Elle est aidé par l'un de ses enfants dans la vente. Dame S. Estelle sollicite son quatrième crédit à ALIDé pour accroître son volume d'activité.
texts.en:
Presently Togolese, Mrs. Estelle S. was born on July 10, 1967 in Accra, Ghana. Married to Mr. Fiacre Kpossi and the mother of 5 children who are all still in her care and enrolled in school, she has been living in Benin since 2001 in Akpakpa-Dodomey, a slum area in Cotonou. Having already acquired two years of experience in the sale of used clothes, she washes the used clothing that constitutes her merchandise, perfumes the clothing, and irons it, then displays it for sale. She is helped in the sale of it by one of her children. Mrs. Estelle S. is requesting her fourth loan from Alidé in order to increase her turnover.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of two bales of used clothing

loans.name: Liliane

texts.fr: Dame S. Liliane est née le 14 mai 1978 à Ekpè dans le département de l'Ouémé au sud-est du Bénin. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants: Corneille et Fabienne âgés respectivement de 5 ans et de 2ans. Elle fournit divers produits de ménage à ses voisins de quartiers avec qui elle a un contrat de confiance parce que ses produits sont de bonne qualité. Elle demande ce prêt pour renforcer son activité qui est en pleine croissance.
texts.en:
Mrs. Liliane S. was born on May 14, 1978 in Ekpè in Ouémé County in the southeast of Benin. She is married and the mother of 2 children: Corneille and Fabienne, aged 5 and 2 respectively. She furnishes various household items to her neighbors in the district who have confidence in her because her products are of good quality. She is requesting this loan to bolster her business which is currently growing rapidly.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 10 cases of tinned goods

loans.name: Mouniatou

texts.fr: Dame Y. Mouniatou est née vers les années 1972 à ANEHO, au Sud du TOGO. Elle réside au Bénin depuis une dizaine d'année. Elle a à sa charge trois enfants dont Afi la benjamine âgée de 9 ans est scolarisée. Mariée à monsieur ABOU Adjanakou, un gardien de nuit exerçant à Cotonou, dame Y. Mouniatou vend du riz dans un coin de rue de son quartier. Elle sollicite ce crédit afin d'offrir à ses clients plusieurs variétés de mets.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mouniatou Y. was born around 1972 in Aneho, in the south of Togo. She has been living in Benin for about 10 years. She is responsible for 3 children, of whom Afi, the youngest, age 9, is in school. Married to Mr. Adjanakou Abou, a night-time guard working in Cotonou, Mrs. Y. sells rice on a street corner in her neighborhood. She is requesting this loan in order to offer her customers a more varied selection of dishes.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a half-sack of rice, a sack of dried beans, 1/2 basket of condiments, 1/2 case of spaghetti, and a half case of frozen fish

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Dame Z. Christine est née vers 1967 à Cotonou au sud BENIN. Mariée à monsieur BOKO Hyacinthe, un militaire à la retraite, elle a quatre enfants dont un seul est à sa charge. Elle vend en son domicile des poissons frits et fumés. Compte tenu de l'augmentation du nombre de clients elle a commencé par éprouver des difficultés financières. Elle sollicite donc ce deuxième crédit afin de mieux répondre aux attentes de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Ms. Christine Z. was born around 1967 in Cotonou, in the south of BENIN. Married to Mr. Hyacinthe BOKO, who is retired from the military, she has four children, one of whom is in her care. She sells fried and smoked fish out of her home. Given the increase in the number of customers, she began experiencing financial difficulties. She is therefore requesting this second loan in order to respond better to the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 drums of vegetable oil, 10 piles of firewood, and a half sack of charcoal

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
Maria Eugenia is 22 years old and is single. She lives in the neighborhood Unidad de Propósito. She still doesn't have children, and her dream, like most women, is to be able to form her own family one day. Maria Eugenia works in a bank in Managua, and has become a cashier. Before she began this job, she began a business selling shoes, with capital supplied by her parents. At the moment she only sells shoes, but her plans are to have a store where she can offer a variety of products. This loan would be used to buy a variety of shoes in order to improve what she can offer her clients, and this will also allow her to attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria Eugenia tiene 22 años, es soltera, habita en el barrio Unidad de Propósito. Todavía no tiene hijos y su sueño como la mayoría de las mujeres es poder formar algún día una familia. Maria Eugenia trabaja en un banco de Managua, desempeñándose como cajera, pero antes de empezar este trabajo empezó el negocio de la venta de zapatos, con capital otorgado por sus padres. En estos momentos sólo vende zapatos pero sus planes son llegar a poner una tienda donde pueda ofrecer variedad de productos. El préstamo será usado para la compra de variedad de zapatos para poder aumentar la oferta hacia sus clientes, y con esto también poder atraer más clientela.

loans.use: To buy a variety of shoes to improve her business

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es:
Freddy is 34 years old and he and his life's companion have a small bakery. They have worked at this for the past 14 years, and began with their own money. One of the difficulties that has most impacted them is the constant increase in flour, which has obligated them to raise prices. Freddy's plan is to enlarge the bakery, and for this he would use this loan to buy raw materials in order to create more products. Freddy has 3 children of 4, 8, and 10 years of age, whom he hopes to be able to educate to become people of good society. Freddy's bakery is known in the neighborhood Villa Libertad as a bakery that offers excellent products, and because of this it is much enjoyed by everyone nearby.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Freddy tiene 34 años de edad y junto a su compañera de vida tienen una pequeña panadería. Tienen 14 años de dedicarse a esta actividad que iniciaron con fondos propios, una de las dificultades que más les ha afectado es el aumento constante de la harina, lo que les obliga a subir los precios. El plan que Freddy tiene es poder ampliar la panadería, por eso el uso del crédito será para comprar materia prima para elaborar más productos. Freddy tiene 3 hijos de 4, 8 y 10 años de edad, a los que espera poder educarlos para hacerlos personas de bien a la sociedad. La Panadería de Freddy se ha destacado en su barrio Villa Libertad como una panadería que ofrece excelentes productos, y por eso es muy gustada por todos sus vecinos.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for a bakery

loans.name: Raquel Armanda

texts.es:
Raquel has worked selling vegetables at the Municipal Market of Santiago Sacatepquez for more than 13 years. She is considered a very responsible women and a hard worker. She applied for this loan in order to buy more vegetables, taking advantage of the season and, in this manner, increasing her income and profits. She would also like to have a greater variety of products which will also help her to earn more. Her greatest desire is to provide for the education of her children. Raquel has two children, one that is 13 years old and one that is 16, who are currently in school. She separated from her husband three years ago and does not receive any economic support from him. Raquel is the only person that is providing income for her family.

Translated by Daniel Kahn, Kiva Staff

Raquel ha trabajado en la venta de verduras en el Mercado Municipal de Santiago Sacatepquez por más de 13 años. Es considerada como una mujer muy responsable y tabajadora. Este préstamo lo ha solicitado por que quiere comprar más verduras, aprovechando que ahora es muy buena época para hacerlo, y de esta manera tendrá mejores ingresos y ganancias. Quiere tener también mas variedad de productos, esto le ayudará a ganar más. Su mayor deseo es sacar adelante los estudios de sus hijos, tiene dos hijos, uno de 13 años y el otro de 16, los dos están estudiando actualmente. Ella se separó de su esposo hace 3 años, y no cuenta con ayuda económica de él, Ella es la única que lleva los ingresos económicos de su familia.

loans.use: Increase variety and quantity of vegetables that she sells / Comprar mas cantidad y variedad de verduras para su venta.

loans.name: Eufemio

texts.es:
Don Eufemio is 46 years old. He lives in the neighborhood Laureles Sur. He is married and his wife is a domestic employee and helps with the expenses of the household. He has 3 children, 15, 13, and 10 years old. Since he was very young, he worked as a bricklayer, an activity that has served to support his family. He has come to realize with much pleasure that after many years of working as a bricklayer he has come to love his work. Don Eufemio is asking for a loan in order to construct a wall in his house, and therefore be able to give better security to his home and to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Eufemio tiene 46 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y su esposa es empleada doméstica y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Tiene 3 hijos de 15, 13 y 10 años de edad. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la labor de albañil, actividad que le ha servido para el sustento de su familia, y que él mismo cuenta realiza con mucho gusto porque ya son muchos años trabajando de albañil que le ha tomado amor a su trabajo. Don Eufemio está solicitando el préstamo para construir una pared en su vivienda, y así poder darle mayor seguridad a su vivienda y a su familia.

loans.use: To build a home on the west side of his house

loans.name: Elieser

texts.es:
Elieser is a single father of 2 children of 5 and 10 years old. He has had a paper store in his home for the past 3 years, and this has enabled him to improve the lives of his children. He lives in the neighborhood Laureles Sur, where he daily serves his neighbors. As a single father, Elieser's dream is to have the power to replace the mother's love that his children don't have, to educate them, and above all to teach them good habits. Elieser has improved his house little by little, and this time with the loan he is asking for he will build a wall in his home, in order to continue with his plans to see his home completely finished.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Elieser es un padre soltero de 2 niños de 5 y 10 años de edad, tiene 3 años de tener una pulpería en su vivienda lo que le ha permitido sacar adelante a sus hijos. Habita en el barrio Laureles Sur donde atiende diariamente a sus vecinos. Como padre soltero el sueño de Elieser es poder sustituir el amor de madre que no tienen sus hijos, educarlos y sobre todo enseñarles buenos hábitos. Elieser ha venido mejorando su casa poco a poco, y ésta vez con el crédito solicitado levantará una pared en su vivienda, para seguir con sus planes de ver terminada en su totalidad su vivienda.

loans.use: To build a wall on the southeast side of his house

loans.name: Leydi

texts.es:
Doña Leydi is 30 years old. She lives in the shire Sabana Grande. She is married and she has 2 young children. Her husband is an automotive mechanic and contributes the expenses of the household. Doña Leydi sells cosmetics and has 4 years of experience. She began with loans from Avon. With the the money that she is asking for, she will buy more beauty products, clothes, and shoes, in order to offer her clients variety and in this manner attract more clients. In the future she wants to continue growing and diversifying her products, and in this manner enable her childrens' studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Leydi tiene 30 años de edad, habita en la comarca Sabana Grande, es casada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad, su esposo es mecánico automotriz y aporta a los gastos del hogar. Doña Leydi vende cosmético y tiene cuatro años de experiencia, ella inició con créditos en la Avon. Con el dinero que está solicitando es para comprar mas productos de cosméticos ropa y zapatos, para ofrecer a sus clientes variedades y así lograr captación de más clientes A futuro es poder seguir creciendo y diversificando los productos, así como brindar estudios a sus hijos.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Xiomara Indiana

texts.es:
Xiomara L. lives in a neighborhood called La Luz de Managua. She is 57 years old, and is married. Just like her, her husband is in business, dedicating himself to the sale of automotive spare parts. She has 6 children, of whom all but one depend on her economically. She hopes to always have work in order to help her son in his studies. Xiomara works selling clothing, shoes cosmetics, and at the moment she is beginning to work alongside her husband to sell auto parts. She has been in business for 8 years and several times has has hard times with the businesses that she has experimented with. She needs this loan in order to buy childrens' clothing that she currently has very little inventory of.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Xiomara L. habita en el barrio La Luz de Managua, tiene 57 años, es casada su esposo al igual que ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de repuestos automotrices. Tiene 6 hijos de los cuales solamente uno depende económicamente de ella, y espera tener siempre trabajo para seguir apoyando a su hijo en los estudios. Xiomara se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticas, y actualmente está incursionando junto a su marido en la venta de repuestos para vehículo, tiene 8 años de ser comerciantes y algunas veces le ha tocado duro debido a las ventas bajas que ha experimentado. Requiere del préstamo para la compra de ropa para niños, ya que en este momento dispone de poco inventario de éste producto.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing for children

loans.name: Anastacio De Jesus

texts.es:
Anastacio makes a living working arduously in the Israel Lewites market in Managua selling milk products and derivatives. He is known for being a hard-working person who has been able to provide for his family and put food on the table. His efforts are supported by loans from Kiva partner Ceprodel, which he has invested directly into the milk products he offers. Currently his biggest need is to acquire capital for his business, which is why he is turning again to Ceprodel for support in purchasing the products he most needs.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein

En el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua el señor Anastacio M. se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio de venta de productos lacteos o derivados de la leche. Se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabnajadora que ha logrado mantener su familia y llevado el sustento a su mesa.

Para ello el se ha respaldado de los creditos otorgados por Ceprodel el cual los ha invertido directamente en la compra de sus productos lacteos para ofrecerlos. Hoy en dia su mayor necesidad es adquirir lo mas pronto posible el recurso economico para continuar con su negocio y esta es la razon por la que ha buscado una vez mas el aopyo en Ceprodel para adquirir sus productos que le son de suma necesidad.

loans.use: Purchase milk products to sell / Compra de los productos lacteos

loans.name: Norma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mrs. Norma Vivas sells pastries and sodas in her own stand in the Israel Lewites market in the city of Managua. She has two school-aged children, and that is why she works very hard in order to cover all their needs. She has come to Ceprodel in order to obtain a loan that will allow her to buy pastries and sodas so that she can later on sell them and keep on supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

En le mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Norma Vivas se dedica a la venta de reposterias y refrescos los cuales los oferta a sus clientes en su propio tramo en el mercado. Es madre de dos hijos en edad escolar y por este motivo se esfuerza mayormente para suplir sus necesidades.

Hoy en dia ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el proposito de obtener un credito que le permita la compra de las reposterias y las gaseosas para su respectiva comercializacion y asi salir adelante en el mantenimiento de su hogar.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (pastries and sodas) for her business.

loans.name: Ana Cecilia

texts.es:
Ana is a woman who dedicates herself to selling foods like baked good, coffee and snacks at a post in the Israel Lewites market in the city of Managua. Since she started her business with few products, she has been able to make do and at times has been the means of support for her household. Over time she has been able to increase her selection and has improved her quality of life thanks to the support of loans from Kiva partner Ceprodel. Once again she is requesting a loan to purchase her products. She is very confident that her request will be fulfilled and she will be able to continue providing for her household.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva volunteer

La señora Ana Cecilaia P. es una dama que se dedica al negocio de venta de comestibles como reposterias, café y golosinas estando ubicada en el mercado Israel Lewites de la ciudad de Managua.

Desde que inició su negocio con pocos productos ha logrado mantenerse y a la vez ha sido el sustento de su hogar de habitacion. Hoy en dia a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido ha aumentado su mercaderia y ha mejorado su nivel de vida gracias al poyo brindado por Ceprodel opr medio de los creditos que se le han birndado. Una vez mas solicita el credito para la compra de sus productos, ella está muy confiada que su credito le será otorgado y asi continuara con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitacion.

loans.use: Purchase products for her business / Compra de los productos

loans.name: Dominga Clementina

texts.es:
Mrs. Dominga lives in the neighborhood of Villa Reconciliacion in Managua. She is 50 years old and married. Her husband sells cattle, and he spends most of his time on the road. They have three children, all of whom are independent. Mrs. Dominga has a neighborhood store in her own home, and in occasions she also sews. She has been working in her business for the past three years, and she has worked very hard in order to keep it afloat. Mrs. Dominga wishes to improve her quality of life through her business, and that is why she is requesting a loan with which she will buy basic home products in order to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Dominga habita en el barrio Villa Reconciliación de Managua. Tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, su esposo se dedica a la comercialización de ganado, la mayor parte la pasa fuera de su vivienda. Tienen 3 hijos que ya son independientes a ella. Doña Dominga tiene una pulpería en su vivienda, y en ocasiones se dedica a la costura, tiene 3 años de estar en este negocio, por lo que ha trabajado fuertemente para poder mantenerlo y salir adelante. Doña Dominga desea mejorar su nivel de vida y esto espera lograrlo a través del negocio, es por eso que está solicitando el crédito, para la compra de productos básicos para el hogar y así seguir adelante con el crecimiento de la pulpería.

loans.use: To buy basic home  products for her business.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Mrs Teresa is 49 years old and she is married. Her husband is a merchant, he sells basic grains at one of the markets at the capital city. They live in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She has three children, one is already independent, he is married, and the other two are in middle school. Teresa is a seamstress, she makes and sells clothes. She has been doing this work from a very young age. It’s been 31 years since she started sewing and she has a large clientele since she does a fine job and she is very dedicated to satisfy her clients. The requested loan will be use in both businesses. Her husband will buy more basic grains, and she will buy more raw materials for her dressmaking.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Teresa tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, su esposo es comerciante, él vende granos básicos en un mercado de la capital, y está pendiente de su familia, ella vive en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, tiene tres hijos, uno es ya independiente, ya se casó, y dos que están estudiando en la secundaria. El trabajo que hace la Sra. Teresa es de costura, confecciona y vende la ropa, desde muy joven se ha dedicado a trabajar, son treinta y un años que tiene de estar cociendo y tiene mucha clientela ya que trabaja fino y con dedicación para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos. Con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para invertir en los dos negocio el de su esposo que es para comprar más granos básicos así como compra de materia prima para su costura.

loans.use: Buy raw materials for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Lucianitas Santa Lucia Group 1

texts.en:
Santa Lucia is a small village with an interesting setting. Not like most villages, the church and the community centre are situated on the same square. They are a bit apart from each other which creates two important squares and gives Santa Lucia a stretched look. This is all surrounded by steep hills on which all the houses are built in a very picturesque way. This is a very pleasant town and even when it is pouring down rain and the streets have changed into little rivers, the streets are still full of people.

The women tell me they all grew up here and for that reason, they know each other very well. Most of the women have been working on their beautiful embroideries since they were very young, as the president of the group tells me. She sells her blouses to her friends and family and some of the women present are wearing her blouses today. She and three others also sew skirts.

They sell most of their goods in Sololá which is the nearest city, about one hour away. The market days there are the best day to have good business, says Paulina. Brigida travels to a town called Godines. This is a town with an crossroads where you can go to several places and because of that, many people pass by. That's why she decided to travel the 2 hours a couple of times a week to sell her goods.

Genara tells me she went to school for four years only, and she started helping her parents from then on. It is her wish to see her children who are at university now get a degree so they have more choices in what their occupation could be. Having her business means having the means to support her children in their journey to become the professionals she was not able to become. These women are struggling for a noble cause; let's support them in their struggle.

loans.use: buy better fabric and tools for embroidery

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
The community of Pampa Cruz is located approximately 30 minutes from the district of Cangallo. Approximately 30 families live in the community, and they harvest grains such as wheat, barley, and corn, and vegetables such as peas and potatoes. This community only maximizes their land once a year because they do not have an irrigation canal that can support continual farming.

Maria H. buys various types of grains and vegetables and takes them to Ayacucho. She also has a general store where she sells groceries. Maria takes advantage of the community markets and/or annexes so that more people buy her products. She wants to improve her business in order to giver her children, who study in Cangallo, a better education and to buy them a little house. Maria says that she learned how to save through her small bank. She also values herself as a woman and understands her husband and children better.

Lorenza C. buys and sells animals. She also stocks groceries that she uses for bartering purposes. Lorenza ultimately would like to have a small grocery store as she gets older. Now that she is in FINCA Peru, she is very enthusiastic because she knows that they will train her near other businesses. Lorenza is very anxious to learn more. She only asks God to give her the health and life to keep on working.

Anna H. buys and sells animals at the community annex and sells wheat products. She does the most business in her community. Her dream is to buy a house in Ayacucho to live with her children. At her communal bank, she learned to respect herself, and she knows that she has the same abilities as the me

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva volunteer.

L. comunidad D. Pampa Cruz, esta ubicada aproximadamente a unos 30 minutos del distrito D.
